original: 'on te trid kyi rkyen gyis brjod pa'i dngos po skyes bu'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rdzas bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir gcig la sogs par mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te trid kyi rkyen gyis brjod pa'i dngos po skyes bu'i byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rdzas bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir gcig la sogs par mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di bsu ba ni /
translated: But if the thing expressed by the condition of the verb, which has the nature of the activity of the person, is understood in the same way as the substance, then it is not contradictory to say that there is one, etc.üîΩTo anticipate this qualm, he says,

original: 'on te byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if the agent, etc.‚Äù

original: sun 'byin pa ni ma 'brel pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni ma 'brel pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is, ‚ÄúIt would be a great non sequitur.‚Äù

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: lhas byin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag 'dir ro //
analyzed: lhas byin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag 'dir ro //
translated: In this statement, ‚ÄúDevadatta, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, etc.‚Äù

original: re lde la sogs pa'i las gcig pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: re lde la sogs pa'i las gcig pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the activity of the fence, etc. is one,

original: bya ba gcig nyid dang / de bzhin du byed pa po tha dad pas na tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba gcig nyid dang / de bzhin du byed pa po tha dad pas na tha dad par 'gyur ro //

original: ci ltar bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig gis mang po'i tshig tu'o //
analyzed: ci ltar bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshig gis mang po'i tshig tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow would the activity be?‚Äù The singular is used for the plural.

original: gzhan gyis lan gdab pa'i phyir @251a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis lan gdab pa'i phyir @251a * //
translated: In order to respond to this, the other says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //

original: gal te khams kyi don nges sbyor gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te khams kyi don nges sbyor gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: byed pa po'i tha dad pas tha dad par rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not reasonable that it is different because of the difference of the agent?

original: khams kyi don de yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: khams kyi don de yang zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat meaning of the element, etc.‚Äù

original: rkyen gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ling nga la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ling nga la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the meaning of the condition‚Äù means because the meaning of the condition is the sprout, etc.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor med de yang ngo // de ni zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor med de yang ngo // de ni zhes bya ba ni nges par sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the connection. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means the condition.

original: 'on ni ci ltar re lde gyis shig ces bya ba gnyis kyi tshig tu 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'on ni ci ltar re lde gyis shig ces bya ba gnyis kyi tshig tu 'gyur ba /
translated: ‚ÄúBut how is it that the two words ‚Äòmake‚Äô and ‚Äòfence‚Äô are used?‚Äù

analyzed: de bzhin du lhas byin dang mchod sbyin dag gis re lde byed do zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: khams kyi don yan 'gar ba ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: khams kyi don yan 'gar ba ni zhes smras so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the element is not a separate word.‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù is the refutation.

original: 'brel phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the connection‚Äù means because of the connection with the agent.

original: der 'gyur tha dad na zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor tha dad na'o //
analyzed: der 'gyur tha dad na zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor tha dad na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there were a difference in the state‚Äù means if there were a difference in the connection.

original: der 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
analyzed: der 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni tha dad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be so‚Äù means it would be different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat also.‚Äù

original: khams kyi don de yang ngo //
analyzed: khams kyi don de yang ngo //
translated: That also is the meaning of the element.

original: de tha dad bas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po tha dad pas so //üîΩrang gi 'dod pas gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de tha dad bas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po tha dad pas so // rang gi 'dod pas gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the difference in that‚Äù means because of the difference in the agent.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na zhes bya ba ba'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na zhes bya ba ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAccording to our view,‚Äù in order to set forth the treatise according to his own opinion.

original: las dang byed pa po las zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i lnga pa'o //
analyzed: las dang byed pa po las zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i lnga pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe action, the agent, and the object‚Äù is a genitive tatpurusa compound.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the action.

original: gang gi tshe brjod pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: gang gi tshe brjod pa zhes bya ba ni byed pa po zhes 'brel te //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is said‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúthe agent.‚Äù

original: dang po nyid kyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid kyi don yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the meaning of the first‚Äù means because of the meaning of mere nature.

original: phyogs gnyis ka la yang rim gyis sbyor ba gnyis ston par byed pa ni bdag nyid chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka la yang rim gyis sbyor ba gnyis ston par byed pa ni bdag nyid chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great being shows the two kinds of application, in order, in the words beginning with ‚Äúwhen.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: The two verses beginning with ‚Äúwhen‚Äù are the summary verses.

original: las zhes bya ba ni yi ge las so //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni yi ge las so //
translated: The word ‚Äúaction‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom the letters.‚Äù

original: de ltar sgra'i byed pa'i sgom pa dpyad nas don gyi byed pa'i sgom pa dpyad pa'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgra'i byed pa'i sgom pa dpyad nas don gyi byed pa'i sgom pa dpyad pa'i phyir gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having analyzed the meditation on the function of sound in this way, in order to analyze the meditation on the function of meaning, he says, ‚Äúwhen,‚Äù and so on.

original: las kyi sgra ni ni bha ba'i don yin la zhes bya ba'i mdo 'dir ri khrod rjes rang gis bshad par bha ba na bha ba ste skul ba'i rkyen to zhes bshad do //
analyzed: las kyi sgra ni ni bha ba'i don yin la zhes bya ba'i mdo 'dir ri khrod rjes rang gis bshad par bha ba na bha ba ste skul ba'i rkyen to zhes bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúaction‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúfrom.‚Äù In this s≈´tra, the sage himself explains, ‚ÄúbhavanƒÅ means bhavana, which is the condition of instigation.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin dang de ni sgom pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i sgras brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de ni sgom pa nyid yin la zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i sgras brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is meditation itself, and it is expressed by the word ‚Äúmeditation.‚Äù This is the meaning.

original: gal te de ltar na bdag @251b des par sbyor ro snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na bdag @251b des par sbyor ro snyam pa'i rtogs pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, isn‚Äôt there no realization of the thought ‚ÄúI am applying myself‚Äù?

original: de ji ltar na sgom pa nyid byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na sgom pa nyid byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that meditation itself is the meaning of a sentence?

original: bshad pa ni de'i tshe nges par sbyar ba ni de'i lhag ma'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir de gtsor gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa ni de'i tshe nges par sbyar ba ni de'i lhag ma'i phyir zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir de gtsor gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: The explanation is: at that time, the application is not the primary factor because it is a qualifier of the remainder.

original: gtsor gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni ngag gi don nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gtsor gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ni ngag gi don nyid ma yin no //
translated: And because it is not the primary factor, it is not the meaning of the sentence.

original: de bzhin du nges sbyor ngag gi don du byed pa'i tshe yang nges sbyor nyid gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nges sbyor ngag gi don du byed pa'i tshe yang nges sbyor nyid gtso bo yin la /
translated: Similarly, when application is taken to be the meaning of the sentence, application itself is primary.

original: rgol ba ni khyad par yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ni khyad par yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: And the objection is a qualifier. This should be understood.

original: gal te nges sbyor gyi khyad par can gyi sgom pa ngag gi don yin mod /
analyzed: gal te nges sbyor gyi khyad par can gyi sgom pa ngag gi don yin mod /
translated: If meditation, qualified by application, is the meaning of the sentence,

original: gdon mi za bar 'jug pa go ci lta zhe na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'jug pa go ci lta zhe na /
translated: why is the inevitable engagement also mentioned?

original: sgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the question.üîΩWhen one understands in this way,

original: de ltar rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor gyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa na'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni nges sbyor gyi khyad par can nyid du rtogs pa na'o //
translated: that is, when one understands that it is qualified by application,

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni mi 'jug par yang ci ltar 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni mi 'jug par yang ci ltar 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
translated: this is clarified by the question, how could it be that it does not engage?

original: de ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: sems sam zhes bya ba'i bar ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: sems sam zhes bya ba'i bar ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation up to ‚Äúmind.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar min zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar min zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If it is not so, this is introducing the opponent‚Äôs doubt.

original: mtho ris 'dod pa zhes 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir na 'bras bu med par zhes ci ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pa zhes 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir na 'bras bu med par zhes ci ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not so, then why is it said that ‚Äúthe result is not obtained‚Äù for the sake of obtaining heaven?

original: sun 'byin pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ga las rtogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ga las rtogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is ‚ÄúHow is it known that it has a result?‚Äù

original: gal te 'di ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: If it is so, then this is the explanation beginning with ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin yang dan med pa nyid bzlog par dka' ba nyid kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bstan zin to zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin yang dan med pa nyid bzlog par dka' ba nyid kyi sgo nas so //
translated: It has been shown that even though it is not created by a person, it is difficult to refute its lack of authority.

original: bsgom pa khas blangs nas sun dbyung ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa khas blangs nas sun dbyung ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Having accepted meditation, the refutation is stated.

original: da ni de nyid med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de nyid med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show that it does not exist,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said ‚ÄúMoreover.‚Äù

original: mchod sbyin don tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yod ma zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mchod sbyin don tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa yod ma zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe meaning of sacrifice and giving is different‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúif you think that . . . .‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to meditation.

original: 'tshed byed ces bya ba nas tha dad par rtogs na zhes bya ba'i bar ni gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: 'tshed byed ces bya ba nas tha dad par rtogs na zhes bya ba'i bar ni gzhan gyi ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you think that . . . sacrifice and giving are different‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: tshod pa dang mchod sbyin dag ni las nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshod pa dang mchod sbyin dag ni las nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because sacrifice and giving are presented as actions.

original: byed do zhes bya ba 'dir bya ba tha dad pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba 'dir bya ba tha dad pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúyou do‚Äù indicates that a different action is perceived.

original: gtan tshigs des na ma dmigs par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na ma dmigs par ma grub po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi //
translated: The reason is that the nonperception of a difference is not established.

original: lan du de ltar yin na thug pa med do zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bos sgom pa dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa 'dod pa de'i phyir spyi @252a * //
analyzed: lan du de ltar yin na thug pa med do zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bos sgom pa dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa 'dod pa de'i phyir spyi @252a * //
translated: The response to this is that if this were so, there would be an infinite regress.

original: dang khyad par gzhan dang gzhan du 'gro bas thug pa med do //
analyzed: dang khyad par gzhan dang gzhan du 'gro bas thug pa med do //
translated: Because you maintain that meditation, sacrifice, and so on are established by the nature of universals and particulars, therefore, because universals and particulars are different from each other, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de nyid ston pa ni mchod sbyin byed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni mchod sbyin byed pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúthe performance of sacrifice,‚Äù etc.

original: don 'di yin te te dper mchod do zhes bya ba 'dir mchod byed do zhes bya ba 'phangs pa de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi yul can gyi rang gi bya ba skyed do zhes shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don 'di yin te te dper mchod do zhes bya ba 'dir mchod byed do zhes bya ba 'phangs pa de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi yul can gyi rang gi bya ba skyed do zhes shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning is this: Just as in the statement ‚Äúhe sacrifices,‚Äù the meaning of the suffix is implied, namely, ‚Äúhe performs the act of sacrificing,‚Äù in the same way, the meaning of the suffix in ‚Äúthe performance of sacrifice‚Äù is implied, namely, ‚Äúthe act of producing the performance of sacrifice.‚Äù

original: des na mchod sbyin gyi yul can rang gi byas pa las skyes ba nyid gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mchod sbyin gyi yul can rang gi byas pa las skyes ba nyid gzhan yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the performance of sacrifice would be something other than that which is produced by its own action.

original: de bzhin du mchod sbyin skyed par sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba 'dir yang gal te yang mchod sbyin skyed par bsgrub par bya'o zhes brjod par 'dod na yang gzhan 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchod sbyin skyed par sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba 'dir yang gal te yang mchod sbyin skyed par bsgrub par bya'o zhes brjod par 'dod na yang gzhan 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in the statement ‚Äúhe establishes the performance of sacrifice,‚Äù if it is claimed that ‚Äúthe performance of sacrifice is to be established,‚Äù then again something else would be implied.

original: de ltar gcig nas gcig brgyud pa ni mngon sum la snang ba yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar gcig nas gcig brgyud pa ni mngon sum la snang ba yang med do //
translated: Thus, there is no appearance of anything in perception that is passed down from one to another.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is for this reason that the passage beginning with ‚ÄúTherefore, these‚Äù is explained.

original: de'i phyir mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don las tha dad pa'i sgom pa'i 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs su mngon sum la mi snang ba la brten pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i don las tha dad pa'i sgom pa'i 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs su mngon sum la mi snang ba la brten pa na /
translated: Therefore, in the argument for the cessation of meditation that is different from the object of sacrifice, etc., the reason is based on the fact that it does not appear to direct perception.

original: de la ma grub pa med do //üîΩrnam par rtog pa tsam ni sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de la ma grub pa med do // rnam par rtog pa tsam ni sgrub pa'am /
translated: And there is no nonestablishment of that reason.üîΩFor mere conceptualization does not have the power to establish or to refute.

original: 'gog pa la nus pa yod pha ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa la nus pa yod pha ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: thug pa med par mi 'gyur du bcug kyang /
analyzed: thug pa med par mi 'gyur du bcug kyang /
translated: Even if one allows that there is no infinite regress,

original: tha mi dad pa las yang tha dad par sgro btags nas tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ngo zhes bshad pa ni 'chi ka'i lus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa las yang tha dad par sgro btags nas tha snyad du byed pa ni mthong ngo zhes bshad pa ni 'chi ka'i lus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one sees that, having superimposed difference on what is not different, one makes conventional distinctions.

original: lhug pas ni dpe yin na de bzhin zhes ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni don bstan to //
analyzed: lhug pas ni dpe yin na de bzhin zhes ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis ni don bstan to //
translated: The example is given in the verse beginning with ‚Äújust as,‚Äù and the meaning is taught in the first half of the verse beginning with ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid du ston pa ni byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the similarity is in the words ‚Äúthe agent.‚Äù

original: bram ze ni mchod sbyin la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mchod sbyin byed do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bram ze ni mchod sbyin la bya ba byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni mchod sbyin byed do zhes brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The words ‚Äúthe brahmin performs the sacrifice‚Äù express the performance of the sacrifice.

original: bya ba de log shig tu mthong ba ni med do //
analyzed: bya ba de log shig tu mthong ba ni med do //
translated: There is no seeing of the action as something different.

original: des na tha dad pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is merely a conventional designation of difference.

original: mtshon sbyin la bya ba gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshon sbyin la bya ba gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: The action is not different from the sacrifice.

original: 'o na mchod sbyin yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mchod sbyin yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the sacrifice?

original: mchod sbyin gyi ni bya ba yang zhes smos so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba yod ma yin zhes bya ba dang / ma yin zhes bya ba gnyi gar yang gzung ba'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi ni bya ba yang zhes smos so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba yod ma yin zhes bya ba dang / ma yin zhes bya ba gnyi gar yang gzung ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe action of the sacrifice‚Äù is mentioned in the statement ‚Äúthere is no seeing of the sacrifice as something different‚Äù and in the statement ‚Äúit is not the case that there is no seeing of the sacrifice as something different.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi bya ba gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi bya ba gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the action of the sacrifice not different?

original: lha sbyin nyid dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin nyid dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúDevadatta himself‚Äù is mentioned.

original: dbyug pa can bzhin du mchod sbyin dang ldan pa las mchod sbyin yin no zhes ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: dbyug pa can bzhin du mchod sbyin dang ldan pa las mchod sbyin yin no zhes ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that Devadatta is the sacrifice because he possesses the sacrifice, like a club-bearer,

original: @252b tha dad pa la mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @252b tha dad pa la mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is undermined by the nonobservation of difference.

original: autpal la sngon po bzhin du ldog pa tsam gyis byas pa'i tha dad pa la ba rten na /
analyzed: autpal la sngon po bzhin du ldog pa tsam gyis byas pa'i tha dad pa la ba rten na /
translated: If the difference of the action from the sacrifice is based on the mere difference that is the mere negation of the identity of the two, like the blueness of a lotus,

original: gcig nyid la gzhi mthun pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid la gzhi mthun pa rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: then the common locus of the two, identity and difference, is established in the case of oneness.

original: 'dir yang tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang tha dad pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Here, too, they are distinct.

original: 'di la mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di la mi dmigs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
translated: We have already explained that this is unacceptable, since it is contradicted by the fact that they are not perceived.

original: de'i phyir mchod sbyin ni khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i lha sbyin la sogs pa'i rdzas las tha dad pa ma yin par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod sbyin ni khyad par can gyi gnas skabs thob pa'i lha sbyin la sogs pa'i rdzas las tha dad pa ma yin par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should accept that the sacrifice is not distinct from the substance, such as Devadatta, who has attained a special condition.

original: de yang gang ci'i rang bzhin yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de yang gang ci'i rang bzhin yin yang rung ste /
translated: Moreover, whatever the nature of the agent,

original: byed pa de las tha dad pa ni med do zhes skabs nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa de las tha dad pa ni med do zhes skabs nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: it is not distinct from the action.

original: gzhan dag byed pa'i bya ba tha dad pa'i don du 'bad pa byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag byed pa'i bya ba tha dad pa'i don du 'bad pa byed pa ni /
translated: Others, in order to establish the distinctness of the action of the agent,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: argue as follows:üîΩIf Devadatta is the agent of cooking,

original: lha sbyin ci byed ces bya ba ni 'dra'i ba'o //
analyzed: lha sbyin ci byed ces bya ba ni 'dra'i ba'o //
translated: then what is he doing?

original: 'tshed do zhes bya la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: 'tshed do zhes bya la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: He is cooking.

original: 'dra'i ba dang lan 'di dag mthong ba'i phyir nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra'i ba dang lan 'di dag mthong ba'i phyir nges pa ste /
translated: Since we see this question and answer, it is certain that the agent is distinct from the action.

original: de yod pa na mchod sbyin la sogs pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir bya ba gzhan nyid du grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yod pa na mchod sbyin la sogs pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir bya ba gzhan nyid du grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Since there is doubt about sacrifice, etc. when that exists, it is established that they are different actions.

original: don 'di ni sangs rgyas pa yang 'dod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di ni sangs rgyas pa yang 'dod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: This point is accepted by the Buddhists as well.üîΩTo show this, he says,

original: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa yang 'dra'i ba dang ldan tha dad pa mtho ba de nyid kyi tha dad pa zlog par byed pas de ni de ltar mi 'thad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa yang 'dra'i ba dang ldan tha dad pa mtho ba de nyid kyi tha dad pa zlog par byed pas de ni de ltar mi 'thad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The refutation is as follows: ‚ÄúThe difference of the similar and dissimilar is seen. That difference is refuted. Therefore, it is not tenable that way.‚Äù

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gtso bya la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni gtso bya la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù refers to the primary action, etc.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni byed par dri ba'i brjod pa'o //üîΩrnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni byed par dri ba'i brjod pa'o // rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another way‚Äù refers to the expression of the question about the agent.üîΩThe commentary is as follows: ‚ÄúIf the agent is different from the action, then the agent would be without action.‚Äù

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù refers to sacrifice, etc.

original: 'dra'i ste zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra'i ste zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe similar‚Äù is the question.

original: 'di ni brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brjod pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the expression‚Äù is the commentary.

original: don 'di yin te gtso bo la sogs pa la the tshom za ba na //
analyzed: don 'di yin te gtso bo la sogs pa la the tshom za ba na //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: When there is doubt about the principal, etc.,

original: ci byed ces 'dra'i ba'i tshig mi 'thad do //
analyzed: ci byed ces 'dra'i ba'i tshig mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not correct to ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it doing?‚Äù

original: bum pa la the tshom za ba ni snam bu 'dri bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bum pa la the tshom za ba ni snam bu 'dri bar mi 'thad do //
translated: When there is doubt about a pot, it is not correct to ask about a cloth.

original: gzhan smras pa ni byed pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan smras pa ni byed pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Another says: ‚ÄúThe meaning of the word ‚Äòdoing‚Äô is . . .‚Äù

original: bum pa dang snam bu ltar shin tu tha dad pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu ltar shin tu tha dad pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is not thought that they are not completely different, like a pot and a cloth.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs pa na khyad par gyi cha la the tshom za ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig rtogs pa na khyad par gyi cha la the tshom za ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: When one understands only the universal, it is only correct to ask, because there is doubt about the particular aspect.

original: khyad par med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin @253a * //üîΩpar byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sun 'byin @253a * // par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout distinction . . .‚Äù and so on is the refutation.

original: skye pa dang gnas pa'i gzhan gyi dbang med pa la gal te rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang med na ni de'i tshe bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du tha dad pa nyid spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: skye pa dang gnas pa'i gzhan gyi dbang med pa la gal te rtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang yang med na ni de'i tshe bum pa dang snam bu bzhin du tha dad pa nyid spang bar mi nus so //
translated: If, without the dependence of origination and endurance, there is also no dependence of understanding, then at that time it is not possible to avoid the difference, just as in the case of a pot and a cloth.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i rtogs pa ni khyad par rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i rtogs pa ni khyad par rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the universal is by nature included in the cognition of the particular.

original: des na khyad par gyi cha la the tshom mi za pas ci 'dra'i ba'i go skabs yod /
analyzed: des na khyad par gyi cha la the tshom mi za pas ci 'dra'i ba'i go skabs yod /
translated: Since there is no doubt about the particular aspect, how could there be an occasion for the cognition of the universal?üîΩBut if the particular does indeed project the universal, then when the universal is cognized, the particular is not cognized.

original: 'on te spyi khyad par 'phen par byed mod kyi spyi rtog pa na de rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa khyad par spyi'i 'phangs par 'gyur ba yin na ni ma rtogs pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te spyi khyad par 'phen par byed mod kyi spyi rtog pa na de rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa khyad par spyi'i 'phangs par 'gyur ba yin na ni ma rtogs pa ma yin te ;
translated: To anticipate this doubt and explain, it is not the case that the particular does not project the universal.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Rather, it is cognized.

original: de lta na yang the tshom med pa'i 'dra'i ba'i go skabs su ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na yang the tshom med pa'i 'dra'i ba'i go skabs su ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even so, how could there be an occasion for the cognition of the universal without doubt?

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: The latter half is explained as follows.

original: spyi 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Only the universal means only the universal.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi khas len pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi khas len pa'o //
translated: But refers to the assertion of others.

original: spyi zhes bya ba spyi'i shes pas khyad par zhes bya ba khyad par gyi shes pa 'phen te /
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba spyi'i shes pas khyad par zhes bya ba khyad par gyi shes pa 'phen te /
translated: The universal projects the particular, which is called the particular cognition.

original: yul can gyi yul can bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul can gyi yul can bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of the cognition is shown.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the distinction.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú If, on the other hand‚Äù and so on is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: de ni zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the distinction.

original: lan du spyi de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du spyi de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThat universal itself‚Äù and so on.

original: don 'di yin te gal te spyi rtogs kyang khyad par mi rtogs kyi /
analyzed: don 'di yin te gal te spyi rtogs kyang khyad par mi rtogs kyi /
translated: The meaning is as follows: If the universal is cognized but the particular is not cognized,

original: 'on kyang khyad par spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin na /
translated: but the particular is cognized as having the nature of the universal,

original: de'i tshe yang spyi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang spyi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: then in that case, it is the universal that is cognized.

original: de lta yin dang spyi gzhan med pa'i dbang po rtogs pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang spyi gzhan med pa'i dbang po rtogs pa kho na rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then the cognition of the sense faculty itself, since there is no other universal, would be the cognition of the object.

original: 'phen par byed pa de nyid 'phang bar bya bar yang 'gyur ba ni mi rigs pa'i phyir 'di yang bkag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa de nyid 'phang bar bya bar yang 'gyur ba ni mi rigs pa'i phyir 'di yang bkag pa yang yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable that the propelling would be the propelled, and so this is also refuted.

original: 'on te spyi gzhan kho na 'phang bar bya ba yin no zhes dogs na spyi las zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on te spyi gzhan kho na 'phang bar bya ba yin no zhes dogs na spyi las zhes smos so //
translated: If it is feared that the object is only another universal, then ‚Äúfrom the universal‚Äù is stated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de lta yin na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes smos te /
translated: If that is so, he says,

original: 'phang bar bya ba'i spyi'i gzhan yod na'o //
analyzed: 'phang bar bya ba'i spyi'i gzhan yod na'o //
translated: if the universal of that which is to be lifted exists,

original: spyi de tsam ni mngon sum la snang ba med pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di yang mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi de tsam ni mngon sum la snang ba med pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di yang mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because that mere universal does not appear to perception, this understanding is also unreasonable.

original: gzhan dag rigs pa can gyi mdo dang lhan cig sdong bar bsams nas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so /
analyzed: gzhan dag rigs pa can gyi mdo dang lhan cig sdong bar bsams nas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so /
translated: Thinking of this, he says if and so on, intending to refute the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: de lta yin dang reng reng po tsam gyi spyi'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang reng reng po tsam gyi spyi'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If that is so, then the mere universal of a human would be directly perceived,

original: mtho yong ram mi'i khyad par ni @253b mngon sum ma yin ba dang / gzhan gyi tshe mthong ba'i yor dang / skyes bu'i khyad par la dran pa de lta na /
analyzed: mtho yong ram mi'i khyad par ni @253b mngon sum ma yin ba dang / gzhan gyi tshe mthong ba'i yor dang / skyes bu'i khyad par la dran pa de lta na /
translated: but the particulars of a human, such as height, would not be directly perceived, and the memory of the particulars of a human seen at another time would not be possible.

original: mtho yong ram mi zhes the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: mtho yong ram mi zhes the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: In that case, one would doubt whether it is a human or not.

original: de bzhin thams cad du the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad du the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, one would doubt everything.

original: des na spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bor gyur pa na the tshom du rigs pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bor gyur pa na the tshom du rigs pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, when it becomes the nature of a universal and a particular, it is only reasonable to doubt.

original: 'di sun 'byin pa ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di sun 'byin pa ni spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The refutation of this is as follows:

original: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa na khyad par dmigs pa'i phyir med pa kho nar rigs kyi the tshom ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa na khyad par dmigs pa'i phyir med pa kho nar rigs kyi the tshom ni ma yin te /
translated: If a universal is perceived, then since a particular is perceived, it is only reasonable that it does not exist, not that there is doubt,

original: med par nges pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: med par nges pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it is ascertained that it does not exist.

original: de ltar spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sum byung nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi mngon sum yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sum byung nas /
translated: Thus, since a universal is perceived and a particular is not perceived, this is the reason.

original: khyad pa dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sum 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: khyad pa dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de sum 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the reason ‚Äúbecause a particular is remembered‚Äù is as follows:

original: khyad par dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par dran pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because a particular is remembered, etc.

original: ci'i phyir don med ce na khyad par dran pa las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don med ce na khyad par dran pa las zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why is it meaningless? He says, ‚ÄúBecause of remembering a particular.‚Äù

original: mtho yor ram mi'i khyad par ma nges par dran pa gang yin pa de ni the tsho ma ma yin te /
analyzed: mtho yor ram mi'i khyad par ma nges par dran pa gang yin pa de ni the tsho ma ma yin te /
translated: Any memory of a particular that is not ascertained as a cairn or a person is not doubt,

original: de las sngar dran pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las sngar dran pa gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because it is not a memory of something else that existed previously.

original: 'on te skyes bu dang mtho yor 'dra ba 'ga' zhig srid pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bu dang mtho yor 'dra ba 'ga' zhig srid pa yin la /
translated: But it is possible that a person is similar to a cairn.

original: des na reng reng mthong ba na gcig la sbyar ba'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na reng reng mthong ba na gcig la sbyar ba'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, when one sees a corpse, there is doubt because of the application of the one to the other.

original: 'on ni 'ga' zhig reng reng po mthong bas sngar nyams su myong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa las gcig la gnyis ma nges par dran par 'gyur ba de ci the tshom ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on ni 'ga' zhig reng reng po mthong bas sngar nyams su myong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa las gcig la gnyis ma nges par dran par 'gyur ba de ci the tshom ma yin nam /
translated: But when one sees a corpse, and then remembers the former experience, the latent potentialities are aroused, and one remembers the two as not ascertained as one. Is that not doubt?

original: 'on te der yang re zhig sngon mthong ba la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang re zhig sngon mthong ba la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even in that case, it depends on the former perception,

original: de lta na yang khyad par dran pa'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par dran pa'i phyir zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: then in that case, one should not say that it is because of the memory of the difference.

original: sngar khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be because of the former perception of the difference.

original: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa la ltos pa yang 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa la ltos pa yang 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also mistaken to depend on the perception of the universal,

original: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: spyi mngon sum du gyur pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven without the perception of the universal,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci srid sgrub byed dang gnod byed ma zhugs kyi bar du ni srog ni yod dam med ces brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ci srid sgrub byed dang gnod byed ma zhugs kyi bar du ni srog ni yod dam med ces brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: As long as there is no proof or disproof, it is not to be said that life exists or does not exist.

original: der ni spyi 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: der ni spyi 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: And there is no apprehension of any universal there.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzung ngo //üîΩde'i phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis dngos su kun @254a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa gzung ngo // de'i phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis dngos su kun @254a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include intrinsic nature, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on.

original: du spyod pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i dus nyid na the tshom gyi tha snyad du bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: du spyod pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i dus nyid na the tshom gyi tha snyad du bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although there is no direct experience of the two aspects that appear in the conceptualization in any way, still, when there is proof and disproof, there is the expression of doubt. This is the idea.

original: skabs nyid du nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nyid du nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary at this point is ‚ÄúTherefore . . . ‚Äù

original: ma nges par rtogs pa'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa de nyid spyi yin no zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: ma nges par rtogs pa'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa de nyid spyi yin no zhes 'brel te //
translated: The uncertain cognition of the sacrifice, etc., is itself the universal. This is the connection.

original: rnam pa gang gis rtogs pa zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis rtogs pa zhe na /
translated: In what way is there cognition?

original: med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: med do zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthere is no . . . ‚Äù

original: tshad ma gang la rtogs she na /
analyzed: tshad ma gang la rtogs she na /
translated: In what valid cognition is there cognition?

original: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las zhes smos so //
analyzed: spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las zhes smos so //
translated: In general, it is said that inference is based on perception.

original: mchod pa la sogs pa dag tu bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs pa dag tu bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa gcig 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that one who possesses the characteristics of an object of worship, etc.

original: 'di 'dra ba ni bya bar brjod do zhes bar da grub pa na zhes de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid can gzhan dag kyang ma lus par bya ba'i tha snyad du rung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni bya bar brjod do zhes bar da grub pa na zhes de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid can gzhan dag kyang ma lus par bya ba'i tha snyad du rung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is to be called ‚Äúsuch and such,‚Äù when that is established, then others who possess characteristics like that are also suitable to be called by the term ‚Äúobject of worship,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: This is an inference based on the nature of that.

original: spyi yongs su bcad pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi yongs su bcad pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt there another way of determining the universal?

original: des na de skad du ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na de skad du ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it stated in that way?

original: khyad par med par ma zin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: khyad par med par ma zin pa zhes smos so //
translated: It is stated without distinction as ‚Äúnot apprehended.‚Äù

original: gal te spyi mngon sum du gyur pa la sogs pa the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi mngon sum du gyur pa la sogs pa the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin na'o //
translated: If the direct perception of the universal, etc. is not the cause of doubt,

original: 'on te tshom gyi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tshom gyi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: then what is the cause of doubt?

original: la las ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: la las ni zhes smos so //
translated: It is stated as ‚Äúsome.‚Äù

original: yul thag ring po 'am mun pas non pa'i dus su the tshom gyi yul gyi dngos po'i rnam pas dpen pa'o //
analyzed: yul thag ring po 'am mun pas non pa'i dus su the tshom gyi yul gyi dngos po'i rnam pas dpen pa'o //
translated: In the case of a distant object or when it is obscured, it is a non-perception of the form of the object in question.

original: ma dmigs pas the tshom gyi rgyur brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma dmigs pas the tshom gyi rgyur brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt non-perception said to be the cause of doubt?

original: de ci ltar blo yin par brjod ces dogs nas /
analyzed: de ci ltar blo yin par brjod ces dogs nas /
translated: How can it be described as cognition?

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa de lta bur gyur pa'i ma dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma dmigs pa spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ma gyur pa de lta bur gyur pa'i ma dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma dmigs pa spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is a non-perception of that kind, which is not the characteristic of perception, it is not excluded from non-perception.

original: de lar yang shes pa dang shes bya ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de lar yang shes pa dang shes bya ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin gyis rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be twofold in nature, as a negation of cognition and the cognized.

original: blo'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in ‚Äúthe nature of cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: des na blo nyid mi dmigs par brjod pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na blo nyid mi dmigs par brjod pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in describing cognition itself as non-perception.

original: 'on kyang dmigs bzhin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs bzhin pa'i don gyi rang bzhin yang yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: However, the difference is that it is also the nature of the object that is being perceived.

original: spyi mthong ba ni the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes grub kyang skabs kyi spyi tha dad pa la bsam pa las yang gzhan gyi dogs pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: spyi mthong ba ni the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no zhes grub kyang skabs kyi spyi tha dad pa la bsam pa las yang gzhan gyi dogs pa ston pa ni /
translated: But, in addition to the consideration of a separate general in the context, he shows another doubt:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: lan ni skyes bu dang @254b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni skyes bu dang @254b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThe post‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIs it not non-existent?‚Äù means ‚Äúit is only apprehended,‚Äù which is to say.

original: des na de ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ni yod pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not existent.

original: yod pa la gnod pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yod pa la gnod pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the harm in its being existent?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The two aspects are the aspects of the general and the particular.

original: dmigs pa yang med de des na spyi tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bzlog pa ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang med de des na spyi tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bzlog pa ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Since there is no apprehension of the general, therefore a separate general does not exist.üîΩHe shows the reversal:

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù and so on.

original: mtho yor dang skyes bu'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par 'dir ro //
analyzed: mtho yor dang skyes bu'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par 'dir ro //
translated: The particular of the post and the person is here.

original: tha dad blo med phyir zhes bya ba ni blo rnam pa gcig ni da dung snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad blo med phyir zhes bya ba ni blo rnam pa gcig ni da dung snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no separate cognition‚Äù means that a single cognition does not appear as a universal.

original: khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a particular aspect appears.

original: blo tha mi dad kyang spyi gzhan du 'gyur ro snyam du don gyi tha dad pa nyid ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: blo tha mi dad kyang spyi gzhan du 'gyur ro snyam du don gyi tha dad pa nyid ni zhes smos so //
translated: Even though there is no separate cognition, one might think that a universal is different in meaning, so he says, ‚ÄúThe difference in meaning is . . .‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te /üîΩmtho yor dang skyes bu'i rnag bzhin spangs nas dmigs pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te / mtho yor dang skyes bu'i rnag bzhin spangs nas dmigs pa med na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were not so‚Äù means if the universal were not different in meaning from the particular, then . . .

original: de'i tshe mtho yor dang skyes bu'i rnam pa'i khongs su gtogs pa tha mi dad pa spyi nyams su myong gyur na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtho yor dang skyes bu'i rnam pa'i khongs su gtogs pa tha mi dad pa spyi nyams su myong gyur na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one does not perceive a universal apart from the particular, then one would experience a universal that is not different from the particular aspects of a post and a man.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba khyad par la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba khyad par la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù refers to the particular.

original: de yongs su spangs par zhes mtho yor dang skyes bu yongs su spangs par ro //üîΩde dag las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yongs su spangs par zhes mtho yor dang skyes bu yongs su spangs par ro // de dag las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned that‚Äù means having abandoned the post and the man.

original: mtho yor dang skyes bu dag las so //
analyzed: mtho yor dang skyes bu dag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those‚Äù means from the post and the man.

original: de gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni reng reng po nyid de'o //
analyzed: de gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni reng reng po nyid de'o //
translated: If it were different, it would be a mere corpse.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: spyi don gzhan pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya zhes bya ba skyed bu'am mtho yor ro //
analyzed: spyi don gzhan pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya zhes bya ba skyed bu'am mtho yor ro //
translated: If the universal were different, then the object of cognition would be without a body or a head.

original: gzhan dag skabs thob nas rnam par rtog par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag skabs thob nas rnam par rtog par byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Others imagine the following in this context: If the universal were different from the particulars, then the universal would not be the object of cognition.

original: mi snang ba zhes bya ni snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba zhes bya ni snang ba med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNonappearance‚Äù means the nature of nonappearance.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa phyi ma rjes su brjod nas zlog pa ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa phyi ma rjes su brjod nas zlog pa ni / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The latter conception is refuted by stating:üîΩIf the universal were different from the particulars, then the universal would not be the object of cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa bar ma sum 'byin pa ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bar ma sum 'byin pa ni / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: The middle conception is refuted by stating:üîΩIf the universal were different from the particulars, then the universal would not be the object of cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po sun 'byin pa'i snang ba med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po sun 'byin pa'i snang ba med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first conception is refuted by stating:üîΩIf the universal were different from the particulars, then the universal would not be the object of cognition.

original: da ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan lta bu'i grub pa'i mtha' dogs pa bsu nas rnam par rtog pa bar ma nyid du sdud par smras pa ni /
analyzed: da ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan lta bu'i grub pa'i mtha' dogs pa bsu nas rnam par rtog pa bar ma nyid du sdud par smras pa ni /
translated: Now, having anticipated the philosophical position of another, he says that he will gather together the middle-range conceptual thoughts:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say, etc.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni @255a * //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni @255a * //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a state‚Äù means

original: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: an unclear aspect.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /üîΩgrub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so,‚Äù etc. is the philosophical position.

original: de ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: The thought is as follows:

original: gang gi phyogs bar ma'i go skabs su 'gyur ba gzhan gang rung ba snang ba mi gsal ba yin par ni mi smra'o //üîΩ'on kyang gang gis yul yod pa dang med pa ni blo la rag las pa blo dang yul dag la nye bar 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs bar ma'i go skabs su 'gyur ba gzhan gang rung ba snang ba mi gsal ba yin par ni mi smra'o // 'on kyang gang gis yul yod pa dang med pa ni blo la rag las pa blo dang yul dag la nye bar 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no //
translated: I do not say that the unclear appearance of any other object that might appear in the interval between the two is the object.üîΩHowever, the existence or nonexistence of the object depends on the cognition.

original: dper na der yod pas yul yod pa de bzhin du blo de'i rnam pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: dper na der yod pas yul yod pa de bzhin du blo de'i rnam pa can ma yin na /
translated: For example, just as the existence of an object is dependent on the existence of the object, if the cognition does not have the aspect of that object,

original: blo mi gsal bar rtogs so zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: blo mi gsal bar rtogs so zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin te /
translated: then one conventionally says that the cognition is unclear.

original: de'i rnam pa yul la sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yul la sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the aspect of that is superimposed on the object.

original: gal te dung dkar po de'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni kha dog de'o //
analyzed: gal te dung dkar po de'i bdag nyid du yod pa ni kha dog de'o //
translated: If the white of a conch exists as the essence of that, then that is the color.üîΩThe shape that is not different from that is impaired.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i dbyibs la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i don dang tha mi dad pa'i mi gsal ba la gnod pa'i gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i dbyibs la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i don dang tha mi dad pa'i mi gsal ba la gnod pa'i gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'o //
translated: If, as you say, the shape of a pot is impaired when the color is impaired, then the shape of the pot would be impaired when the color of the pot is impaired.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdbyibs tha dad pa yin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni rdzas kyang nye bar mtshon par lta'o //üîΩdbyibs sam rdzas kha dog dang tha mi dad pa ci 'dra ba kha dog dang tha mu dad pa de 'dra ba la kha dog la gnod pas gnod byed cing ngo //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dbyibs tha dad pa yin no zhe na zhes bya bas ni rdzas kyang nye bar mtshon par lta'o // dbyibs sam rdzas kha dog dang tha mi dad pa ci 'dra ba kha dog dang tha mu dad pa de 'dra ba la kha dog la gnod pas gnod byed cing ngo //
translated: The explanation of this is as follows.üîΩThe shape is different.üîΩThe shape or substance that is not different from the color is impaired by the impairment of the color, just as the shape that is different from the color is impaired by the impairment of the color.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbyibs la sogs pa rtogs pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tha dad par dbyibs la sogs pa rtogs pa med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the shape and so on are not cognized as different, then the shape and so on would not be cognized as different from the color.

original: 'on te dbyibs dang kha dog dag de'i bdag nyid du gnas kyang gcig la gnod gzhan la ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbyibs dang kha dog dag de'i bdag nyid du gnas kyang gcig la gnod gzhan la ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the shape and color exist in the self-existence of that, but that one is harmed and the other is not,

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;üîΩ/ sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ; / sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye ba ni //
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúWhose?‚ÄùüîΩThe analysis of connection

original: 'brel pa'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: is the analysis of relation.

original: 'brel pa'i rnam par dbye ba gang gis dbyibs la sogs pa de dag nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rnam par dbye ba gang gis dbyibs la sogs pa de dag nyid la'o //
translated: By means of the analysis of relation, those shape, etc.

original: gcig ni kha dog go //
analyzed: gcig ni kha dog go //
translated: One is color.

original: gzhan rdzas sam dbyibs te /
analyzed: gzhan rdzas sam dbyibs te /
translated: The other is substance or shape,

original: dbyibs dang rdzas dag ni 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs dang rdzas dag ni 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because shape and substance are obtained.

original: reng reng po tsam dang rdzas tsam ni 'thob kyi /
analyzed: reng reng po tsam dang rdzas tsam ni 'thob kyi /
translated: Only the mere shape and the mere substance are obtained.

original: mi 'thob pa ni kha dog 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa ni kha dog 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Only color is not obtained. This is the meaning.

original: gal te de ni gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de ni gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that is different,

original: de dag gi gang gi tshe rdzas sam dbyibs kha dog las gzhan yin na de'i tshe de nyid de bzhin nyid du gsal ba mi gsal ba'i kha dog snang @255b pa'i dus can sngon nam phyi ma'i mngon sum la cis mi snang ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gang gi tshe rdzas sam dbyibs kha dog las gzhan yin na de'i tshe de nyid de bzhin nyid du gsal ba mi gsal ba'i kha dog snang @255b pa'i dus can sngon nam phyi ma'i mngon sum la cis mi snang ste /
translated: If it is different from substance, shape, or color, then why does it not appear in the direct perception of the past or the future, when it is the clear or unclear color of reality itself?

original: snang ba kho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba kho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it would have to appear.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba snang ba gnyis la'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba snang ba gnyis la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo‚Äù refers to the two appearances of the clear and unclear.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs te rdzas la tha dad pa'am zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyang kha dog dang dbyibs las tha dad pa zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs te rdzas la tha dad pa'am zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyang kha dog dang dbyibs las tha dad pa zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf color and shape are different from substance‚Äù means that substance should be understood as different from color and shape.

original: dbyibs kyang kha dog dang zhes bya ba 'dis kyang kha dog kyang dbyibs las zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbyibs kyang kha dog dang zhes bya ba 'dis kyang kha dog kyang dbyibs las zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShape is also different from color‚Äù means that color should be understood as different from shape.

original: 'grel pa so sor mi snang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni lan gzhan ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa so sor mi snang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni lan gzhan ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf they do not appear separately‚Äù and so on presents another answer.

original: rtsa ba'i bshang pa ni gnyis tshogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bshang pa ni gnyis tshogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe two combined are feces.‚Äù

original: rdza sa sam dbyibs dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ni mngon sum gyi stobs las skyes pa'i zhes pa yin pas 'di ni mngon sum gyi byed pa kho na yin snyam pa gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdza sa sam dbyibs dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes mtshams sbyor bar byed pa ni mngon sum gyi stobs las skyes pa'i zhes pa yin pas 'di ni mngon sum gyi byed pa kho na yin snyam pa gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThat very thing that is perceived as a substance or as a shape is this very thing,‚Äù is a restatement. The phrase, ‚Äúarises from the power of perception,‚Äù makes it clear that this is the function of perception alone.

original: rjes su sbyor ba ni mngon sum las ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su sbyor ba ni mngon sum las ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúInference does not arise from perception.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang bral bar ni bsgrub par zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang bral bar ni bsgrub par zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that it is not connected to the function of perception.

original: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam yang mngon sum med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam yang mngon sum med pa'i phyir na /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist.‚Äù

original: rdzas la sogs pa tha dad par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa tha dad par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference does not exist to establish the difference between substances, etc.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The reason is that it does not exist when there is no connection to perception.üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúNor is there a valid cognition that is non-deceptive with regard to that.‚Äù

original: tha dad par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog las dbyibs dang rdzas dag cing blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog las dbyibs dang rdzas dag cing blta bar bya'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúrealization of difference‚Äù is the perception of shape as different from color, and of substance as different from both.

original: de ltar zhar la 'ong ba'i yan lag can bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhar la 'ong ba'i yan lag can bsal nas /
translated: Having thus cleared away the subsidiary topics that have been introduced,üîΩhe now summarizes the main point:

original: 'on te yul thag ring por skyes bu dang mtho yor gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i reng reng po tsam dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te yul thag ring por skyes bu dang mtho yor gyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'i reng reng po tsam dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, the nature of a person and a post, which are devoid of the nature of a far-off object, are observed as mere bareness.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba na'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù introduces the summary.

original: thun mong ba ni reng reng po'i spyi'o //üîΩskabs nyid nye bar sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ba ni reng reng po'i spyi'o // skabs nyid nye bar sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúbareness‚Äù is the common nature of both.üîΩThe summary of the point is stated in the passage beginning with the words, ‚ÄúTherefore, the nature of a person and a post, which are devoid of the nature of a far-off object, are observed as mere bareness.‚Äù

original: byed do zhes bya ba 'dis bstan par bya ba mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi thun mong ba'i rang bzhin spyi'i ngo bor bya ba zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba 'dis bstan par bya ba mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi thun mong ba'i rang bzhin spyi'i ngo bor bya ba zhes bya ba ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúnature‚Äù indicates that the nature of the particular actions such as sacrifice, etc., is not a common nature, that is, a universal.

original: grub pa'i dngos gzhi brjod pa ni de'i phyir sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩde la tha dad par zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin @256a * //
analyzed: grub pa'i dngos gzhi brjod pa ni de'i phyir sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de la tha dad par zhes bya ba ni mchod sbyin @256a * //
translated: The main point of the proof is stated in ‚ÄúTherefore, meditation . . .‚Äù

original: la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad par ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúdifferently‚Äù means that the action is different from the particular action of sacrifice, etc.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi sgom pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi sgom pa bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted meditation that has the nature of both,

original: da ni khams kyi don gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: da ni khams kyi don gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: now, in order to refute the side that takes the meaning of dhƒÅtu to be an element,

original: khams kyi don yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khams kyi don yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe meaning of dhƒÅtu is also . . . .‚Äù

original: gal te lha sbyin gyi sbyin sreg ces tha dad par tha snyad byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lha sbyin gyi sbyin sreg ces tha dad par tha snyad byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the expression ‚ÄúDevadatta‚Äôs sacrifice‚Äù is a different expression,

original: las kyang mig ser can la de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i blo skye ba ma yin nas /
analyzed: las kyang mig ser can la de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i blo skye ba ma yin nas /
translated: then even in the case of a jaundiced person, the cognition of that form would not arise.

original: des na der yang mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na der yang mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore it follows that the expression ‚Äúappears unclearly‚Äù would exist in that case as well.

original: de ni de ltar ma 'brel te zhes gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma 'brel te zhes gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba /
translated: This is not related to that, because it is an absurd consequence.

original: gang dang gang las de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i blo skye ba dang de la mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bzhed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dang gang las de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i blo skye ba dang de la mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad du bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bzhed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not the assertion of this system that the convention of nonclarity is applied to that which is not the cause of a cognition having that aspect, and that is unclear.

original: 'on kyang gang la mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad du bya ba la nyes pa 'dis bya ba yin no zhes bya ba bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang la mi gsal bar snang ba'i tha snyad du bya ba la nyes pa 'dis bya ba yin no zhes bya ba bzhed pa yin te /
translated: But it is the assertion of this system that the convention of nonclarity is applied to that which is not the cause of a cognition having that aspect, and that is unclear.

original: des kyang ha cang thal ba med do //
analyzed: des kyang ha cang thal ba med do //
translated: And that does not lead to absurd consequences.

original: gzhan gyis 'on te de nyid ces smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'on te de nyid ces smras te /
translated: Another says, ‚ÄúBut it is that itself.‚Äù

original: khyod kyis blo'i rang bzhin du brjod pa mi gsal ba gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyis blo'i rang bzhin du brjod pa mi gsal ba gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: That which you call the nature of cognition is unclear.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: If that is so, this is a refutation.

original: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba kha dog dang dbyibs so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba kha dog dang dbyibs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose two‚Äù are color and shape.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o ;
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù is another‚Äôs assertion.

original: / kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba de ni rdzas la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: / kha dog dang dbyibs snang ba de ni rdzas la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: The appearance of color and shape is based on substance.

original: spyi la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba grub ba sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba grub ba sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is an inference for the sake of establishing that the cognition is not based on a universal.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù is the objection.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las so //
translated: ‚Äú From that‚Äù is from color and shape.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù and so on is the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: mtho yor dang mi la gnas pa'i kha dog gam dbyibs snang ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mtho yor dang mi la gnas pa'i kha dog gam dbyibs snang ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Granted that the color or shape of a post or a man appears,

original: 'on kyang so so'i rang bzhin du ma yin par thun mong gi rang bzhin du snang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang so so'i rang bzhin du ma yin par thun mong gi rang bzhin du snang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: but it appears only as a common nature, not as an individual nature.

original: des na the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore there is doubt.

original: sun 'byin pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ni gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni gsal bas nye ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin ni gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni gsal bas nye ba'i gnas skabs rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The response is that it is not so. The meaning of ‚Äúthe nature of the other‚Äù is that the state of the clear is understood.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means that the nature of the unclear would not be understood.

original: de zhes bya ba ni kha dog gam /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni kha dog gam /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to color.üîΩ

original: dbyibs @256b so ;
analyzed: dbyibs @256b so ;
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to color or shape.üîΩ‚ÄúClearly or not clearly‚Äù refers to the nature of the object.

original: / gsal ba mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: / gsal ba mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the fault if one understands it in that way?

original: de lta yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is stated.

original: brgya la gzhan yan lag can the tshom gyi rgyur smra bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan yan lag can the tshom gyi rgyur smra bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If it were so, then it would be the cause of doubt about something else.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù and so on.

original: der zhes bya ba ni mtho yor ram skyes bu la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni mtho yor ram skyes bu la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to a scarecrow or a person.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni kha dog gam dbyibs so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni kha dog gam dbyibs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom them‚Äù refers to color or shape.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to blue and so on.

original: de las tha dad pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs las so //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs las so //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent from that‚Äù refers to color and shape.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to the doubt of others.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: It is that very color and shape.

original: len du ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: len du ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot in the way that is grasped‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan gyi lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot in the way that is grasped‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gsal bar bya ba dang mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gsal bar bya ba dang mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The following is stated in order to clarify this: ‚ÄúIf it is not clear, it is not different from that which is clear.‚Äù
