original: gal te de ltar de dag las tha dad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med mod mi gsal ba'i kha dog dang dbyibs go ci ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar de dag las tha dad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir med mod mi gsal ba'i kha dog dang dbyibs go ci ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If it is nonexistent because it is not observed as different from those, then how could the unclear color and shape be nonexistent?

original: mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The following is stated: ‚ÄúIf it is unclear‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gnod pa'i phyir med do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyir med do zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is nonexistent because it is impaired.

original: gang gis gnod ces dogs pa na /
analyzed: gang gis gnod ces dogs pa na /
translated: If it is asked by whom it is impaired,

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i rigs pa smras pa ni /üîΩgsal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa'i rigs pa smras pa ni / gsal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the reasoning that is accepted by others is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is clear‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa can skyes nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa can skyes nas /
translated: because the clear aspect arises,

original: nye ba'i yul du mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa gsal ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nye ba'i yul du mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa gsal ba 'di ni /
translated: this clear aspect that is present in front of the object that is near

original: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: is not the nature of the unclear aspect.

original: de'i phyir des gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir des gnod pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not harmed.

original: dogs pa de nyid la rang gi 'dod pas rigs pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dogs pa de nyid la rang gi 'dod pas rigs pa brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to express his own opinion regarding that doubt, he says:

original: de las bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that.

original: mi gsal ba de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: mi gsal ba de las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin ni gsal ba ste /
translated: The nature that is the opposite of that unclear is clear.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i dbyibs dang kha dog mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i dbyibs dang kha dog mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: That is the non-apprehension of the shape and color of the unclear.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa dogs par byed pa ni /üîΩ'di ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa dogs par byed pa ni / 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to express the doubt regarding the opinion of others, he says:üîΩThis is not so, and so on.

original: lan du 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩkha dog de ni zhes @257a * //
analyzed: lan du 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // kha dog de ni zhes @257a * //
translated: In response, he says: This is not so, and so on.üîΩThat color is the color that appears in a distant place.

original: bya ba ni yul thag ring po na snang ba'i kha dog de dbyibs gang la nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba ni yul thag ring po na snang ba'i kha dog de dbyibs gang la nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to express the refutation, he says:üîΩThat sacrifice, and so on.

original: mchod sbyin de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod sbyin la rang gi nus pa rtogs kyang /
analyzed: mchod sbyin de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchod sbyin la rang gi nus pa rtogs kyang /
translated: Even though one understands one's own ability in a sacrifice,

original: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin mtho ris la ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe mchod sbyin mtho ris la ;
translated: when a sacrifice is for heaven,

original: nus par rtogs pa de'i tshe bskul yang rtogs pa 'di mchod sbyin de la ci ltar 'jug / da ni tha ma sgrub pa'i phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: nus par rtogs pa de'i tshe bskul yang rtogs pa 'di mchod sbyin de la ci ltar 'jug / da ni tha ma sgrub pa'i phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: When one realizes that it is possible, then even if one is urged, how could one engage in this realization of the sacrifice?üîΩNow, the final refutation of the position of the establishment of the object of engagement is as follows.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ste dmigs pa med pa nyid bzlog par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ste dmigs pa med pa nyid bzlog par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is difficult to reverse the absence of an object.

original: sgom pa la sogs pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'brel pa gang las rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: sgom pa la sogs pa rnams kyi phan tshun 'brel pa gang las rtogs pa'am /
translated: The mutual connection of meditation, etc. is from which one understands.

original: 'jug pa'i yul mchod sbyin gyi mtho ris la sogs dang 'brel pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul mchod sbyin gyi mtho ris la sogs dang 'brel pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Or, the object of engagement is connected with heaven, etc. of the sacrifice.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: That is the establishment of reality.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sgom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sgom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All refers to meditation, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: Well then, how does one engage?

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, etc. is stated.

original: gal te blo dmigs pa med pa yin mod /
analyzed: gal te blo dmigs pa med pa yin mod /
translated: If the mind is without an object,

original: sel ba sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi yul yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: sel ba sgra dang rnam par rtog pa dag gi yul yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: how is the object of exclusion the object of words and conceptual thoughts?

original: de nyid kyang gzhan sel ba yin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gzhan sel ba yin no zhes smos te /
translated: That itself is the exclusion of another. This is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa blo'i dmigs pa med pa nyid gzhan sel ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa blo'i dmigs pa med pa nyid gzhan sel ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The object of the conceptual mind is the exclusion of other.

original: gzhan sel ba brjod bya yin no zhes bya ba nyid mthar gtugs na brjod par bya ba sel ba yin no zhes don nges par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba brjod bya yin no zhes bya ba nyid mthar gtugs na brjod par bya ba sel ba yin no zhes don nges par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the statement that the exclusion of other is the object of expression is finally reduced to the statement that the object of expression is the exclusion of other, because the meaning is ascertained in this way.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore is a conjunction that brings up the next topic.

original: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'o //
translated: Exaggeration is a superimposition that is not true.

original: gal te des spros pa de tsam gyis ci zhig bshad ce na /üîΩsgro 'dogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te des spros pa de tsam gyis ci zhig bshad ce na / sgro 'dogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If it is asked what is the elaboration by that,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúExaggeration is . . .‚Äù

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: First means principal.

original: de ltar mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du rjod pa dang / ma khyab pa dang ha cang khyab pa'i nyes pa yang spangs pa dang de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du rjod pa dang / ma khyab pa dang ha cang khyab pa'i nyes pa yang spangs pa dang de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the possession of nondeceptiveness is stated as the definition of valid knowledge, and the errors of nonpervasion and overpervasion are also avoided. Because it possesses that definition,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yang bstan pa dang / rig byed nyid las de grub pas bcom ldan 'das mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di la rig byed rang las tshad @257b ma yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don med par brjod pa lhur len pa'i spros pa gsal
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yang bstan pa dang / rig byed nyid las de grub pas bcom ldan 'das mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'di la rig byed rang las tshad @257b ma yin pa'i phyir mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid don med par brjod pa lhur len pa'i spros pa gsal
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn himself is a valid cognition in regard to other worlds and so on‚Äù is also taught.üîΩThe dispute that ‚Äúsince that is established from the Vedas, the BhagavƒÅn is not necessary‚Äù is clarified in this text, which is intent on stating that the definition of being undeceiving is meaningless because the Vedas are not valid cognitions in regard to themselves.

original: ba na / yang rang gi gzhung lugs la ltos na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kho na la yang ma khyab par ston pas gal te zhes bya ba sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ba na / yang rang gi gzhung lugs la ltos na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid kho na la yang ma khyab par ston pas gal te zhes bya ba sogs pa smos so //
translated: When the definition of being undeceiving is taught in terms of one‚Äôs own textual system, it is not universal. Therefore it says ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par zhes bya ba'i gzhal byang gyur pa'i las so //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par zhes bya ba'i gzhal byang gyur pa'i las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù and so on are objects of evaluation.

original: shes nas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa skyes nas so /
analyzed: shes nas zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa skyes nas so /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving understood‚Äù means having generated understanding.

original: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness that recognizes and so on is a valid cognition‚Äù is supplied.

original: de ltar ma yin na de'i yul du 'gro ba'i rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na de'i yul du 'gro ba'i rtogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: If it were not so, then the cognition of that object would be impossible.

original: / sogs pa'i sgras ni bum pa gcig yin no snyam pa na yan lag can gyi shes pa dang / sngon po ngang g-yo ba zhes pa ni sngon po nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid dag gi khyad par can du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par tha dad pa 'dzin pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: / sogs pa'i sgras ni bum pa gcig yin no snyam pa na yan lag can gyi shes pa dang / sngon po ngang g-yo ba zhes pa ni sngon po nyid dang mi g-yo ba nyid dag gi khyad par can du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par tha dad pa 'dzin pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the cognition of the whole, when one thinks ‚Äúthis is one pot,‚Äù and the cognition of a particular, as when one thinks ‚Äúthis is blue and moving,‚Äù where the blue is qualified by movement.

original: 'di la ni rang gi lugs kyis tshad ma 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni rang gi lugs kyis tshad ma 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in this case, we do not accept a valid cognition in our own system.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi lugs ston pa ni de la sngon med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams 'di yang nye bar mtshon ba tsam ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi lugs ston pa ni de la sngon med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams 'di yang nye bar mtshon ba tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, when he teaches the other system, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no prior nonexistence,‚Äù and so on.

original: dang po lta ba'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: dang po lta ba'i shes pa ni //
translated: The first cognition of the view

original: rnam par rtog med byis pa dang // lkugs sogs rnam shes dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med byis pa dang // lkugs sogs rnam shes dang 'dra ba //
translated: is nonconceptual, like the consciousness of a child or a mute,

original: dag pa'i dngos las skyes pa yod //
analyzed: dag pa'i dngos las skyes pa yod //
translated: and arises from a pure entity.

original: ces bya ba dang / de yi 'og tu blo gang gis //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang / de yi 'og tu blo gang gis //
translated: And after that, the cognition

original: dngos chos rigs la sogs rnams su //
analyzed: dngos chos rigs la sogs rnams su //
translated: and so on, with regard to things and attributes.

original: phyir zhing zhen byed de yang ni //
analyzed: phyir zhing zhen byed de yang ni //
translated: And that is also

original: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: considered to be direct perception.

original: zhes bya ba yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be examined.

original: yan lag gi shes pa'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di tshad ma ma yin na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yan lag gi shes pa'i stobs las byung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di tshad ma ma yin na zhes 'brel to //
translated: If this conceptual cognition is not a valid cognition because it arises from the power of the cognition of the parts, then the connection is

original: 'on te de ma thag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te yul rtogs pa la bar du gcod pa mig la sogs pa spangs nas mchod pa lta ba'i shes pa tshol na de'i tshe dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yod na 'jug par byed pa tshad ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'on te de ma thag pa yin na zhes bya ba ni / gal te yul rtogs pa la bar du gcod pa mig la sogs pa spangs nas mchod pa lta ba'i shes pa tshol na de'i tshe dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa yod na 'jug par byed pa tshad ma yin pas na /
translated: If it is immediate, then

original: 'jug pa la bar ma chod pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa la bar ma chod pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: if the visual cognition seeks the object of comprehension, having eliminated the eye and so on that interrupt the object of comprehension, then at that time, since the engaging cause is a valid cognition if memory, desire and so on exist, then the conceptual cognition that is not interrupted in engaging would be a valid cognition.üîΩThis is what is thought.

original: de ltar rtsod pa gnyis la /üîΩgzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
analyzed: de ltar rtsod pa gnyis la / gzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
translated: In response to these two disputes,

original: mi 'dod ces bya bas rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bkag la /
analyzed: mi 'dod ces bya bas rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin pa bkag la /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe conventional is not accepted because it grasps the object of apprehension,‚Äù refuting that conceptual cognition is a valid cognition.

original: blo ni tshad ma nyid ces @258a * //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma nyid ces @258a * //
translated: The mind is valid knowledge.üîΩ

original: bya ba la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa bkag go //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa bkag go //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe mind is valid cognition‚Äù refutes the eye and so on.

original: des na yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir lta ba nyid tshad mar brjod pa yin no //üîΩgal te / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
analyzed: des na yongs su gcod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dang / ma bzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir lta ba nyid tshad mar brjod pa yin no // gal te / tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
translated: Therefore, because it has the nature of determining and because it apprehends what has not been apprehended, seeing is called valid knowledge.

original: shes pa zhes bya bas slu ba can bkag pa yin mod gzung ba 'dzin pa ni ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya bas slu ba can bkag pa yin mod gzung ba 'dzin pa ni ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe line ‚ÄòValid knowledge is nondeceptive‚Äô refutes deceptive consciousnesses, but how does it refute the apprehension of objects?‚Äù

original: bden te mi slu ba can gyi shes pa la tshad ma'i ming byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te mi slu ba can gyi shes pa la tshad ma'i ming byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is true that the term valid knowledge is not applied to nondeceptive consciousnesses.

original: 'on kyang 'dis 'jal bas na tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba tshad ma'i sgras brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dis 'jal bas na tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba tshad ma'i sgras brjod par bya ba gang yin pa de'i mtshan nyid ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba ni yin te /
translated: However, the definition of valid knowledge is ‚Äúa nondeceptive consciousness,‚Äù which is what is referred to by the term valid knowledge, because it is that which measures.

original: log par rtogs pa'ang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'ang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is possible to have a wrong understanding.

original: bya ba rdzogs zin pa'i las la ni phyi ma sgrub byed dam par 'gyur ba mi 'os so //
analyzed: bya ba rdzogs zin pa'i las la ni phyi ma sgrub byed dam par 'gyur ba mi 'os so //
translated: It is not proper to establish the latter as the means of establishing an action that has already been completed.

original: des na don gyi sgrub pa ma bzung bar 'dzin pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don gyi sgrub pa ma bzung bar 'dzin pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, without apprehending the object of establishment, the apprehension is explained.

original: re zhig ngo shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ngo shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: First, from the perspective of recognition, it is explained as this is that and so on.

original: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba da ltar ba tsam gyis gcig nyid la'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba da ltar ba tsam gyis gcig nyid la'o //
translated: In one means in mere one-ness.

original: ci'i phyir 'di la tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di la tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this not a valid cognition?

original: sngon med pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be non-existent before.

original: sngon med pa ni ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: sngon med pa ni ma bzung ba'o //
translated: Non-existent before means not apprehended.

original: gcig nyid la ni da ltar tsam gyis gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gcig nyid la ni da ltar tsam gyis gcig nyid do //
translated: In one-ness means in mere one-ness.

original: ci'i phyir sngon med pa ma bzung zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sngon med pa ma bzung zhen /
translated: Why is the non-existent before not apprehended?

original: de nyid ni 'di'o snyam pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'di'o snyam pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought this is that is the thought of one-ness.

original: da lta'i shes pas mthong ba da ltar ba tsam gyis gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da lta'i shes pas mthong ba da ltar ba tsam gyis gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the present cognition realizes one-ness through mere present seeing.

original: gal te sngar lta ba'i shes pas ma bzung ba snga ma dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid do shes pa'i rtogs pas rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngar lta ba'i shes pas ma bzung ba snga ma dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid do shes pa'i rtogs pas rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not apprehended by the prior cognition of the object, is it not apprehended by the cognition of simultaneity?

original: des na de skad ci ste brjod ces dogs na /
analyzed: des na de skad ci ste brjod ces dogs na /
translated: If that is so, why is it said that it is not apprehended?

original: snga ma dang lhan cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma dang lhan cig ces gsungs so //
translated: The answer is that it is said to be simultaneous with the prior object.

original: gal te de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag gcig tu nges pa de lta na yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag gi byed pa de la med pa'i phyir na 'di ni the tshom gyi gnas yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs
analyzed: gal te de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngag gcig tu nges pa de lta na yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i mngon sum dag gi byed pa de la med pa'i phyir na 'di ni the tshom gyi gnas yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs
translated: If it is certain that the prior and subsequent statements are the same, then the activity of the prior and subsequent direct perceptions does not exist in that case, so this is a basis for doubt.

original: pa yin no //üîΩsnga ma dang lhan cig gzung ba'i gcig nyid ni zhes bya ba'i yul gyi yul can bstan pa'i phyir snga ma dang lhan cig tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no // snga ma dang lhan cig gzung ba'i gcig nyid ni zhes bya ba'i yul gyi yul can bstan pa'i phyir snga ma dang lhan cig tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: This is what is thought.üîΩThe object of the cognition of simultaneity is taught to be the simultaneity of the prior object, so the meaning of ‚Äúsimultaneous apprehension‚Äù is the simultaneity of the prior object.

original: gcig nyid kyi shes pa nyid ni rtsod pa'i yul gyi gcig nyid bdag gis byed pa ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi shes pa nyid ni rtsod pa'i yul gyi gcig nyid bdag gis byed pa ste /
translated: The cognition of simultaneity itself is the activity of the simultaneity of the prior object.

original: @258b gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: @258b gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: it is the illuminator.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi gci /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi gci /
translated: The basis of the dispute is one.

original: ces 'dod pa der ni 'di skye mched du gyur cing sgrub byed yin pas na gzhi ste /
analyzed: ces 'dod pa der ni 'di skye mched du gyur cing sgrub byed yin pas na gzhi ste /
translated: In that case, it is the basis because it is the source and the proof.

original: rtsod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is connected with the dispute.

original: rtsod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa 'di yang rtogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma la snang ba'i rang bzhin dag gcig nyid la rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa 'di yang rtogs pa snga ma dang phyi ma la snang ba'i rang bzhin dag gcig nyid la rigs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, this connection with the dispute is reasonable in regard to the very same thing that appears in the prior and subsequent cognitions,

original: mngon sum gyis gcig nyid gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gcig nyid gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because direct perception manifests the very same thing.

original: gal te bdag nyid kha cig nyid sems na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kha cig nyid sems na ni /
translated: If it is the very same self that is thought of,

original: de'i tshe autpala sngon po bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i tshe autpala sngon po bzhin du mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: then, since it is established by direct perception, like a blue lotus,

original: rtsod pa med pa zhes ston pa ni da ltar ba tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa zhes ston pa ni da ltar ba tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the statement ‚Äúthere is no dispute‚Äù is made.

original: de bzhin du snga ma tsam gyi tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma tsam gyi tha dad pa med pa'i rang bzhin gyis kyang rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no dispute because of the non-difference of the prior and subsequent cognitions.

original: da ltar ba zhes dngos por bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bos tha mi dad par bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba zhes dngos por bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bos tha mi dad par bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe present‚Äù is taught as an entity is for the purpose of teaching that it is not different by virtue of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi gcig nyid la rtsod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi gcig nyid la rtsod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is a dispute about the sameness of the prior and subsequent.

original: gang du rtsod pa yod pa der gtan la phebs pa yang mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang du rtsod pa yod pa der gtan la phebs pa yang mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: And isn‚Äôt it the case that when there is a dispute, there is also a resolution?

original: des na skabs su bab pa la ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na skabs su bab pa la ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how is it that the present case is just as it is?

original: snga ma de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat prior‚Äù is made.

original: mngon sum gyis gcig nyid mi 'dzin pa tsam gyis rtsod pa yod par ni brjod zin pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gcig nyid mi 'dzin pa tsam gyis rtsod pa yod par ni brjod zin pa yin la /
translated: It has already been stated that there is a dispute merely because direct perception does not apprehend sameness.

original: da ni tha dad par 'dzin pa las bzlog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: da ni tha dad par 'dzin pa las bzlog pa kho na'o //
translated: Now, it is just the opposite of apprehending difference.

original: dngos po snga ma de yang phyi ma zhes bya ba dang da ltar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po snga ma de yang phyi ma zhes bya ba dang da ltar ba ma yin no //
translated: That prior entity is not called subsequent or present.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa snga mas bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa snga mas bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is apprehended by the prior cognition.

original: 'di'i tha dad pa ci ltar nges na zhes pa snga ma ni zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad pa ci ltar nges na zhes pa snga ma ni zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúhow is its difference ascertained?‚Äù is the reason.

original: rdzas nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rdzas nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúSubstance‚Äù and so on are mentioned.

original: ci lta bur gyur pa zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur pa zhig la zhe na /
translated: What kind of thing is it?

original: snga phyir gyur pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snga phyir gyur pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúprior and subsequent.‚Äù

original: snga ma dang phyi mar yang de nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar yang de nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same thing in the prior and subsequent moments,

original: de kho na nyid du skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in reality it is momentary.

original: de lta mod kyi rtogs pa snga phyir gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rtogs pa snga phyir gyur pa yin no //
translated: However, there are prior and subsequent moments of cognition.

original: gzhan las ci 'dra bar gyur pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: gzhan las ci 'dra bar gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of thing is it that is different from that?

original: tha dad par brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi rdzas so //
analyzed: tha dad par brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo can gyi rdzas so //
translated: It is a substance that has a nature imagined to be different.

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis byas pa las tha dad pa btags she na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis byas pa las tha dad pa btags she na /
translated: On the basis of what reason is it imagined to be different?

original: rjes su 'gro ba de dang ldog pas zhes gsungs te /üîΩlha spyin nyid ni mchod sbyin byed pa dang / mi byed pa'i gnas skabs gnyi gar rjes su 'gro @259a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba de dang ldog pas zhes gsungs te / lha spyin nyid ni mchod sbyin byed pa dang / mi byed pa'i gnas skabs gnyi gar rjes su 'gro @259a * //
translated: It is said that it is ‚Äúon the basis of its presence and absence.‚ÄùüîΩDevadatta himself is present in both situations, when he is performing a sacrifice and when he is not.

original: la mchod sbyin byed pa'i gnas skabs ni res 'ga' rjes su mi 'gro bas na ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: la mchod sbyin byed pa'i gnas skabs ni res 'ga' rjes su mi 'gro bas na ldog pa yin no //
translated: However, the situation of performing a sacrifice is sometimes absent, and so it is absent when he is not performing a sacrifice.

original: des na gnyi ga la khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ma khyab pa'i dogs pa sa rdzas tha dad par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la khyab pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ma khyab pa'i dogs pa sa rdzas tha dad par brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the investigation of substantial difference is based on the doubt whether there is pervasion of both or non-pervasion.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni tha dad pa med kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni tha dad pa med kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is clarified by ‚Äúeven though there is no difference.‚Äù

original: rang gi bya ba dang khams kyi don yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyi ga la nyes pa gzhan brjod pa dran par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba dang khams kyi don yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyi ga la nyes pa gzhan brjod pa dran par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd the meaning of one‚Äôs own action and element, etc.‚Äù is to remind one of the other faults that apply to both.

original: dman pa dag skyon 'di tsam du zad do snyam du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du khyad par gyi don du'o //
analyzed: dman pa dag skyon 'di tsam du zad do snyam du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i don du khyad par gyi don du'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is in order to prevent the inferior from thinking that this is the only fault.

original: de ltar yang rtsod pa 'on te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang rtsod pa 'on te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the objection is, ‚ÄúBut if that is so . . .‚Äù

original: rtags las ma skyes pa'i shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa ma brjod do //
analyzed: rtags las ma skyes pa'i shes pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa ma brjod do //
translated: Since this is the context of consciousness not produced from a sign, inference is not mentioned.

original: de'i yul can yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang byung ba la sogs pa'i yul can yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i yul can yin yang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang byung ba la sogs pa'i yul can yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it has that as its object‚Äù means even though it has as its object the elements, the things derived from the elements, and so on.

original: der 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: der 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa nyid du'o //
translated: It is not so, i.e., it is not the case that there is no objective support.

original: skul ba ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang phra ba dang / bskal pa rjod par byed kyi dbang po la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skul ba ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / rgyang ring ba dang phra ba dang / bskal pa rjod par byed kyi dbang po la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The instigation is that which is past, present, and distant, subtle, and described as eons, but not by other faculties, etc.

original: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo med pas na mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe rang gi ngo bo med pas na mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of seeing is because at that time, there is no appearance due to the absence of one's own nature.

original: 'o na khyod kyi rjes su dpog pa la yang rang gi ngo bo mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi rjes su dpog pa la yang rang gi ngo bo mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then in inference as well, one's own nature does not appear.

original: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid du nges zhes dogs na /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su dpag pa yod pa nyid du nges zhes dogs na /
translated: How then is the existence of inference ascertained?

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni zhes smos so //
translated: In response, it is said that in inference...

original: rjes su dpag pa der ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa der ni /
translated: In that inference,

original: de ltar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don de gnas par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don de gnas par nges pa yin no //
translated: the meaning of thus abiding is ascertained as abiding.

original: 'chad pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the hidden object, etc.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the meaning of the definition of the reason.

original: gang dang zhes bya ba bsgrub bya dang ngo //
analyzed: gang dang zhes bya ba bsgrub bya dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWhich‚Äù refers to the probandum.

original: de zhes bya ba rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don de yod na'o zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'o ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rtags kyi mtshan nyid kyi don de yod na'o zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúIf that‚Äù refers to the meaning of the definition of the reason. ‚ÄúExists‚Äù is the probandum.

original: /'o na 'byung dang byung ba bskul ba la dmigs pa med pa nyid du ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: /'o na 'byung dang byung ba bskul ba la dmigs pa med pa nyid du ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: Now, how is it understood that the instigation of the primary elements and the derivative form is indeed without a referent?

original: bshad pas bskul bas bskyed pa'i blo dmigs pa med pa nyid ni'o //
analyzed: bshad pas bskul bas bskyed pa'i blo dmigs pa med pa nyid ni'o //
translated: The understanding that the cognition produced by the instigation of speech is indeed without a referent is from the nonexistence of its nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa @259b las so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin med pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa @259b las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the nonexistence of its nature‚Äù means from the nonexistence of the nature of the primary elements and the derivative form.

original: rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin mod zhugs pas nges par byas pa thob pa ni yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin mod zhugs pas nges par byas pa thob pa ni yod pa yin la /
translated: Although it does not apprehend its own nature, the obtained result of the action of engaging is existent.

original: de tsam gyis bskul ba tshad mar smra ba rnams kyi don grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis bskul ba tshad mar smra ba rnams kyi don grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: To that extent, the proponents of valid knowledge maintain that the purpose is established.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe future‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gis nges par byas pa thob par nges par 'brel ba ni med do //üîΩ'on ni nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis nges par byas pa thob par nges par 'brel ba ni med do // 'on ni nus pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: but there is no certainty that the result will definitely be obtained by the one who has performed the action.üîΩAnd if the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩBut the result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.üîΩThe result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.üîΩThus, the result is inferred from the cause.üîΩThis is explained in the following.üîΩIf the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩThe result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.üîΩThe result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.

original: de yang dngos po nyid du na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po nyid du na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, the result is inferred from the cause.

original: rjes su dpag pa las ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is explained in the following.üîΩIf the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩThe result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.üîΩThe result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.

original: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mthong ba ste /
translated: Thus, the result is inferred from the cause.üîΩThis is explained in the following.üîΩIf the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩThe result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.üîΩThe result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.

original: des na rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa la sogs par gnas te /
analyzed: des na rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog pa la sogs par gnas te /
translated: Thus, the result is inferred from the cause.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained in the following.

original: gal te rig byed kyi bstan pa'i me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed kyi bstan pa'i me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩThe result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.üîΩThe result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.üîΩThus, the result is inferred from the cause.

original: me'i sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in the following.üîΩIf the result is not seen immediately after the action, then the result will not be inferred from the cause, because the result is a real entity.üîΩThe result is inferred from the cause, because the result is not seen elsewhere.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid ni mtho ris la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The result is not seen elsewhere, i.e., apart from the cause.üîΩThus, the

original: de ma byas na zhes pa ni me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa ma byas na'o //
analyzed: de ma byas na zhes pa ni me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa ma byas na'o //
translated: If one does not do that, means if one does not do the fire sacrifice, etc.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, means if it is another‚Äôs.

original: bdag gi nus pa rtogs pa ni mchod sbyin la'o //
analyzed: bdag gi nus pa rtogs pa ni mchod sbyin la'o //
translated: The realization of one‚Äôs own ability is with regard to the sacrifice.

original: re zhig bdag gis mchod sbyin bya bar nus so zhes nus pa rtogs na mchod sbyin gyi rgyu gang gi phyir shes pa snga mas dngos po de tha ma'i rang bzhin skad cig gzhan dang bral ba dang / snga na med par zhes bya ba skad cig de las sngon rol du mi gnas par 'dzin pa de'i phyir shes pa snga mas bzung ba nyid phyi ma'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dre ba 'gal ba yin no //üîΩdes na tha dad par nges pa nyid du sgrub po //
analyzed: re zhig bdag gis mchod sbyin bya bar nus so zhes nus pa rtogs na mchod sbyin gyi rgyu gang gi phyir shes pa snga mas dngos po de tha ma'i rang bzhin skad cig gzhan dang bral ba dang / snga na med par zhes bya ba skad cig de las sngon rol du mi gnas par 'dzin pa de'i phyir shes pa snga mas bzung ba nyid phyi ma'i rang gi ngo bo dang 'dre ba 'gal ba yin no // des na tha dad par nges pa nyid du sgrub po //
translated: First, if one realizes one‚Äôs ability, thinking, ‚ÄúI am able to perform the sacrifice,‚Äù then the cause of the sacrifice is known. The prior cognition apprehends the nature of the final thing as free from another moment, and as not existing before, that is, as not enduring prior to that moment. Therefore, the prior cognition itself is incompatible with the mixing of the final thing with its own nature.üîΩThus, it is established that they are ascertained as different.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad par 'dzin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad par 'dzin pas na'o //
translated: By that, means by apprehending their different natures.

original: phyis rjes su sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni do zhes pa'i rtogs pas zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis rjes su sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni do zhes pa'i rtogs pas zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The phrase later on, in connection with should be understood by the particle hi in the verse.

original: ci ltar bzung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i shes pas gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres par bzung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar bzung bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i shes pas gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres par bzung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase as it was apprehended means that it was apprehended by the cognition of the view without being mixed with the nature of something else.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni de gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni de gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase in that way means that it was not mixed with the nature of something else.

original: de lta yin mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: bzung pa nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzung pa nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase as an object of apprehension is supplied.

original: yang na snga ma dang phyi ma lta ba'i shes pas bzung ba nyid gcig yin @260a * //
analyzed: yang na snga ma dang phyi ma lta ba'i shes pas bzung ba nyid gcig yin @260a * //
translated: Or, the phrase as an object of apprehension is supplied from the previous and subsequent passages.

original: te ; des na gzung ba nyid ni 'dzin pa mtshams sbyor bar byed pa nyid du brjod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: te ; des na gzung ba nyid ni 'dzin pa mtshams sbyor bar byed pa nyid du brjod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of apprehension is said to be the connecting link with the subject.

original: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma las gcig nyid med na /
analyzed: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma las gcig nyid med na /
translated: If the previous and subsequent are not identical,

original: 'o na ci ltar mi slu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mi slu ba yin zhe na /
translated: then how can it be nondeceptive?

original: mi slu ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi slu ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase nondeceptive is supplied.

original: mngon sum las 'jug pas na don bya ba nyid thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum las 'jug pas na don bya ba nyid thob pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is engaged in the direct perception of the object, it is the attainment of the object‚Äôs function.

original: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig nyid ces bya ba ni thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But the oneness is not to be attained,

original: mngon sum gyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is refuted by direct perception.

original: de'i don bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa tsam ni yod kyang rtsa ba med pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i don bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i zhen pa tsam ni yod kyang rtsa ba med pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Even though there is a mere attachment to the meaning of ‚Äúthis is the object‚Äôs function,‚Äù it is said to be rootless.

original: 'on te gal te 'di ma yin nam ci ltar de'i don bya ba 'di yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te 'di ma yin nam ci ltar de'i don bya ba 'di yin na /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is this? How is this the object‚Äôs function?‚Äù

original: des na don bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na don bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag gcig pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya yin no zhe na /
translated: Then the object‚Äôs function is established by the sameness of the prior and subsequent.

original: don bya ba ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: don bya ba ni zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe object‚Äôs function.‚Äù

original: 'on te ga las yin /
analyzed: 'on te ga las yin /
translated: But how is that?

original: gzhan las yin na yang thams cad las 'gyur bar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan las yin na yang thams cad las 'gyur bar thal lo zhe na /
translated: If it is from another, it would follow that everything would be so.

original: dngos po'i nus pa tsam las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa tsam las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it arises from the mere potency of the thing.

original: de nyid 'di ma yin mod /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ma yin mod /
translated: That is not so.

original: ci ltar de'i rgyu'i nus pa la don bya ba der nus pa skyes pa de bzhin du gal te /
analyzed: ci ltar de'i rgyu'i nus pa la don bya ba der nus pa skyes pa de bzhin du gal te /
translated: Just as the potency of the cause of that arises as the potency of the object‚Äôs function, in the same way, if the potency of the cause of that arises as the potency of the object‚Äôs function, then the object‚Äôs function would be established by the sameness of the prior and subsequent.

original: 'di yang 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di yang 'gyur mod /
translated: This is also possible.

original: de'i tshe tha dad kyang don bya ba nyams pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i tshe tha dad kyang don bya ba nyams pa ci yod /
translated: But at that time, even though they are different, what is the loss to the activity?

original: gang la nus pa'i khyad par med pa de ni skyed byed ma yin pa nyid pas ha cang thal ba yang thag ring du spangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang la nus pa'i khyad par med pa de ni skyed byed ma yin pa nyid pas ha cang thal ba yang thag ring du spangs pa kho na'o //
translated: And since that which does not have a special capacity is not a producer, the absurd consequence is completely avoided.

original: de ltar rgyu tha dad kyang bya ba tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu tha dad kyang bya ba tha mi dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, even though the cause is different, the activity is not different.

original: dper na rgyu rang gi mtshan nyid tsam tha mi dad pa yin pa de bzhin du bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu rang gi mtshan nyid tsam tha mi dad pa yin pa de bzhin du bya ba yang yin no //
translated: For example, just as the cause is not different in its mere intrinsic identity, so also is the activity.

original: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa gnyis dran pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gcig nyid la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa gnyis dran pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gcig nyid la ni tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The summary is the two that occur earlier and later, which have the nature of memory. The meaning is that there is no valid cognition of a single entity.

original: gang yang gal te de ltar gcig nyid nyams pa'am tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gang yang gal te de ltar gcig nyid nyams pa'am tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: And also, if in that way the single entity is lost or is not a valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, it follows that there is also inference.

original: 'di ltar der yang 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngar mthong ba'i me dang / da ltar mthong ba'i la'i dran pa gnyis yin no zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar der yang 'di na me yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngar mthong ba'i me dang / da ltar mthong ba'i la'i dran pa gnyis yin no zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: In the same way, the statement ‚ÄúThere is fire here‚Äù is a combination of the memory of fire seen previously and the memory of smoke seen now.

original: 'on te 'dir gnyis kyis 'brel ba lhag pa rtogs pas na don gcig nye bar bsdu pa yod pa'i phyir na 'di ni gcig kho na rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i rnam par @260b gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'dir gnyis kyis 'brel ba lhag pa rtogs pas na don gcig nye bar bsdu pa yod pa'i phyir na 'di ni gcig kho na rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'i rnam par @260b gzhag pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that the two are related by the relation of inherence, and that the meaning of the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is included in the meaning of the word ‚Äúfire,‚Äù then the statement ‚ÄúOne is perceived‚Äù is established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa gzhan bzhin dran pa tsam ma yin no zhes bya bar sems na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa gzhan bzhin dran pa tsam ma yin no zhes bya bar sems na /
translated: If you think that the statement ‚ÄúThere is fire here‚Äù is not mere memory, like another statement of memory,

original: de ltar na ngo shes pa la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi rtogs bzhin pa gcig gi mtshan nyid don gcig nye bar bsdu pa yod pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo shes pa la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi rtogs bzhin pa gcig gi mtshan nyid don gcig nye bar bsdu pa yod pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid do //
translated: then recognition is also like that, because the meaning of the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is included in the meaning of the word ‚Äúperceived,‚Äù as in the statement ‚ÄúOne is perceived.‚Äù

original: sngar gcig nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar gcig nyid ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one is not perceived previously,

original: tshad ma'ang yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'ang yin te /
translated: it is valid knowledge.

original: dran pa'i shes pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes zer ba 'di ba 'di ni 'dzin pa bshad pa nyid kyis gsal bar rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes zer ba 'di ba 'di ni 'dzin pa bshad pa nyid kyis gsal bar rig par bya ba'o //
translated: This is clearly understood by the explanation of the grasping.

original: chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa tshad mas ma bsal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni tshul gsum yongs su dpag par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs las grub pa na /
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa tshad mas ma bsal ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ni tshul gsum yongs su dpag par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs las grub pa na /
translated: In an inference where the connection between the property and the property-possessor is not established by a valid cognition, when the trimodal condition is ascertained, the proof is established from the reason.

original: don nye bar bsdu pa'i phyir gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / de las lhag par grub pas /
analyzed: don nye bar bsdu pa'i phyir gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / de las lhag par grub pas /
translated: In order to include the meaning, it is posited as one, and it is established as more than that.

original: gal te gzhan gzugs tsam las thob bya gzhan med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gzugs tsam las thob bya gzhan med pa yin na /
translated: If there is nothing to be obtained other than mere form,

original: de'i tshe skad cig ma dang gzugs 'dzin pa'i blo ci ltar tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig ma dang gzugs 'dzin pa'i blo ci ltar tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then how can the cognition that apprehends the momentariness and form be valid? This is the meaning.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni skad cig tu 'dzin pa'i gnod par byed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni skad cig tu 'dzin pa'i gnod par byed pa yang ma yin /
translated: In the philosophical system, the cognition of momentariness is not a fault,

original: skad cig tu 'dzin pa phan 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: skad cig tu 'dzin pa phan 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: and the cognition of momentariness is not a benefit. This is what is taught.

original: skad cig ma yin par 'dzin kyang gal te 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe tshad ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par 'dzin kyang gal te 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe tshad ma yin nam /
translated: If one apprehends it as momentary but does not engage it, then is it valid knowledge?

original: gcig 'jug par byed pas tshad ma yin na ni skad cig mar 'dzin kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: gcig 'jug par byed pas tshad ma yin na ni skad cig mar 'dzin kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: If it is valid knowledge because it engages one thing, then there is no fault in apprehending it as momentary.

original: 'on de ltar yin na gzung ba gzhan yin zhing 'jug pa 'am thob pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir shes pa la ltos pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on de ltar yin na gzung ba gzhan yin zhing 'jug pa 'am thob pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir shes pa la ltos pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, since the object to be apprehended is one thing and the engagement or attainment is another, what is the use of consciousness?

original: gal te de lta na brten pa'i phyogs la yang 'gyur ba'i don byed par bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin bzung ba'i phyir bya ba ci yongs su rdzogs pas na ci'i don du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na brten pa'i phyogs la yang 'gyur ba'i don byed par bsgrub bya'i rang bzhin bzung ba'i phyir bya ba ci yongs su rdzogs pas na ci'i don du 'jug ste /
translated: If that is so, then in the case of the SautrƒÅntika position, since the nature of the object of activity is apprehended as the object to be established, what is the use of engagement, since the activity is completely finished?

original: des na shes pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pas ci bya zhes brjod pa ni mi nus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is impossible to say, ‚ÄúWhat is the use of consciousness?‚Äù

original: skad cig tu bzung ba la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma bzung yang gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas 'jug par byed pa bzlog par mi nus pa gang du dngos po ni 'jug byed ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig tu bzung ba la ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma bzung yang gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pas 'jug par byed pa bzlog par mi nus pa gang du dngos po ni 'jug byed ma yin gyi /
translated: In the case of apprehending it as momentary, even though the future is not apprehended, since one is attached to it as one thing, it is impossible to stop engagement. Therefore the object is not the object of engagement.

original: 'on kyang lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te /
translated: But it is just the adherence to the special nature of the object that is the cause of the adherence to the self of dharmas.

original: de lta ma yin na dngul don du gnyer ba nya phyis la mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngul don du gnyer ba nya phyis la mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that one who seeks silver would not engage in mother of pearl.

original: dngul du 'jug par byed pa yang dngul du lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te /üîΩde ma skyes sam @261a * //
analyzed: dngul du 'jug par byed pa yang dngul du lhag par zhen pa nyid yin te / de ma skyes sam @261a * //
translated: And it is just the adherence to silver that causes one to engage in mother of pearl.üîΩIf that adherence had not arisen,

original: phyin ci log skyes na 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log skyes na 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or if it had been destroyed, one would not engage in it.

original: der lhag par zhen pa de yang de'i rigs can 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar der mngon par 'dod pa don bya ba thob pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i tha snyad du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: der lhag par zhen pa de yang de'i rigs can 'ga' zhig la 'gyur bar der mngon par 'dod pa don bya ba thob pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i tha snyad du byas pa yin la /
translated: And that adherence to the special nature of the object is posited as a nondeceptive convention in regard to that which is desired, the attainment of the object's function, in regard to some object that is of its type.

original: gzhan du ni slu ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni slu ba yin no //
translated: In regard to other objects it is deceptive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan 'dzin pa na gzhan du 'jug pa mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan 'dzin pa na gzhan du 'jug pa mi 'gal te /
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction in engaging in one object while apprehending another,

original: de'i rigs can la ltos nas slu ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs can la ltos nas slu ba rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for it is in regard to objects of its type that nondeceptiveness is posited.

original: de'i phyir brtan pa dang mi brtan pa 'dzin pa la ma ltos par ni dngos po 'dzin tsam nye bar mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtan pa dang mi brtan pa 'dzin pa la ma ltos par ni dngos po 'dzin tsam nye bar mkho ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to apprehend an object, it is necessary to apprehend it as either permanent or impermanent.

original: rtogs pa'i don nyid la sngon nyams su myong ba'i don bya ba dran pa las mngon par 'dod pas thob par bya ba dang / gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa dag 'jug par byed pa yin gyi rtogs pa ma skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don nyid la sngon nyams su myong ba'i don bya ba dran pa las mngon par 'dod pas thob par bya ba dang / gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa dag 'jug par byed pa yin gyi rtogs pa ma skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúagain‚Äù is that the object of prior experience is remembered, and the object of desire is obtained. It is the object of the prior experience and the object of desire that are remembered and obtained, not the prior experience and the desire.

original: 'jug pa de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa de la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúagain‚Äù is used because the prior experience and the desire are not the same as the memory and the obtainment.

original: nyid smos pa ni dbang po la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyid smos pa ni dbang po la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is used to exclude the sense faculties, etc.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don ni ma rtogs la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don ni ma rtogs la /
translated: If that is so, then the object of prior experience is not understood,

original: de'i yul can tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go gang zhig dang 'brel ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yul can tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di go gang zhig dang 'brel ba yin zhe na /
translated: and the means of knowledge is the subject that has that object. What is the connection between them?

original: gal te yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúagain‚Äù is used because the object of prior experience is not understood.

original: de la zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don la 'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don la 'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthere‚Äù refers to the object of prior experience.

original: de bzhin du gzugs tsam rtogs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs tsam rtogs pas na /
translated: In the same way, because the mere form is understood,

original: ro la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the means of knowledge is the collection of taste, etc.

original: gal te rtogs pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition because it is conceptual,

original: 'on kyang 'jug pas yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jug pas yin la /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition because it is an awareness,üîΩand if it is not a valid cognition because it is an awareness, then it is not an awareness because it is a valid cognition.

original: 'jug pa yang rtogs pa med par ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang shin tu bzod par dka' ba yin no snyam du dgongs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang rtogs pa med par ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang shin tu bzod par dka' ba yin no snyam du dgongs nas bshad pa /
translated: If you think that it is very difficult to accept that it is a valid cognition because it engages its object, and that it engages its object because it is a valid cognition, then consider the following analogy.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin yang de ltar mthong ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin yang de ltar mthong ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, inference does not apprehend a thing, but it is like seeing it.

original: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pas mi rtsod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni mi 'thad pas mi rtsod do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is thought that since it is not tenable to dispute what is seen, it is not disputed.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni /üîΩrjes su dpag pas ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi le'ur ro //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni / rjes su dpag pas ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi le'ur ro //
translated: That is stated in the line:üîΩ‚ÄúInference does not apprehend a thing, but it is like seeing it.‚Äù

original: blo nyid ces par gzung ba'i rnam par gcad bya brjod pa ni /üîΩmig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo nyid ces par gzung ba'i rnam par gcad bya brjod pa ni / mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe mind itself‚Äù are to be supplied in the passage:üîΩ‚ÄúThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not conscious of objects.‚ÄùüîΩThe words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are to be supplied in the passage:

original: sogs pa'i sgra sa ldan pa dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra sa ldan pa dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa bzung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not conscious of objects.‚Äù

original: mig gdangs kyang yid kyi nus pa nyams pas shes pa @261b ma skyes pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gdangs kyang yid kyi nus pa nyams pas shes pa @261b ma skyes pa la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the eyes are open, the power of the mind is impaired, and there is no engagement in the non-arisen consciousness.

original: gal te 'jug par byed pa'i blo tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'jug par byed pa'i blo tshad ma yin la /
translated: If the engaging cognition is valid cognition,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid chad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid chad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then conceptualization would be valid cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says conceptualization is...

original: shin tu goms pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'jug pa dmigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa la rnam par rtog pa med kyang 'jug pa dmigs pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that even without conceptualization in very familiar cases, engagement is observed.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa'i skabs nyid du mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa'i skabs nyid du mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: He concludes precisely in the context of the distinction.

original: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa sel ba'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa sel ba'o //
translated: The previous refers to the elimination of conceptualization.

original: blo nyid ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: blo nyid ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa gcod pa'o //
translated: The cognition itself refers to the elimination of the eyes, etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa gcod pa de nyid brjod pa ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcod pa de nyid brjod pa ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of that very elimination of conceptualization, etc. is conceptualization, etc.

original: 'o na ma goms pa'i yul la ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug byed yin pas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ma goms pa'i yul la ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug byed yin pas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says, Then for an unfamiliar object, conceptualization itself would be the engager and thus valid cognition,

original: goms pa med pa gang yin pa der ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms pa med pa gang yin pa der ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is not familiar‚Äù means that which is not well known.üîΩIn some cases, a convention of identity is applied to something that is based on a particular time.üîΩThat is, ‚Äúas much as‚Äù is based on a particular time.

original: 'ga' zhig gang gi dus kyi khyad par la brten pa can la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang gi dus kyi khyad par la brten pa can la /
translated: It is based on a particular time, and it is based on a particular place.

original: gcig nyid kyi tha snyad brtan po zhugs pa de snyed de ni'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi tha snyad brtan po zhugs pa de snyed de ni'o //

original: gzhan la med pa'i 'dra ba'i khyad par gyis byas pa /üîΩbar du chod pa med na 'gyur ba yin te ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan la med pa'i 'dra ba'i khyad par gyis byas pa / bar du chod pa med na 'gyur ba yin te ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩIn the same way, the object of doubt is also based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩTherefore, the object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.

original: de bzhin du the tshom gyi yul yang de 'dra ba'i 'dra ba mthong ba'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba gcig nyid du grub pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid do //üîΩ'o na rjes su dpag pa 'di skad cig 'jig pa la gnod par byed do zhe na /üîΩma yin te gcig nyid kyi tha snyad tsam grub pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.

original: gal te nges pa yang gcig gi tha snyad nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nges pa yang gcig gi tha snyad nyid ma yin nam /
translated: The object of doubt is based on a particular time, a particular place, a particular state, a particular similarity, and a particular absence of obstruction.üîΩThe

original: des na dus tha dad pa la gcig nyid du nges pa ci ltar skad cig ma nyid du nges pa dang mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te kun rdzob kyi gcig nyid du tha snyad bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dus tha dad pa la gcig nyid du nges pa ci ltar skad cig ma nyid du nges pa dang mi 'gal zhe na ma yin te kun rdzob kyi gcig nyid du tha snyad bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //

original: des na dus tha dad pa la gzhan nyid bkag kyang 'chad pa med do //
analyzed: des na dus tha dad pa la gzhan nyid bkag kyang 'chad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, even though difference in time is refuted, there is no contradiction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir stor ba pa'i rnyed pas na bdag po nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir stor ba pa'i rnyed pas na bdag po nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the existence of the self is not contradicted by the fact that the self is not perceived.

original: don dam pa gcig nyid ci ste mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: don dam pa gcig nyid ci ste mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is ultimate oneness not established?

original: ma yin te don dam pa'i gcig dang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te don dam pa'i gcig dang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not, because the ultimate is not established as one or as pervasive.

original: brda grub pas ni khyab pa rnyed par gyur to //
analyzed: brda grub pas ni khyab pa rnyed par gyur to //
translated: Pervasiveness is established by the establishment of the sign.

original: ma la sogs pa la spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa la spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to abandon the view of self with regard to mother, etc.

analyzed: de bas na gang du ma goms pa'i phyir tha snyad pa'i gcig pa nyid ma grub pa der ni ngo shes pa la sogs pa @262a * //
translated: Therefore, where conventional oneness is not established because of lack of familiarity, there recognition, etc.

original: gzung ngo // der yang rnam par dbyer med par 'jug pa can don gcig byed pa /
analyzed: gzung ngo // der yang rnam par dbyer med par 'jug pa can don gcig byed pa /
translated: And there, too, it is a single object, which is the basis of the operation of the nondifferentiated cognition.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la /
translated: It is a certain form, etc.üîΩIt is that which is the basis of the stable convention of oneness.

original: gang zhig la gcig nyid kyi tha snyad brtan po yod pa de la log par rtogs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig tu de lta bu'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig la gcig nyid kyi tha snyad brtan po yod pa de la log par rtogs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig tu de lta bu'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is that which is the basis of the convention of oneness, and it is that which is the basis of the convention of difference.

analyzed: gal te de ltar yon tan yang bsal ba la sngon po zhes bya ba ni / sngon po'i sgras brjod par bya ba ste /

original: brda'i dus bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur bas des na gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyams so zhe na /
analyzed: brda'i dus bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad rjes su dpag par 'gyur bas des na gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba de nyams so zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is the expression of the quality of blueness.

original: de skad du ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de skad du ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúblue‚Äù is the

original: 'di ltar gang du shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum nyid tha snyad kyi rgyu yin zhing rnam par rtog pa ni tshogs pa nye ba la skye ba de thams cad du ni rnam par rtog pa tshad mar mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum nyid tha snyad kyi rgyu yin zhing rnam par rtog pa ni tshogs pa nye ba la skye ba de thams cad du ni rnam par rtog pa tshad mar mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, where there is a very clear perception, it is the cause of a convention, and where there is a conception, it arises in dependence on a collection. In all such cases, it is not tenable that conception is a valid cognition,

original: log par rtags pa'i yul nyid la ltos nas tshad ma'i go skabs 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par rtags pa'i yul nyid la ltos nas tshad ma'i go skabs 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opportunity for a valid cognition is tenable in dependence on the very object of a mistaken conception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid 'di'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni mthong ba gnyis snang ba tsam la gzung ba 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid 'di'o snyam pa'i shes pa ni mthong ba gnyis snang ba tsam la gzung ba 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Therefore the cognition thinking ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù is the apprehension of an object in mere appearance to the two eyes.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa don dam pa'i gcig nyid la ni rang rgyud pa'i dam bca' ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa don dam pa'i gcig nyid la ni rang rgyud pa'i dam bca' ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa yin zhing /
translated: In the case of the other‚Äôs thesis of ultimate oneness, it is not a valid cognition in the case of the Svatantrikas.

original: kun rdzob pa'i gcig nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i gcig nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
translated: In the case of conventional oneness, it is an inference.üîΩThis is the position.

original: de bzhin gzhan du yang ltar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan du yang ltar rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is also reasonable to apply this method to other cases.

original: 'di ltar sngon po la yang mngon sum gyi 'jug pa bsal na sngon por rnam par rtog pa gzung ba 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po la yang mngon sum gyi 'jug pa bsal na sngon por rnam par rtog pa gzung ba 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, if the engagement of direct perception in blue is refuted, then the apprehension of the conception of blue is the apprehension of the object.

original: mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin zhing /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin zhing /
translated: The unclear one is inference.

original: sngon po'i yon tan gzhan dang ldan pa la ltos nas ni dngos po can ma yin pa'i dam bca' tsam tshad ma ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i yon tan gzhan dang ldan pa la ltos nas ni dngos po can ma yin pa'i dam bca' tsam tshad ma ma yin pa yin no //
translated: In dependence on the possession of another quality of blue, the mere thesis that is not an entity is not a valid cognition.

original: the tshom pa'i dngos po can ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: the tshom pa'i dngos po can ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhes gnas so //
translated: The one that has a doubtful entity is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te mngon sum la yang 'jug par byed pa yin zhing /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum la yang 'jug par byed pa yin zhing /
translated: If it is said that direct perception is also the engagement,

original: 'khor pa yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa tsam nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'khor pa yang 'jug pa dang ldog pa tsam nyid yin na /
translated: and the retinue is just the engagement and disengagement,

original: de ci ltar yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba las rnam par rtog pa nyid spang bya yin te /
analyzed: de ci ltar yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba las rnam par rtog pa nyid spang bya yin te /
translated: then how is that accomplished? Conceptualization is to be abandoned.

original: nyes pa bzhin du dran pa tsam ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: nyes pa bzhin du dran pa tsam ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is not just the memory of a fault,

original: mngon sum gyis yul gcig pa nyid bsal ba'i ngo shes pa las cir 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis yul gcig pa nyid bsal ba'i ngo shes pa las cir 'gyur te /
translated: then what is the point of recognizing the object of direct perception as the same,

original: @262b spros pas chog go //
analyzed: @262b spros pas chog go //
translated: since it is enough to elaborate?

original: rigs pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of reasoning is:

original: 'di ni don gzhan dang gzhan dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni don gzhan dang gzhan dran pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gnyis yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is because the two cognitions are of the nature of remembering other and other objects.

original: de ltar gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs te /
