translated: Thus, it has been established that recognition is not a valid cognition in regard to the object of apprehension.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate that the opponent‚Äôs assertion that the object of the dispute is the identity of the prior and the subsequent is untenable, it is stated that the cognition of recognition does not depend on the activity of direct perception.

original: snga ma dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid rtsod pa'i yul yin no zhes gang brjod pa mi bzod pas de la ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa mngon sum gyi byed pa la mi ltos pa ni dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no zhes bstan
analyzed: snga ma dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid rtsod pa'i yul yin no zhes gang brjod pa mi bzod pas de la ngo shes pa'i rtogs pa mngon sum gyi byed pa la mi ltos pa ni dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin no zhes bstan
translated: This is merely an assertion, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, the opponent‚Äôs objection is anticipated:

original: gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig nyid rtsod pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig nyid rtsod pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWell, then, how can identity be the object of dispute?‚Äù

original: rtogs shing nyams su myong ba yin gyi lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs shing nyams su myong ba yin gyi lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: It is understood and experienced, and it is not merely a case of clinging to something as being more than it is.

original: des na mngon sum gyi bsal ba ma grub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi bsal ba ma grub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the refutation of direct perception is not established.

original: sun 'byin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the refutation is as follows:

original: re zhig phyi ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis snga ma mi 'dzin na zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyi ma 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis snga ma mi 'dzin na zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin te /
translated: First, it is established that the later cognition apprehending the second moment does not apprehend the first moment.

original: de lta ma yin na skad cig gcig bzung na dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag bzung bar thal na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skad cig gcig bzung na dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag bzung bar thal na /
translated: Otherwise, if one moment were apprehended, it would follow that all the moments of time would be apprehended,

original: de lta bu ni dbang po'i byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni dbang po'i byed pa ma yin no //
translated: but that is not the function of the sense faculties.

original: mngon sum las snga ma rigs na snga ma de dang phyi ma gcig pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum las snga ma rigs na snga ma de dang phyi ma gcig pa la tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If the earlier were apprehended by direct perception, then the earlier and the later would not be the same, because there would be no direct perception of the earlier.

original: mngon sum med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthere would be no direct perception.‚Äù

original: gal te snga ma'i rang bzhin ma rig mod de /
analyzed: gal te snga ma'i rang bzhin ma rig mod de /
translated: Even if the nature of the earlier is not known,

original: de lta na yang de dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: what contradiction is there in understanding it to be the same as that?

original: ma rtogs pa med pa dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa med pa dang zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere would be no non-understanding of what is not understood.‚Äù

original: des nyams su myong pa med par ni de la brten pa'i gcig pa nyid nyams su myong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: des nyams su myong pa med par ni de la brten pa'i gcig pa nyid nyams su myong bar mi nus so //
translated: Without experiencing it, one cannot experience the sameness based on that.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis don grub pa gcig tsam du rtogs pas ni brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis don grub pa gcig tsam du rtogs pas ni brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par mi 'grub po //
translated: But the mere realization of the object as just the nature of itself does not establish the particularity that is intended to be expressed.

original: de'i phyir snga ma dang lhan cig gcig ni mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir snga ma dang lhan cig gcig ni mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since one of the two is refuted by perception,

original: shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: it is not the object of consciousness.

original: des na ngo shes pa ni rang rgyud pa dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ngo shes pa ni rang rgyud pa dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intention is that recognition is only an autonomous thesis, but not a valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du sngon gyi dus su mngon sum las phyi ma rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon gyi dus su mngon sum las phyi ma rigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be seen that the statement ‚ÄúThe latter is not reasonable from the perspective of direct perception in the past‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag las don dam par gcig nyid med pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snga ma dang phyi ma dag las don dam par gcig nyid med pa des na'o //
translated: Because ultimately there is no identity between the former and the latter.

original: kun rdzob ni rnam par rtog @263a * //üîΩpa yin la /üîΩdes gzhag pa ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi de nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni rnam par rtog @263a * // pa yin la / des gzhag pa ni kun rdzob pa yin gyi de nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The conventional is conceptual.

original: snga ma snga ma'i rtogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i rtogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is established by that is conventional, but that itself is expressed as ‚Äúby the realization of the former.‚Äù

original: dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma nyed ma yin no zhes bya bas mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dam bcas pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma nyed ma yin no zhes bya bas mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
translated: The conclusion is: It is merely a thesis, not a valid cognition.

original: kun rdzob pa'i rtogs pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i rtogs pa 'di la'o //
translated: This is in regard to the understanding of the conventional.

original: rang gi don la aa nam gyi rkyen bcug pas na kun rdzob pa zhes brjod kyang kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi don la aa nam gyi rkyen bcug pas na kun rdzob pa zhes brjod kyang kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Although it is said conventional by inserting the suffix -tva, it means the object called conventional.

original: yan lag can gcig nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag can gcig nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation in terms of the power of the conception of a single whole is:

original: bum sogs zhes bya ba'o shes pa ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bum sogs zhes bya ba'o shes pa ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: The cognition of pot, etc. is the excessive adherence to a single cognition.

original: shes de dag ces bya ba ni rol sogs pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: shes de dag ces bya ba ni rol sogs pa'i shes pas so //
translated: The phrase those cognitions refers to the cognitions of color, etc.

original: tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the conception of a whole, the apprehension of an object is not a valid cognition.

original: yan lag can gyi shes pa gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par bstan nas dam bca' tsam du ston pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi shes pa gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par bstan nas dam bca' tsam du ston pa ni /
translated: Having taught that the cognition of a whole is not a valid cognition because it apprehends an object, he shows it to be merely a thesis:

original: tshogs pa las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Apart from the collection, etc.

original: gzhan gyi kun du 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi kun du 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the grasping of others.

original: nyams pa ni dka' sar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: nyams pa ni dka' sar phyin pa ste /
translated: The seventh is the loss of the path, which is like going to a difficult place.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro // de ltar tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //
translated: This is because one is separated from the right view.üîΩThus, the cognition that is not deceived by the valid cognition

original: shes pa zhes bya ba'i slu ba smos pa bshad na /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba'i slu ba smos pa bshad na /
translated: is called ‚Äúnondeceptive.‚ÄùüîΩNow, in the explanation of the word ‚Äúcognition‚Äù in the PramƒÅ·πáavƒÅrttika,

original: rnam 'grel gyi shes pa'i tshig bshad pa la skabs dang mtshams kyi sbyor ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sgo nas gzhan dag gi rgol ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi shes pa'i tshig bshad pa la skabs dang mtshams kyi sbyor ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sgo nas gzhan dag gi rgol ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: first, in order to connect with the context, the opponent‚Äôs objection is stated with ‚ÄúIf it is said that . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe ngo shes par bya ba'i yan lag can gcig nyid med cing gzung ba'i dngos po yang zhig pas 'thob par mi nus pa dang / byed ba nyid thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngo shes par bya ba'i yan lag can gcig nyid med cing gzung ba'i dngos po yang zhig pas 'thob par mi nus pa dang / byed ba nyid thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When there is no single whole that is recognized and the apprehended object is destroyed, it cannot be obtained, and because the action itself is shared,

original: gnyi ga yang dor ba na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dor ba na /
translated: both are rejected.

original: bcom ldan 'das su gyur nas gzhan ci zhig lus she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das su gyur nas gzhan ci zhig lus she na /
translated: If the Blessed One has become that, what else remains?

original: bden te mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i don ni phyi rol la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: bden te mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i don ni phyi rol la ltos pa yin te /
translated: True, but the meaning of the statement that perception is engaged is that it is dependent on the external.

original: gzhan rig pa ni de la 'jug par byed pas don grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan rig pa ni de la 'jug par byed pas don grub pa yin la /
translated: Since the cognition of another is engaged in that, the meaning is established.

original: nyams su myong par mngon par rlom pa yang de bzhin byas pas yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong par mngon par rlom pa yang de bzhin byas pas yin no //
translated: And the conceit of experience is also made in the same way.

original: de kho na nyid du ni rnam par rtog pa med pa rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyis mthar thug pas na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni rnam par rtog pa med pa rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyis mthar thug pas na /
translated: But in reality, since it is nonconceptual and terminates in its own nature alone,

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis gzhan rig par sgro 'dogs pa na 'jug @263b par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis gzhan rig par sgro 'dogs pa na 'jug @263b par byed pa yin no //
translated: it is engaged in the superimposition of the cognition of another by means of conceptual thought.

original: des na nyes par byed pa ni de nyid la nges pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa spangs pa na /
analyzed: des na nyes par byed pa ni de nyid la nges pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa spangs pa na /
translated: Therefore, since it is ascertained in reality, when conceptual thought is abandoned,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das gnas pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das gnas pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mi 'gal lo //
translated: the Blessed One abides in a nonconceptual nature, and so there is no contradiction.

original: da ni rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang blo tshad mar sgrub par 'dod nas sngar gyi rjes su brjod pa las 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: da ni rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang blo tshad mar sgrub par 'dod nas sngar gyi rjes su brjod pa las 'jug par byed do //
translated: Now, wishing to establish valid cognition in another way, he engages in the following statement.

original: 'dod pa bsgrub pa la 'jug pa ni tshad ma las don du gnyer ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub pa la 'jug pa ni tshad ma las don du gnyer ba yin la /
translated: Engaging in the accomplishment of what is desired is the pursuit of the goal through valid cognition.

original: de yang yul gyi khyad par yongs su bcad pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu gnyi ga la ltos nas don bya ba don du gnyer ba rnams tshang ma tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul gyi khyad par yongs su bcad pa med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bu gnyi ga la ltos nas don bya ba don du gnyer ba rnams tshang ma tshol ba yin no //
translated: And since that cannot occur without the ascertainment of the specific object, those who pursue the goal in relation to both effects seek the ascertainment.

original: gal te yang rang la rag las pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang rang la rag las pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu gtso bo yin la /
translated: Even though ascertainment through one's own reliance is the primary effect of valid cognition,

original: 'jug pa ni skyes bu la ltos pas nges pa ma yin pa de lta na yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa la 'jug pa na tshad ma nye bar mkho ba yin pa des na /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni skyes bu la ltos pas nges pa ma yin pa de lta na yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa la 'jug pa na tshad ma nye bar mkho ba yin pa des na /
translated: and engagement is not ascertained because it depends on the person, still, when engaging in accomplishing the desires of the person, valid cognition is necessary.üîΩTherefore,

original: de la ltos nas 'jug pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtso bo yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dang po blo tshad mar sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ltos nas 'jug pa nyid 'bras bu'i gtso bo yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dang po blo tshad mar sgrub pa yin no //
translated: In relation to that, the first is the establishment of the mind as valid knowledge, from the perspective of engagement being the principal result.

original: des na de'i yan lag nyid kyis yongs su gcod pas tshad mar bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de'i yan lag nyid kyis yongs su gcod pas tshad mar bsgrub par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it is established as valid knowledge by the very branch of that.

original: rtogs pa ni khong du chud /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni khong du chud /
translated: Realization is understanding.

original: yongs su bcad pa de nyid ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa de nyid ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That very determination is the result.

original: de'i yul rnam par 'byed pa ni chu rtogs kyi me ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul rnam par 'byed pa ni chu rtogs kyi me ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The differentiation of its object is the realization, not the fire.

original: de'i rgyu yin pas na shes pa nyid tshad mar bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pas na shes pa nyid tshad mar bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is the cause of that, it should be understood that consciousness itself is taught as valid knowledge,

original: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: not the eye and so on.

original: de yod na 'di yod phyir dang // zhes bya ba de na yod pa'i dang rnam par 'grel pas ni /
analyzed: de yod na 'di yod phyir dang // zhes bya ba de na yod pa'i dang rnam par 'grel pas ni /
translated: The phrase because when this exists, that exists is an analysis of the term that exists.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word also is used for another.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word not is used for the eye and so on.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said because of this.

original: bshad pa ni 'jug par byed pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'jug par byed pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúbecause it engages . . .‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar 'jug par byed pa las ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'jug par byed pa las ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that a valid cognition is necessarily an engagement,

original: 'on kyang gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad ba las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gdon mi za bar yongs su bcad ba las yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but rather that it is necessarily a determination.

original: shes pa dang yongs su bcad pa de'i bdag nyid yin yang tha dad par brjod par 'dod pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du rnam par dbye ba yin no//
analyzed: shes pa dang yongs su bcad pa de'i bdag nyid yin yang tha dad par brjod par 'dod pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed du rnam par dbye ba yin no//
translated: Even though the cognition and the determination are of the same nature, the desire to express them as distinct is the distinction between the probandum and the proof.

original: @264a * // tshad ma ni thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa ste /
analyzed: @264a * // tshad ma ni thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause a valid cognition is that which obtains . . .‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: tshad ma ni 'dod pa thob pa'i don kho nar tshol ba yin gyi rtogs par bya ba'i don ni ma yin te zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni 'dod pa thob pa'i don kho nar tshol ba yin gyi rtogs par bya ba'i don ni ma yin te zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The opponent thinks that a valid cognition is that which seeks only the object that is desired to be obtained, but not the object that is to be understood.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i thob par byed pa'i nus pa bar du gegs byed pa dang / ma tshang ba thams cad rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'i tshad ma'i thob par byed pa'i nus pa bar du gegs byed pa dang / ma tshang ba thams cad rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin gyi //
translated: The response is ‚Äúno, because . . . ‚Äù A valid cognition is not that which obtains, because it is not that which excludes all the obstructions and deficiencies that prevent the capacity to obtain.

original: 'on kyang don yongs su bcad pa'i sgo nas thob par byed pa rung ba nyid kyi tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang don yongs su bcad pa'i sgo nas thob par byed pa rung ba nyid kyi tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyi de nyid ces smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de nyid ces smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the other . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe nature of the other is the nature of the object.üîΩThe reply is, ‚ÄúThe nature of the object . . .‚Äù

original: thob par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: thob par byed pa'i nus pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the object is the nature of the cognition.üîΩThe meaning is that the ascertainment of the object is ascertained by the nature of the cognition.

original: lan ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the nondeceptive . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe nature of the nondeceptive is the nature of the object.üîΩThe meaning is this.

original: gang la thob par byed pa rung ba nges par 'gyur ba shes pa 'di'i rang bzhin goms pa las 'khrul pa mtha' dag bsal bar de 'dra ba rang rig pas mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la thob par byed pa rung ba nges par 'gyur ba shes pa 'di'i rang bzhin goms pa las 'khrul pa mtha' dag bsal bar de 'dra ba rang rig pas mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ascertainment of the object is ascertained by the nature of the cognition.

original: gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin zhes smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the nondeceptive . . .‚Äù

original: thob pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: thob pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the nondeceptive is the nature of the object.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: 'di ni yul gzhan snang ba nyid yin gyi snang ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid la re zhig tshad ma yod pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ni yul gzhan snang ba nyid yin gyi snang ba tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid la re zhig tshad ma yod pa yin /
translated: This is the appearance of another object, not just an appearance. This is the meaning.

original: de'i don bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba thob pa la mi 'khrul ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i don bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba thob pa la mi 'khrul ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is not mistaken with regard to the obtainment of the occurrence of its object?

original: gal te yang 'khrul bar dogs pa dang bral bar lhag par zhen pa de yang ci dngos po zhig ci lta ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci yod de /
analyzed: gal te yang 'khrul bar dogs pa dang bral bar lhag par zhen pa de yang ci dngos po zhig ci lta ba yin nam ma yin zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci yod de /
translated: Moreover, what certainty is there that the conception of the absence of error is a real entity, or that it is not?

original: rmi lam du gzhan du yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam du gzhan du yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is observed otherwise in dreams.

original: des na thob pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin ci ltar nges zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na thob pa la mi 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin ci ltar nges zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, how can the nature of non-error with regard to obtainment be ascertained?

original: 'di la lan 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this, he says, ‚ÄúWell then, it should be explained.‚Äù

original: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas su'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt should be explained‚Äù means in the appropriate place.

original: de'i phyir 'di tsam du ring bar ma bskyal ba rnam par chad pa nyid du gsal bar mdun na snang ba rnams la dngos po 'dzin pa rnam par 'dzin pa yin la de bzhin du gegs byed pa dang / ma tshang ba med na don bya ba yang thob pa kho na'o zhes lhag par zhen par brtan pa las mi 'khrul ba nyid du rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di tsam du ring bar ma bskyal ba rnam par chad pa nyid du gsal bar mdun na snang ba rnams la dngos po 'dzin pa rnam par 'dzin pa yin la de bzhin du gegs byed pa dang / ma tshang ba med na don bya ba yang thob pa kho na'o zhes lhag par zhen par brtan pa las mi 'khrul ba nyid du rnam par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, when the object is not far from the sense faculty, it is clearly seen as interrupted. When it is in front of one, one grasps the object, one grasps the image. In the same way, when there is no obstruction and nothing is missing, one definitely obtains the object. Thus, one is firmly attached to the idea that the means of valid knowledge is nonerroneous.

original: thob par rung ba'i tshad ma nyid 'di la log pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par rung ba'i tshad ma nyid 'di la log pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the measure of valid knowledge in terms of the conventional truth of error.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas ni aa rtsa ta la sogs @264b pa'i lugs bsal na thob par bya ba'i don la mi 'khrul ba nyid tshad ma yin par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas ni aa rtsa ta la sogs @264b pa'i lugs bsal na thob par bya ba'i don la mi 'khrul ba nyid tshad ma yin par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: In terms of the conventional truth of reality, when the systems of Asatƒ´ryapƒÅda and so on are refuted, valid knowledge is shown to be nonerroneous in terms of the object to be obtained.

original: 'o na bdag la sogs pa yang ci ste song zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag la sogs pa yang ci ste song zhe na /
translated: Well, why is it not so for the self and so on?

original: snang ba ci 'dra ba las mngon si /
analyzed: snang ba ci 'dra ba las mngon si /
translated: What is the appearance from which it is evident?

original: di rnam par gzhag pa dang / dngos sam brgyud pas mngon sum la brten pa'i tshul gsum yongs su dag pa'i sgrub byed las skyes par rnam par rtog pa ci 'dra ba zhig la rjes su dpag par rnam par bzhag la /
analyzed: di rnam par gzhag pa dang / dngos sam brgyud pas mngon sum la brten pa'i tshul gsum yongs su dag pa'i sgrub byed las skyes par rnam par rtog pa ci 'dra ba zhig la rjes su dpag par rnam par bzhag la /
translated: and the mode of positing the inferential sign, and the mode of generating the thought that is posited as the inference, which is born from the proof that is the pure trimodal condition, either directly or indirectly.

original: de dag gi yul du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yul du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the objects of those.

original: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: rnam par gnas pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that there would be no fixed rule.

original: yang ci ltar rtogs rnam par dbye ba shes pa la rag las snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar rtogs rnam par dbye ba shes pa la rag las snyam du dogs na /
translated: If one wonders, ‚ÄúHow is it that the understanding depends on the knowledge of the divisions?‚Äù

original: rnam 'grel rnam par phye nas ston pa ni dpe sngon rol du gyur pa nyid kyis na rnam pa gnyis pa phye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel rnam par phye nas ston pa ni dpe sngon rol du gyur pa nyid kyis na rnam pa gnyis pa phye ba'o //
translated: The explanation that analyzes the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava is the second division, because it is prior to the example.

original: shes pa rjod par byed pa'i yul gyi rnam pa'i sgras khyad par gyi don can tha dad pa'i sgra dang lhan cig bsdu ba ston par byed pa de'o //
analyzed: shes pa rjod par byed pa'i yul gyi rnam pa'i sgras khyad par gyi don can tha dad pa'i sgra dang lhan cig bsdu ba ston par byed pa de'o //
translated: The expression of the object of consciousness is the expression of the meaning of the qualifier together with the word different.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the aspect of the object.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means distinct.

original: thos pa'i phyir na yul gyi rnam pa can gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thos pa'i phyir na yul gyi rnam pa can gyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Because of hearing, it has the characteristic of the aspect of the object.

original: yul gyi rnam pa can tha dang pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i tshig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa can tha dang pa zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i tshig bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe aspect of the object is different‚Äù indicates the meaning of the compound.

original: de las blo'i rtogs pa tha dad pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de las blo'i rtogs pa tha dad pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the cognition is different from that.

original: de ltar gtso bo rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lugs brjod na /
analyzed: de ltar gtso bo rnam pa dang bcas pa'i lugs brjod na /
translated: Thus, having stated the system of the principal consciousness with an aspect,

original: de ni bye brag tu smra ba la bltas nas rnam pa med par khas blangs kyang tshul gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni bye brag tu smra ba la bltas nas rnam pa med par khas blangs kyang tshul gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: in response to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, although they assert that there is no aspect, it is explained that there is no other system.

original: yul la rnam pa tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul la rnam pa tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object has different aspects‚Äù is stated.

original: rjes su byed pa ni snang ba ste yul dang 'brel pa shes pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa ni snang ba ste yul dang 'brel pa shes pa'i chos so //
translated: ‚ÄúCorresponding‚Äù means appearing, the quality of consciousness that is related to the object.

original: gnyis pa de nyid mdor bsdus nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa de nyid mdor bsdus nas ston pa ni /
translated: The second is a brief presentation of that.

original: yul dang 'dra ba 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: yul dang 'dra ba 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa la ltos nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúLike the object‚Äù is from the point of view of the desire for the form.

original: yul la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i lugs la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul la mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i lugs la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDirected toward the object‚Äù is from the point of view of the system without form.

original: de tha dad pas zhes bya bas ni yul dang 'dra ba 'am yul la mngon du phyogs pa nyid tha dad pas so //üîΩrnam pa la sdang bas kyang gang las yul gyi khyad par rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa zhes pa'i rang la brten pa'i khyad @265a * //
analyzed: de tha dad pas zhes bya bas ni yul dang 'dra ba 'am yul la mngon du phyogs pa nyid tha dad pas so // rnam pa la sdang bas kyang gang las yul gyi khyad par rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa zhes pa'i rang la brten pa'i khyad @265a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the difference‚Äù means because of the difference between ‚Äúlike the object‚Äù and ‚Äúdirected toward the object.‚Äù

original: par 'ga' di zhig 'dod dgos so //
analyzed: par 'ga' di zhig 'dod dgos so //
translated: Also, because of the aversion to the form, it must be admitted that there is some difference based on itself, from which the difference of the object is understood and established.

original: rtog pa tha dad pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni sngon po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pa tha dad pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni sngon po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression of the different conceptualization is ‚Äúblue,‚Äù

original: bar med par ni nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar med par ni nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means that it is not possible without a break.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'dra ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe yul dang 'dra ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa yin gyi bems po'i bdag nyid gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam pa las phyi rol rig ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa 'dra ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe yul dang 'dra ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa yin gyi bems po'i bdag nyid gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam pa las phyi rol rig ce na /
translated: When there is similarity of aspect, then it is cognition of an essence that is similar to the object, not of another essence that is material. So how can there be cognition of something external to the aspect?

original: de'i rnam par rig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is cognition of its aspect.

original: de'i rnam pa'i shes pa rig pa gang yin pa de nyid sngon po'i rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i shes pa rig pa gang yin pa de nyid sngon po'i rig pa yin no //
translated: That cognition of its aspect is itself cognition of blue.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa'i khyad par nyid las rtogs pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa'i khyad par nyid las rtogs pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, the difference in the cognition is due to the difference in the aspect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu yang rnam pa gnyis yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: That is why it is said that the effect is also twofold.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //üîΩre zhig rnam pa med pa la ni don rtogs pa nyid 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o // re zhig rnam pa med pa la ni don rtogs pa nyid 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The effect of valid cognition is as follows.üîΩIn the case of cognition without an aspect, the effect is just the understanding of the object.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa la yang dpyod pa dang bral ba la ltos nas de nyid yin no//
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa la yang dpyod pa dang bral ba la ltos nas de nyid yin no//
translated: In the case of cognition with an aspect, that is the effect, in relation to cognition that is free from doubt.

original: dpyod pa dang ldan pa la ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang ldan pa la ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa kho na don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: For one who is endowed with analysis, the realization of the object is just the realization of its own nature.

original: des na de kho na nyid du yul gzhag pa 'bras bu tshad ma la rag lus so zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid du yul gzhag pa 'bras bu tshad ma la rag lus so zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the positing of an object in reality depends on valid cognition as its effect.

original: khungs brjod pa ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khungs brjod pa ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The source is stated with ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: rnam pa tha dad pa las yul du rtogs pa tha dad pa yin mod shes pa tshad ma yin pa'i skabs la ci phan zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa las yul du rtogs pa tha dad pa yin mod shes pa tshad ma yin pa'i skabs la ci phan zhe na /
translated: Even though the different aspects of the object are the different realizations of the object, what is the use of this in the context of valid cognition being knowledge?

original: yul gyi rnam pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThat aspect of the object . . .‚Äù

original: 'di yang 'og tu ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu bsam par ro //
analyzed: 'di yang 'og tu ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu bsam par ro //
translated: This will be shown later, in the chapter on valid cognition and its effect.

original: gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand ‚Äúthat which is related to the eye and so on.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rnam pa de 'brel par gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa de 'brel par gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Similarly, that aspect is not related.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: How? etc.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-difference, because of non-difference from the object of knowledge.

original: sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid bya ba la rnam par zhes bya ba la lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid bya ba la rnam par zhes bya ba la lhag ma'o //
translated: The best means of proof is the highest means of proof.

original: gal te de lta na yang mig la sogs pa byed par ci ste mi 'dod ce na sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang mig la sogs pa byed par ci ste mi 'dod ce na sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is so, why is it not accepted that the eye, etc. are the agents? He says: because of the best means of proof.

original: sgrub byed dam pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa ni byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @265b don to //
analyzed: sgrub byed dam pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa ni byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i @265b don to //
translated: The sense-faculties, etc. are not the agents because they are not the best means of proof. This is the meaning.

original: rnam par ji ltar sgrub byed dam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par ji ltar sgrub byed dam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the best means of proof?

original: sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dam pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: because of the best means of proof.

original: ston par 'gyur ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu bsam par ro //
analyzed: ston par 'gyur ba ni tshad ma dang 'bras bu bsam par ro //
translated: The teaching will be considered in terms of the valid cognition and the result.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If the eye, etc. are not the agents,

original: 'o na zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: then what? This is the question.

original: lan du rgyu mig la sogs pa la 'bras bu mthong ba btags pas so //üîΩdpar na rkun pos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lan du rgyu mig la sogs pa la 'bras bu mthong ba btags pas so // dpar na rkun pos zhes gsungs so //
translated: The answer is that the eye, etc. are figuratively designated as the result, seeing.üîΩFor example, when a thief is set free, the village is said to have been burned by the thief.

original: dper na rkun pos btang ba'i mes grong bsregs kyang rkun pos bsreg so zhes zer ba de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyis dngos po mthong ba yin yang mig la sogs pas mthong ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rkun pos btang ba'i mes grong bsregs kyang rkun pos bsreg so zhes zer ba de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las skyes pa'i mngon sum gyis dngos po mthong ba yin yang mig la sogs pas mthong ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, although a thing is seen by direct perception produced from the eye, etc., it is said that the eye, etc. see.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam pa nyid dang 'brel pas yul gyi khyad par rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa dang / 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa yang rtogs pa med na mi 'gyur ba yin ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam pa nyid dang 'brel pas yul gyi khyad par rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa dang / 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa yang rtogs pa med na mi 'gyur ba yin ;
translated: Because the distinction of the object is established by the mere aspect that is of the nature of consciousness, and because the engagement of one who seeks a result does not occur without the realization of that object,

original: de'i phyir shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'o //üîΩgal te rtogs pa tsam mam /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa tshad ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'o // gal te rtogs pa tsam mam /
translated: therefore, consciousness is valid knowledge. This is the conclusion.

original: 'jug pa tsam gyis ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa tsam gyis ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: If it is mere realization or mere engagement, it is not valid knowledge,

original: log pa'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even in erroneous consciousness.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa la 'jug par byed pas thob par byed pa ni mngon par 'dod par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa la 'jug par byed pas thob par byed pa ni mngon par 'dod par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin te /
translated: However, since it causes the attainment of realization, it is a valid cognition, because it is what is desired,üîΩsince one who seeks the result seeks the valid cognition.

original: 'bras bu don du gnyer bas tshad ma tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa na don dam par tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu don du gnyer bas tshad ma tshol ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa na don dam par tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: If you suspect this, then it is shown that ultimately it is not a valid cognition,

original: 'on kyang tha snyad pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: but rather it is conventional.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúIf it is said, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma rjes su dpag pas snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma rjes su dpag pas snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù means ‚ÄúIs it by direct perception or by inference?‚Äù

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po sel ba ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po sel ba ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: In this regard, first the refutation of the first position is ‚ÄúFirst, etc.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum thob par byed pa mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum thob par byed pa mi rtogs she na /
translated: Moreover, why is the attainment of direct perception not realized?

original: rang rig pa'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúSelf-awareness, etc.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'i mngon sum ni shes pa'i bdag nyid la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'i mngon sum ni shes pa'i bdag nyid la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-awareness‚Äù means that direct perception, such as the sense faculties, does not engage the nature of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i nges pa skyed na /üîΩde'i tshe 'ga' yang bslus pa'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i nges pa skyed na / de'i tshe 'ga' yang bslus pa'am /
translated: However, if one generates certainty that distinguishes valid and non-valid forms of reflexive awareness,üîΩthen at that time, no one would be deceived,

original: the tshom dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba te /
analyzed: the tshom dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba te /
translated: or would have doubts,üîΩbecause that [certainty] exists for all cognitions.

original: de ni shes pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni /üîΩde skyes @266a * //
analyzed: de ni shes pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed pa ni / de skyes @266a * //
translated: To teach this, [the root text] says,

original: bu'i dus nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bu'i dus nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe time of the person in whom that [certainty] arises . . .‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod pa'i lan no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyod pa'i lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut . . . ‚Äù and so forth is the response to the objection.

original: shes pa lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: shes pa lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe hiddenness of the hidden cognitions . . .‚Äù and so forth. Because of their hiddenness,

original: shes pa nyid rang las grub pa ma yin na /
analyzed: shes pa nyid rang las grub pa ma yin na /
translated: cognition itself is not established from itself.

original: de'i chos tshad ma lta ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i chos tshad ma lta ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could its property, valid cognition, exist? This is the meaning.

original: dpyod pa pa gnyi ga la yang 'thad par gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa pa gnyi ga la yang 'thad par gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the treatise in both the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka and NaiyƒÅyika is ‚ÄúBut . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las grub na de'i tshe 'ga' yang bslus pa'am the tshom du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba son 'dug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las grub na de'i tshe 'ga' yang bslus pa'am the tshom du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba son 'dug go zhe na /
translated: If even a nonvalid cognition were established from itself, then it would follow that no one would be deceived or doubtful.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa ni zhes smras te /üîΩgnod par byed pa'i shes pa las sam /üîΩrgyu dbang po'i skyon rab rib la sogs pa shes pa las blta bar bya ste /üîΩgnod dang rgyu ni nyes ldan par //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa ni zhes smras te / gnod par byed pa'i shes pa las sam / rgyu dbang po'i skyon rab rib la sogs pa shes pa las blta bar bya ste / gnod dang rgyu ni nyes ldan par //
translated: But it is said that a nonvalid cognitionüîΩis invalidated by a subsequent cognition that is valid, or

original: shes pa dag gis de dmigs sel //
analyzed: shes pa dag gis de dmigs sel //
translated: by a cognition of the fault in the cause of the cognition, such as diseased vision.

original: zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said,üîΩ‚ÄúThe object is eliminated by a cognition that is faulty or that has a faulty cause.‚Äù

original: gal te gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma gzhan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa yang tshad ma gzhan nyid yin na /
translated: If the fault is also a valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe thug pa med do zhes gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de'i tshe thug pa med do zhes gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: then there is an infinite regress.

original: 'dis ni tshad ma'o cog ni thams cad rang nyid las yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshad ma'o cog ni thams cad rang nyid las yin la /
translated: This shows that all valid cognitions are valid in themselves,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa ni gzhan las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa ni gzhan las yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and that nonvalid cognitions are invalid in relation to others.

original: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba gzhan kho na las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa zhes bya ba gzhan kho na las skye ba yin la /
translated: If it is said that the so-called consciousness arises from another,üîΩand that its valid knowledge does not arise from another, what is the connection? Or else, it is possible that the invalid cognition arises from itself.

original: de'i chos tshad ma ni gzhan las ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci 'brel yang na tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di spangs pa'i sgo nas phyogs gzhan ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
analyzed: de'i chos tshad ma ni gzhan las ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci 'brel yang na tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i dogs pa 'di spangs pa'i sgo nas phyogs gzhan ston pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
translated: In order to eliminate this qualm, the other position is presented with ‚ÄúMoreover, if the consciousness that arises . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: // bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: // bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows.

original: dper na shes pa rang skye ba'i don rgyu la ltos pa de bzhin du skyes zin pa'i shes pa tshad ma ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na shes pa rang skye ba'i don rgyu la ltos pa de bzhin du skyes zin pa'i shes pa tshad ma ni gzhan la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the arising of consciousness depends on a cause, so too the arisen consciousness, the valid knowledge, does not depend on another.

original: de'i de ni lhan cig skyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i de ni lhan cig skyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: That is because it is only coemergent.

original: shes pa skyes pa na ma skyes par sngar gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa skyes pa na ma skyes par sngar gnas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: When consciousness arises, it does not arise from what previously existed without arising.

original: des na spyir gnas pa ni dmigs kyis sel ba gzhan gyis gdon mi za bar bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na spyir gnas pa ni dmigs kyis sel ba gzhan gyis gdon mi za bar bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in general, what exists is necessarily eliminated by other exclusions.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na yang rang nyid las ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na yang rang nyid las ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, even though it is not a valid cognition, it is not from itself.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni gal te shes pa rnams kyi spyir btub pa'i tshad ma de dmigs kyis @266b bsal ba'i yul spangs nas nges pa'i yul la rang nyid gnas sam /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni gal te shes pa rnams kyi spyir btub pa'i tshad ma de dmigs kyis @266b bsal ba'i yul spangs nas nges pa'i yul la rang nyid gnas sam /
translated: If a valid cognition is refuted in general, and then a specific object is excluded and the object of ascertainment is established,

original: 'on te thams cad du khyab pa dmigs kyis sel bas rang gi yul dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad du khyab pa dmigs kyis sel bas rang gi yul dang bral ba ni /
translated: or if it is excluded by a pervader, and the object is separated from its own object,

original: gnas de la phyogs dang po la ni bsal ba thob pa yin pa rang nyid las tsha dam 'am /
analyzed: gnas de la phyogs dang po la ni bsal ba thob pa yin pa rang nyid las tsha dam 'am /
translated: in that case, in the first position, the refutation is established from itself.

original: tshad ma ma yin des pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin des pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not by a valid cognition or a non-valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par 'ga' zhig las yin no //
translated: But rather, it is from some specific feature.

original: khyad par de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod dgos te /
analyzed: khyad par de yang gdon mi za bar 'dod dgos te /
translated: And that specific feature must undoubtedly be accepted.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par phye nas tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par phye nas tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the distinction between valid cognition and non-valid cognition would not be made.

original: des na gnyi ga yang gzhan kho na las nges par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga yang gzhan kho na las nges par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, both must be ascertained from something else.

original: 'on te bsal bam thob pa yang rang nyid las tshad mang nges na /
analyzed: 'on te bsal bam thob pa yang rang nyid las tshad mang nges na /
translated: But if the ascertainment of validity or invalidity is definitely from itself,

original: de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa nges pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang rang nyid las nges so zhes bya bar 'gyur re //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa nges pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi ga yang rang nyid las nges so zhes bya bar 'gyur re //
translated: then the ascertainment of invalidity would be like that, and so both would be ascertained from themselves.

original: des na phyogs gnyis pa nyid khyed kyis mdun du byas pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na phyogs gnyis pa nyid khyed kyis mdun du byas pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, you have taken the second position yourself.

original: /'di la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: /'di la yang rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, there are two alternatives:

original: shes pa thams cad la khyab pa'i rang nyid las tshad ma yin pa de /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad la khyab pa'i rang nyid las tshad ma yin pa de /
translated: Is the validity of all consciousnesses from itself,

original: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa 'am ma skyes pa zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las skyes pa 'am ma skyes pa zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: arisen from its own cause or not arisen?

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang pos sel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang pos sel bar byed pa ni /
translated: Regarding the first alternative, the refutation is this:

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o//
translated: If it is arisen, etc.

original: de ltar skyes zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skyes zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid du skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen in that way‚Äù means arisen as valid cognition.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means as the nature of invalid cognition.

original: gnod par byed pas ni med pa sgro btags pa la med pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pas ni med pa sgro btags pa la med pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The opponent is made to understand that the nonexistent is not superimposed.

original: yod pa 'jig par byed cing med pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa 'jig par byed cing med pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the existent is destroyed and the nonexistent is produced.

original: ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa kho na la tshad ma'i tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa kho na la tshad ma'i tha snyad mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the designation of valid cognition is seen only in the case of correct understanding.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa tshad ma'i bdag nyid du skyes pa de'i tshe dngos po'i gnas par tshad ma nyid gnas pa 'ga' zhig tu gnod byed pas gzhig par bya ba'i yin par 'gyur na de rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa tshad ma'i bdag nyid du skyes pa de'i tshe dngos po'i gnas par tshad ma nyid gnas pa 'ga' zhig tu gnod byed pas gzhig par bya ba'i yin par 'gyur na de rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: When cognition arises in the nature of valid cognition, then at that time, since it abides as valid cognition in the mode of being of things, it would be destroyed by some opposing factor. But this is not reasonable, he says.

original: bram ze rnams la ni zho byin la /
analyzed: bram ze rnams la ni zho byin la /
translated: To the brahmins, curd was given,

original: dar ba ni koondi n+ya la byin cig ces bya ba 'dir dngos po'i gnas pas koo ndi n+ya la zho byin pa nyid yod pa dmigs kyis sel bas 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dar ba ni koondi n+ya la byin cig ces bya ba 'dir dngos po'i gnas pas koo ndi n+ya la zho byin pa nyid yod pa dmigs kyis sel bas 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and to Kau·πá·∏çinya, milk. Here, by the mode of being of things, the giving of curd to Kau·πá·∏çinya is not negated by the exclusion of what is observed.

original: 'on kyang bram ze rnams la zhes spyir brjod pa las sgro btags pa @267a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang bram ze rnams la zhes spyir brjod pa las sgro btags pa @267a * //
translated: However, since it is said in general, ‚Äúto the brahmins,‚Äù it is an exaggeration.

original: 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa yin te /
translated: But the word ‚Äúbrahmans‚Äù is used in a general sense, and the passage is to be interpreted as a denial of the application of the word ‚Äúbrahman‚Äù to those who are not real brahmans.

original: bsam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi don nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi don nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the meaning of a statement is not fixed by the speaker‚Äôs intention.

original: gal te der yang bram ze rnams la zho sbyin par smra ba ci ltar thos pa'i don med na /
analyzed: gal te der yang bram ze rnams la zho sbyin par smra ba ci ltar thos pa'i don med na /
translated: If the statement ‚Äúcurds should be given to the brahmans‚Äù is not to be taken literally,

original: mi 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe koo ndi n+ya la zho sbyin pa yang dngos po'i lugs su gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yin na de'i tshe koo ndi n+ya la zho sbyin pa yang dngos po'i lugs su gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: then why should the statement ‚Äúcurds should be given to Kau·πá·∏çinya‚Äù be taken literally?

original: ci ltar dgag ste shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i tshad ma nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dgag ste shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i tshad ma nyid bzhin no //
translated: How can it be denied? It is just like the validity of a cognition.

original: de'i phyir spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba dag ni ngag dag la gnas pa yin gyi dngos po'i gnas pa 'jug par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba dag ni ngag dag la gnas pa yin gyi dngos po'i gnas pa 'jug par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the general statement and the exception are both to be taken as applying to the words of the text, not to the way things really are.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sel ba ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second misconception is eliminated by the passage beginning ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: sems pa'i rang bzhin can gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su song ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa'i rang bzhin can gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su song ba'o //
translated: The nature of the mind is to be present in all situations.

original: btags pa'i rdzas ni bdag yin la de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam grangs ni shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yin no //üîΩtshad ma yang dag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: btags pa'i rdzas ni bdag yin la de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rnam grangs ni shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yin no // tshad ma yang dag pa kho na yin te /
translated: The substance that is designated is the self, and the synonyms that are its nature are consciousness, pleasure, and so on.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag brtag pa ni 'ga' las kyang skyes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag brtag pa ni 'ga' las kyang skyes pa ma yin la /
translated: It is a valid cognition because it is the nature of consciousness.

original: de'i rang bzhin shes pa yang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba ma yin te /üîΩde'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes phyir 'jil bar sel na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin shes pa yang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba ma yin te / de'i bdag nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes phyir 'jil bar sel na /
translated: The self is not produced from anything, and the consciousness that is its nature is not produced in any way,üîΩbecause it is not produced by itself.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni ma skyes par khas long zhing bdag gi rang bzhin lhag pa yang gnod mod /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni ma skyes par khas long zhing bdag gi rang bzhin lhag pa yang gnod mod /
translated: If you refute this, saying that the refutation is not produced, and that the remainder of the nature of the self is harmed,

original: rnam par shes pa tshad mas khyab na gnod par byed pa'i go skabs ci yod snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tshad mas khyab na gnod par byed pa'i go skabs ci yod snyam du bsams nas /
translated: then what opportunity is there to harm if consciousness is pervaded by valid knowledge?üîΩThinking this, he says:

original: gnod par byed pa stong yod kyang //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa stong yod kyang // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even though there are a thousand refutations,

original: de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i rang bzhin gyi bdag go //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i rang bzhin gyi bdag go //
translated: The ‚Äúit‚Äù is the self that is the nature of valid knowledge.

original: ci ste yang bdag gis brjod ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'gyur ba /
analyzed: ci ste yang bdag gis brjod ma thag pa'i nyes pa 'gyur ba /
translated: But if one says that the fault just mentioned does not arise,

original: gnod byed dag gis yod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du byas pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gnod byed dag gis yod pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du byas pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma ma yin pa skyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: and that the valid cognition that is produced by the nature of existence that is altered by the afflictive emotions is not a valid cognition,

original: 'on kyang rkyen can gyi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen can gyi rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o//
translated: but rather that it is not a valid cognition because it is produced from a cause that has conditions, this is anticipated and responded to in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf you say . . .‚Äù

original: 'di la lan yon tan lan rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan yon tan lan rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is given in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe response . . .‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: gal te rab rib la sogs pa'i nyes pa skyon tshogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te rab rib la sogs pa'i nyes pa skyon tshogs pa mig la sogs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: If a valid cognition is not produced from the cause of the eye and so on, which is a collection of faults such as the afflictive emotions and so on,

original: de tsam gyis kyang gzhan las tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad du byed na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang gzhan las tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad du byed na /
translated: and if it is also the case that it is not a valid cognition because it is produced from something else,

original: de'i @267b tshe yon tan dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba tshad mar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i @267b tshe yon tan dang ldan pa'i rgyu las byung ba tshad mar 'gyur la /
translated: then it would follow that a valid cognition would be produced from a cause that has good qualities.

original: de tsam gyis kyang gzhan la tshad ma yin par ci ste mi brjod /
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang gzhan la tshad ma yin par ci ste mi brjod /
translated: And if that is the case, why not say that it is a valid cognition because it is produced from something else?

original: ci ste de lta yin pa de lta na yang de ltar tha snyad mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste de lta yin pa de lta na yang de ltar tha snyad mi bya'o //
translated: But even if that were so, one should not make such a convention.

original: de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa la yang de ltar tha snyad mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa la yang de ltar tha snyad mi bya'o //
translated: And at that time, one should not make such a convention even with respect to a nonvalid cognition.

original: gal te gang gis tshad ma ma yin pa ltar gzhan las yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te gang gis tshad ma ma yin pa ltar gzhan las yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: If it were so, then it would be from another, as it is not a valid cognition.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: That which is born from a cause that possesses a fault is not a valid cognition.üîΩBut because it is free from fault.

original: 'on kyang nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen lan du yon tan med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩde lta na yang gal te tshad ma rang las yin na de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang nyid las yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig ni rang las yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen lan du yon tan med phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // de lta na yang gal te tshad ma rang las yin na de'i tshe tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang nyid las yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig ni rang las yin la /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it lacks good qualities, etc.‚ÄùüîΩEven so, if a valid cognition is from itself, then because a nonvalid cognition is also from itself, how can one be established as from itself and the other as from another?

original: gzhan ni gzhan las yin no zhes rnam par gzhag /'on te ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i skyes bu la rab rib yod na 'khrul ba'i shes pa skye la /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan las yin no zhes rnam par gzhag /'on te ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i skyes bu la rab rib yod na 'khrul ba'i shes pa skye la /
translated: But if it is just as it is, when a person has an eye disease, a mistaken cognition arises,

original: rab rib med pa'i dus na ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab rib med pa'i dus na ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: but not when there is no eye disease.

original: des na tshad ma ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the non-valid cognition is

original: rab rib kyis byas pa yin pas tshang ma ma yin pa gzhan las yin la /
analyzed: rab rib kyis byas pa yin pas tshang ma ma yin pa gzhan las yin la /
translated: the other, the one produced by the eye disease.üîΩMoreover, the valid cognition is itself, because one sees correctly withoutüîΩregard to any special quality, merely by attaining the previous state through

original: yang mig sman la sogs bas rab rib bsal ba las sngar gyi gnas skabs thob pa tsam gyis yon tan khyad par la ma ltos par yang dag pa mthong ba'i phyir tshad ma ni rang nyid la yin no na na ;
analyzed: yang mig sman la sogs bas rab rib bsal ba las sngar gyi gnas skabs thob pa tsam gyis yon tan khyad par la ma ltos par yang dag pa mthong ba'i phyir tshad ma ni rang nyid la yin no na na ;
translated: the removal of the eye disease by means of eye medicine, etc.üîΩNow, suppose that a blind person sees correctly through the attainment of

original: 'o na dmus long gang zhig grub pa'i sman dang / sngags la sogs pa'i mthus mig gi yon tan gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir yang dag par mthong yang /
analyzed: 'o na dmus long gang zhig grub pa'i sman dang / sngags la sogs pa'i mthus mig gi yon tan gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir yang dag par mthong yang /
translated: the special quality of the eye through the power of the medicine, mantra, etc.,üîΩwith which he is endowed.üîΩSince he does not attain the previous state, is the valid cognition in that

original: de la snga ma'i gnas skabs thob pa med pa'i phyir ci de'i shes pa'i gzhan kho na las tshad ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la snga ma'i gnas skabs thob pa med pa'i phyir ci de'i shes pa'i gzhan kho na las tshad ma yin nam /
translated: context only the other?

original: sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin mngon bar gsal ba yang mi srid de /
analyzed: sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin mngon bar gsal ba yang mi srid de /
translated: It is not possible for the nature of the previous state to be manifest.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba thob pa'i phyir yang dag par mthong yang de la snga ma'i gnas skabs thob pa med pa'i phyir ci de'i shes pa gzhan kho na las tshad ma yin nam sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin mngon par gsal ba yang mi srid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba thob pa'i phyir yang dag par mthong yang de la snga ma'i gnas skabs thob pa med pa'i phyir ci de'i shes pa gzhan kho na las tshad ma yin nam sngon gnas pa'i rang bzhin mngon par gsal ba yang mi srid de /
translated: And even if it were to be a valid cognition in regard to the existence of the effect, since there is no attainment of the previous state, is it then a valid cognition only in regard to something else? And it is also impossible that the nature of the previous state becomes manifest,

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i nyes pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i nyes pa gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fault of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is being taken up.

original: gang yang mig sman la sogs par skyon sel ba cam du brjod pa de la yang /
analyzed: gang yang mig sman la sogs par skyon sel ba cam du brjod pa de la yang /
translated: And in regard to what is said about the removal of faults in collyrium for the eyes and so on,

original: mig la yon tan gyi khyad par ma skyes so zhes bya ba 'di la lha gtum pos reg pa kho na tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la yon tan gyi khyad par ma skyes so zhes bya ba 'di la lha gtum pos reg pa kho na tshad ma yin te /
translated: it is said that no special quality is produced in the eyes, and this is a valid cognition only in regard to the mere contact with the fierce god.

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa dang bral ba'i gnas skabs nyid @268a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa dang bral ba'i gnas skabs nyid @268a * //
translated: Because the state free from faults

original: yon tan skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is itself the production of the quality.

original: de ni snun nyid yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni snun nyid yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is the mere striking,

original: yod mod ci de tsam gyis yon tan ma yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: yod mod ci de tsam gyis yon tan ma yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: why is it not a quality merely because of that?

original: sngar gnas pa nyid yon tan dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gnas pa nyid yon tan dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: The mere previous state is not incompatible with the quality.

original: des na sngar gnas kyang bar du mi mngon par gyur pa /
analyzed: des na sngar gnas kyang bar du mi mngon par gyur pa /
translated: Therefore, although it existed previously, it has become invisible in the meantime.

original: sngar mngon par gsal ba 'am /üîΩsnga na med pa skyes pa ni yon tan shes pa skyes par byed pa de ci tshad ma nyid gzhan las ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngar mngon par gsal ba 'am / snga na med pa skyes pa ni yon tan shes pa skyes par byed pa de ci tshad ma nyid gzhan las ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is its own domain, even though it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.üîΩThe eye is a valid cognition in regard to the object that is its own domain, because it is a valid cognition in regard to the object that is its own domain.üîΩThe eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.üîΩThe eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.üîΩThe eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.

original: de bzhin du rab rib srid na 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang slu ba'i 'bras bu la sngar gyi mig yon tan dang ldan pa log pa tsam rab rib kyis byas pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab rib srid na 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang slu ba'i 'bras bu la sngar gyi mig yon tan dang ldan pa log pa tsam rab rib kyis byas pa na /
translated: The eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.

original: 'khrul pa yin no zhes brjod pa nus pa des na rang nyid la tshad ma ma yin bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin no zhes brjod pa nus pa des na rang nyid la tshad ma ma yin bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.

original: rang nyid nus pa med na ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di yang slu ba'i nus pa la ltos nas brjod pa'i nus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid nus pa med na ni gzhan gyis bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba 'di yang slu ba'i nus pa la ltos nas brjod pa'i nus pa kho na'o //
translated: The eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.

original: de bas na gcig ni rang las yin la gzhan ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med do //üîΩ'o na tshad ma bdag las yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gcig ni rang las yin la gzhan ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di med do //üîΩ'o na tshad ma bdag las yin la /
translated: The eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.üîΩThe eye is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain, because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is not its own domain.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa yang gzhan las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa yang gzhan las yin no zhe na /
translated: And the nonvalid cognition is from another.

original: gang gis zhes gsungs te rtogs pa gang gis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes gsungs te rtogs pa gang gis so //
translated: By what? By what cognition.

original: de'i ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: de'i ni bdag gi'o //
translated: That is mine.

original: gzhan dag bdag grub pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag bdag grub pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Others say that the self is established.

original: gal te de rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is cognized, etc.

original: rang rig gi ngo bo ni sems ba can tsam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang rig gi ngo bo ni sems ba can tsam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of reflexive awareness is the nature of mere cognition.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gnyid mthug pos log pa'i gnas skabs dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa shes pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi yul dag la rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su zhugs par nyams su
analyzed: gnyid mthug pos log pa'i gnas skabs dang 'gro ba la sogs pa'i tshe sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa shes pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i tha snyad kyi yul dag la rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su zhugs par nyams su
translated: In the state of deep sleep, and in the state of knowing blue, yellow, etc., while walking, etc., the nature of cognition, which is the object of the convention of nonvalid cognition, is experienced as engaged,

original: myong la bdag kyang de nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: myong la bdag kyang de nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: and the self is asserted to be that.

original: des na gzhan pa'i bdag ni rtogs pa med ces ci ste brjod /
analyzed: des na gzhan pa'i bdag ni rtogs pa med ces ci ste brjod /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that the other self is not cognized?

original: shin tu gzhan par 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni grub pa bsgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu gzhan par 'gyur ba nyid yin na ni grub pa bsgrub po zhe na /
translated: If it were very different, it would be established as established.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de'i tshe cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de'i tshe cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The refutation is ‚ÄúAt that time, etc.‚Äù

original: gnyid mthug pos log pa la sogs pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: gnyid mthug pos log pa la sogs pa'i tshe na /
translated: At the time of deep sleep, etc.,

original: dngos po tsam yang rig pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po tsam yang rig pa med do //
translated: there is no awareness of mere things.

original: des na ci ltar bdag yod do zhes yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa las cang ma shes par ni khra bo yod do zhes yod pa tha snyad @268b mi byed do //
analyzed: des na ci ltar bdag yod do zhes yod pa'i tha snyad du byed pa las cang ma shes par ni khra bo yod do zhes yod pa tha snyad @268b mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, just as one does not make the conventional ascription of existence, ‚ÄúThe variegated exists,‚Äù without understanding anything, so too one does not make the conventional ascription of existence, ‚ÄúThe self exists.‚Äù

original: des na bdag de la rtogs dang cig shos zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: des na bdag de la rtogs dang cig shos zhes bya ba la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: Therefore, it is easy to understand such passages as ‚ÄúIn regard to that self, etc.‚Äù

original: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is ‚ÄúTherefore, valid cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
