translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: skye ba'am rtogs pa la ltos nas rang las zhes brjod grang na /
analyzed: skye ba'am rtogs pa la ltos nas rang las zhes brjod grang na /
translated: If one says ‚Äúfrom itself‚Äù in dependence on arising or realization,

original: de la phyogs dang po la ni dper na rang las te rang gi rgyu nyid las tshad ma skye ba bzhin du cig shos tshad ma ma yin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la ni dper na rang las te rang gi rgyu nyid las tshad ma skye ba bzhin du cig shos tshad ma ma yin pa yang yin no //
translated: then in the first case, just as valid cognition arises from itself, from its own cause, so too the other, invalid cognition, arises from itself.

original: byung ba ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means valid cognition or invalid cognition.

original: chad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin par skyes pa la ni gzhan gyi khyad par bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: chad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin par skyes pa la ni gzhan gyi khyad par bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: But if it arises without being a valid cognition, then it cannot establish the difference of another.

original: tshad ma nyid rang las min te tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid rang las min te tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And it is not from itself that there is validity, for then there would be no invalid cognition.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ni tshad ma la yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ni tshad ma la yang med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The second position is that it does not exist even in a valid cognition.üîΩThis is what is shown by ‚ÄúIf it is similar in aspect. . .

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúhaving a similar aspect.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: de nyid du ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: In that case, it is either a valid cognition or an invalid cognition.üîΩIf it is similar in aspect, but is not invalid, then it is a valid cognition.

original: gal te rnam pa mtshungs kyang gang la gnod pa med pa de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa mtshungs kyang gang la gnod pa med pa de tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is invalid, then it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di la bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la bsam par bya ste /
translated: This should be considered.

original: dang po gnod pa med pa 'dod dam phyi sa dang po la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dang po gnod pa med pa 'dod dam phyi sa dang po la brjod pa ni /
translated: Is it maintained that it is non-invalid at the beginning, or that it is non-invalid in the end?üîΩThe first is stated in the line ‚ÄúAt the beginning, all. . .

original: dang po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩtshad ma ma yin pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste / tshad ma ma yin pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩIt is not a valid cognition.

original: gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ni tshad mar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa nyid kyis ni tshad mar mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is a valid cognition because it is non-invalid.

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni phyis gnod byed la the tshom zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni phyis gnod byed la the tshom zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is the expression of doubt about the refutation.

original: gal te the tshom za ba la yang tshang mas nges pa ni mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te the tshom za ba la yang tshang mas nges pa ni mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If one says that one sees a certainty in a doubt,

original: gnod par byed pa 'byung ba de yod pa 'am med par nges pa de ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gzhan las yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa 'byung ba de yod pa 'am med par nges pa de ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gzhan las yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that certainty that the refutation exists or does not exist would be by another perception or inference.

original: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag nyid las nges par brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag nyid las nges par brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it that certainty is expressed only by perception and inference?

original: bshad pa tshad ma gzhan ni yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad pa tshad ma gzhan ni yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that there is no other valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa de'i phyir 'di dag las nges par brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma gzhan med pa de'i phyir 'di dag las nges par brjod la /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition other than perception and inference, certainty is expressed by these two.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod byed la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'jug pa med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnod byed la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'jug pa med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is thought that perception and inference do not engage in a refutation that will occur in the future.

original: de la tshad ma ma yin pa la ltos nas ni phyis gnod pa yod par ma nges la tshad ma la ltos nas ni yod pa ma nges par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshad ma ma yin pa la ltos nas ni phyis gnod pa yod par ma nges la tshad ma la ltos nas ni yod pa ma nges par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In response to that, it should be understood that, in dependence on a nonvalid cognition, it is not ascertained that there is a later invalidator, and in dependence on a valid cognition, it is not ascertained that there is no later invalidator.

original: de ltar rang las tshad mar smra ba sun 'byin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rang las tshad mar smra ba sun 'byin pa na /
translated: Thus, when the Svatantrikas refute the essentialist‚Äôs argument,

original: 'di mi slu @269a * //
analyzed: 'di mi slu @269a * //
translated: the essentialist says, ‚ÄúYour argument is deceptive.

original: ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi phyogs su ltung bas de ltar bdag la gegs byed pa yin no snyam pas /
analyzed: ba nyid kyis mtshan nyid kyi phyogs su ltung bas de ltar bdag la gegs byed pa yin no snyam pas /
translated: Since it is a deceptive argument, it falls into the category of fallacious reasons, and so it is not a refutation of my position.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi lugs bzlog pas 'tsho bar 'dod nas /üîΩre zhig 'di nyid kyi lugs bsam par bya'o zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lugs bzlog pas 'tsho bar 'dod nas / re zhig 'di nyid kyi lugs bsam par bya'o zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Thinking this, the essentialist, wishing to live to fight another day,üîΩsays, ‚ÄúFirst, let us consider your own position.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;üîΩ/ gang du sgrub byed kyi shes pa zhugs pa nyid las mi slu ba'i shes pa zhugs pa ni khas mi len te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ; / gang du sgrub byed kyi shes pa zhugs pa nyid las mi slu ba'i shes pa zhugs pa ni khas mi len te /
translated: The Svatantrikas respond to this with the passage that begins, ‚ÄúIf you think that . . . ‚ÄùüîΩThey do not accept that a nondeceptive cognition is engaged simply because a proving cognition is engaged.

original: 'jug na de nyid ltar mi shes pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug na de nyid ltar mi shes pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, then it would be untenable for it to be a cognition that does not know reality.

original: 'on kyang de ni yul gzhan la zhugs par khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni yul gzhan la zhugs par khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: However, they do accept that it is engaged with respect to another object.

original: des na de /
analyzed: des na de /
translated: Therefore, they say, ‚ÄúIf you think that . . . ‚Äù

original: yul gzhan la ni 'jug 'gyur na //
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni 'jug 'gyur na //
translated: If it engages other objects,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i mi slu ba'i shes pas ni tshad ma rtogs par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i mi slu ba'i shes pas ni tshad ma rtogs par bya ba yin na /
translated: The refutation of this is as follows: If the object to be realized by valid knowledge is a later nondeceptive consciousness,

original: 'das pa la ni rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa la ni rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then there is no realization of the past.

original: gzhan dag snga ma tsam ni 'das par mi 'dod de dper na snam bu la ltos nas sngar yod pa'i snal ma rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag snga ma tsam ni 'das par mi 'dod de dper na snam bu la ltos nas sngar yod pa'i snal ma rnams bzhin no //
translated: Others do not assert that the mere past is the object of the past consciousness, for example, like the prior existence of threads in dependence on cloth.

original: des na 'das pa'i zhes khyad par byed /
analyzed: des na 'das pa'i zhes khyad par byed /
translated: Therefore, the qualification ‚Äúof the past‚Äù is added.

original: 'on te yang mi slu ba'i shes pa'i tshad ma nyid du nges pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te yang mi slu ba'i shes pa'i tshad ma nyid du nges pa ma yin mod /
translated: Moreover, it is not that nondeceptive consciousness is ascertained as valid knowledge.

original: 'on kyang sgrub par pa'i shes pa de nyid goms pa las shin tu gsal bar gyur pas na ;
analyzed: 'on kyang sgrub par pa'i shes pa de nyid goms pa las shin tu gsal bar gyur pas na ;
translated: However, from the cultivation of that very consciousness that is to be established, it becomes very clear.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba nyid nges par rang nyid kyis 'phangs nas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba nyid nges par rang nyid kyis 'phangs nas gnas pa yin te /
translated: Having itself projected the definition of valid knowledge, nondeceptiveness, it remains.

original: des na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma rnam par gnas pa kho na'o zhes dogs na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa yang zhas gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid can tshad ma rnam par gnas pa kho na'o zhes dogs na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa yang zhas gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, if you suspect that the definition of non-deceptive is only a valid cognition, he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition that establishes is also . . .‚Äù

original: ci ltar tshad ma nyid ni rtogs par byed ces bya ba rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: ci ltar tshad ma nyid ni rtogs par byed ces bya ba rjes su 'jug go //
translated: How is valid cognition itself understood?

original: ci'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma rtogs she na /
translated: Why is valid cognition itself not understood?

original: the tshom gyi ni yul yin phyir //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi ni yul yin phyir // zhes smos te /
translated: Because it is the object of doubt.

original: ci 'di tshad ma 'am 'on te ma yin zhes the tshom za ba de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci 'di tshad ma 'am 'on te ma yin zhes the tshom za ba de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of doubt, ‚ÄúIs this a valid cognition or not?‚Äù

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i yul can yin pa nyid las tshad mar nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i yul can yin pa nyid las tshad mar nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is ascertained as a valid cognition because it is the subject that establishes,

original: smras pa ci ltar yul de sgrub byed yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa ci ltar yul de sgrub byed yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: we say, ‚ÄúHow is that object established? It is not!‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i shes pa de tshad ma nyid du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i shes pa de tshad ma nyid du rtogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no understanding of the cognition of that as valid cognition.

original: de'i bya ba grub pa nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba grub pa nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of that is not experienced as accomplished.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa chad ma ma yin pa'i stobs kyis yul sgrub @269b byed nyid du nges la /
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa chad ma ma yin pa'i stobs kyis yul sgrub @269b byed nyid du nges la /
translated: Therefore, the object is ascertained as the object to be established by the power of the cognition that establishes it.

original: yul sgrub byed du nges pas kyang chad ma nyid du nges pa'i phyir gsal bar phan tshun bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: yul sgrub byed du nges pas kyang chad ma nyid du nges pa'i phyir gsal bar phan tshun bsten pa yin no //
translated: And because the object is ascertained as the object to be established, the cognition is ascertained as the cognizer. Thus, the cognizer and cognized are mutually dependent.

original: de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul nyid du grub pa'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma nyid des tshang ma sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom gyi yul nyid du grub pa'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma nyid des tshang ma sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since it is established as the object of doubt, how can it be a valid cognition?üîΩThinking that although the fault of the sign of silence may be established, still, how can you be refuted by that?

original: gal te mi smra ba nyid kyi mtshan la skyon yod du chug mod de lta na yang khyod ldog pas 'tsho bar ci ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams nas sngar bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa'i dran par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te mi smra ba nyid kyi mtshan la skyon yod du chug mod de lta na yang khyod ldog pas 'tsho bar ci ltar 'gyur snyam du bsams nas sngar bshad zin pa'i sun 'byin pa'i dran par byed pa ni /
translated: The recollection of the previously explained refutation is:

original: gal te rtogs pa bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe cognizer is the self,‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni spyod pa rang gi lugs las su rka 'byin pa yal bar dor nas /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa rang gi lugs las su rka 'byin pa yal bar dor nas /
translated: Now, having abandoned the presentation of our own system,

original: mi slu bar smra ba'i lugs 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: mi slu bar smra ba'i lugs 'gog pa ni /
translated: the refutation of the system of the nondeceptive one is:

original: 'on te de don don byed nyid //
analyzed: 'on te de don don byed nyid //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThe object is the object of activity,‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: ces bya ba'o //üîΩmi slu ba'i rtogs pas 'das pa tshad mar shes pa ni mi smra la /üîΩsgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i stobs la brten pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i don sgrub par byed pa shes pa'i yul gyis don byed pa phyis mngon nas sgrub par byed pa shes pa snga ma tshad ma nyid du nges par byed do snyam na /üîΩsun 'byin par byed pas tshad ma sngar grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //üîΩdon 'di yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'o // mi slu ba'i rtogs pas 'das pa tshad mar shes pa ni mi smra la / sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i stobs la brten pa yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang de'i don sgrub par byed pa shes pa'i yul gyis don byed pa phyis mngon nas sgrub par byed pa shes pa snga ma tshad ma nyid du nges par byed do snyam na / sun 'byin par byed pas tshad ma sngar grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so // don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te tshad ma zhes bya ba zhig sngar grub par gyur na de'i tshe de dang 'brel par grub pa'i don bya ba la tshad mar nges par 'gyur ba zhig na 'on kyang tshad ma'i rang bzhin nyid du rung yang grub pa med do //üîΩ'di nyid sdud pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: don bya ba las tshad ma nyid dpog par ni mi byed kyi /
analyzed: don bya ba las tshad ma nyid dpog par ni mi byed kyi /
translated: But it is not that the validity of the cognition is inferred from the activity.

original: 'on kyang don ga las shes pa la 'jug pa na bya ba thob pa der shes de tshad ma yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do zhes dogs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang don ga las shes pa la 'jug pa na bya ba thob pa der shes de tshad ma yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do zhes dogs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: However, when one engages in the cognition of the object, the activity is obtained, and that cognition is called valid.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this doubt, he says:üîΩOr, if it is said that the cognition is valid because it is the cause of the activity, then the activity would be the valid cognition.

original: sun 'byin pa ni don byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni don byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is from the activity, etc.

original: tshad min pas rtogs las kyang mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshad min pas rtogs las kyang mthong // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even from the understanding by non-valid cognition, it is seen.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du khas blangs pa las kyang ngo //
translated: This is because it is accepted as non-valid cognition.

original: rlung gis gtsubs sa pa'i rdul gyi tshogs la du ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa las mer rjes su dpog pa'i blos zhugs pa'i yul de ni res 'ga' me srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gis gtsubs sa pa'i rdul gyi tshogs la du ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa las mer rjes su dpog pa'i blos zhugs pa'i yul de ni res 'ga' me srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of the mind that infers fire from the excessive attachment to smoke in the mass of dust stirred up by the wind is sometimes possible as fire.

original: de las don bya de min na //
analyzed: de las don bya de min na //
translated: But if that is not the object of activity, then it is not the object of the cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa ste /
translated: This is another's doubt.

original: don bya ba de ni @270a * //
analyzed: don bya ba de ni @270a * //
translated: That object of activityüîΩis not the object of the cognition.

original: de'i yul du nye bar song ba na tshad ma gzhan kho na las yin no zhes bya ba lugs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yul du nye bar song ba na tshad ma gzhan kho na las yin no zhes bya ba lugs las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: When it approaches its object, it is from another valid cognition.

original: sun 'byin pa ni gzhan las kyang de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni gzhan las kyang de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The refutation is ‚ÄúThat is also from another,‚Äù

original: mngon sum phyi ma las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdes na me rab tu ston par byed pa'i 'jug par byed pa dang / thob par byed pa thun mong pa rnams la /
analyzed: mngon sum phyi ma las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // des na me rab tu ston par byed pa'i 'jug par byed pa dang / thob par byed pa thun mong pa rnams la /
translated: meaning that it is also from a subsequent direct perception.

original: gcig ni tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di sus byas /üîΩgzhan gyis / de la res 'ga' mi 'thob phyir //
analyzed: gcig ni tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di sus byas / gzhan gyis / de la res 'ga' mi 'thob phyir //
translated: Therefore, who makes this distinction that ‚Äúone is a valid cognition and the other is not‚Äù with regard to the common instigators and acquirers that reveal fire?üîΩThe opponent says,

original: smras pas so //
analyzed: smras pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause sometimes it is not obtained.‚Äù

original: sun 'byin par byed pa'i de ni gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa'i de ni gzhan du'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The refutation is ‚ÄúThat is also from another,‚Äù

original: mi 'thob pa de ni gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis yul phrogs sam /
analyzed: mi 'thob pa de ni gang gi tshe 'ga' zhig gis yul phrogs sam /
translated: meaning that when someone is robbed of their object,

original: nye bar len pa mi brtan pa'i yul rang nyid zad dam bar du 'jug pa'i rkang pa la sogs pa chag pa de'i tshe tshad ma la yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa mi brtan pa'i yul rang nyid zad dam bar du 'jug pa'i rkang pa la sogs pa chag pa de'i tshe tshad ma la yang mthong ngo //
translated: When the object of the unstable appropriation, such as the foot, etc., is destroyed, then one sees that the valid cognition is also destroyed.

original: gang las thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ste /
analyzed: gang las thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which one obtains‚Äù and so on is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gal te de ltar tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag la thob pa mtshungs pa de lta na yang shes pa gang las zhugs pa na thob par the tshom med pa de ni tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag la thob pa mtshungs pa de lta na yang shes pa gang las zhugs pa na thob par the tshom med pa de ni tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if valid cognition and invalid cognition are the same in terms of obtaining, still, when one engages in the cognition from which one obtains without doubt, that is valid cognition.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The refutation is ‚ÄúWell then,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag rnam pa mtshungs par ma gyur na ;
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa dag rnam pa mtshungs par ma gyur na ;
translated: If valid cognition and invalid cognition are not the same in terms of their aspects,üîΩthen at that time there would be no doubt.

original: de'i tshe the tshom med par 'gyur ba zhig / rnam pa mtshungs pa ni gang las the tshom ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe the tshom med par 'gyur ba zhig / rnam pa mtshungs pa ni gang las the tshom ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: From what aspect would the doubt be eliminated?

original: gzhan gyi goms las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi goms las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the other‚Äôs familiarization‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: ga lta yang rags pa'i rnam pa mtshungs pa yod pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: ga lta yang rags pa'i rnam pa mtshungs pa yod pa de lta na yang /
translated: In any case, there is a similarity in the gross aspects.

original: nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa ltar ;
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig la sogs pa ltar ;
translated: But, like a jewel, a pearl, etc.,

original: mi mthun pa phra mo goms pa las nges par 'dzin to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa phra mo goms pa las nges par 'dzin to //
translated: one can ascertain the subtle differences through practice.

original: khyad par de las ni thob pa yod par nges so zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de las ni thob pa yod par nges so zhe na /
translated: And from that difference, there is the definite acquisition of the result.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de ni phan tshun bsten pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgoms pa yod na 'thob par nges la nges par thob pa nges pa yin na yang /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de ni phan tshun bsten pa yin no zhes bya ba'o // goms pa yod na 'thob par nges la nges par thob pa nges pa yin na yang /
translated: The refutation of this is that it is a mutual dependence.

original: yang nas yang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang nas yang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi goms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is practice, there is the definite acquisition of the result. If there is the definite acquisition of the result, there is the definite practice.üîΩBut if there is the definite practice, there is the definite acquisition of the result.

original: gzhan dag gal te nyams su myong ba'i don ni snyon pa'i mi nus so snyam pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gal te nyams su myong ba'i don ni snyon pa'i mi nus so snyam pas /
translated: Others think that the meaning of experience cannot be denied.

original: nyams su myong ba'i 'jug pa'i rim pa ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i 'jug pa'i rim pa ston par byed pa ni /
translated: They teach the process of the experience of the result.

original: de mthong ba nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe seeing of that itself. . . . ‚Äù

original: me la sogs pa gang zhig mthong ba na bsreg @270b pa la sogs pa mthong ba de ltar tha snyad kyi dus su mthong ba na /
analyzed: me la sogs pa gang zhig mthong ba na bsreg @270b pa la sogs pa mthong ba de ltar tha snyad kyi dus su mthong ba na /
translated: When one sees fire, for example, one sees burning.üîΩ

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When one sees fire, etc., one sees burning, etc. In the same way, when one sees at the time of convention, one sees the convention of the characteristics of engagement, etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: me la sogs pa mthong ba rnams la sngar zhugs pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa las mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa mthong ba rnams la sngar zhugs pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de'i mthu las byung ba'i dran pa las mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the desire for fire, etc., arises from memory, which arises from the power of the experience of prior engagement.

original: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de ltar rjes dpag las yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa ni de ltar rjes dpag las yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is that it is like that from inference.

original: 'di mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not direct perception,

original: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: but it is clear that this is an inference of its nature.

original: 'di ltar de mthong nyid la zhes bya bas ni mthong bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de mthong nyid la zhes bya bas ni mthong bzhin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, by ‚Äújust seeing that,‚Äù one does not apprehend the intrinsic characteristic of what is being seen,

original: sngar mthong ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that it was seen before.

original: de'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni de 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni de 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever is such is the performance of the function of such an object.

original: dper na snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snga ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, as before.

original: 'di yang de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang de lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: This is also such.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba'i don bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the performance of the function of such an object is the meaning of valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid las don bya ba nges pa yin mod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid las don bya ba nges pa yin mod /
translated: Indeed, the ascertainment of the function is from inference itself.

original: ded la chad pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ded la chad pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: rjes dpag de yang zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
analyzed: rjes dpag de yang zhes bya ba la sogs smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat inference also,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa mngon sum las bdag nyid thob la bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis don bya ba dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa las 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa mngon sum las bdag nyid thob la bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis don bya ba dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa las 'thad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Inference obtains its own nature from perception that apprehends the connection with the function. And by the explained method, perception that apprehends the connection with the function is also established from inference.

original: phan tshun bsten pa mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa rnam par gnas pa med do //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa rnam par gnas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no establishment of either perception or inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa don bya ba dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i mngon sum la ltos mod /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa don bya ba dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i mngon sum la ltos mod /
translated: Inference does indeed depend on perception that apprehends the relation between the object and its effect.

original: mngon sum ni rang kho nas 'brel pa 'dzin gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni ltos pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang kho nas 'brel pa 'dzin gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni ltos pa ma yin nam /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt perception itself apprehend the relation by itself, and not in dependence on inference?

original: des na gang gis gang yang rung bar gnas par mi 'gyur ba phan tshun bsten par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang gis gang yang rung bar gnas par mi 'gyur ba phan tshun bsten par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how could there be mutual dependence, since one would not be established by the other?

original: rang dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩrang gi ngo bo yang de yin la rang gi dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang yin pa de gcod par byed pa ste ;
analyzed: rang dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rang gi ngo bo yang de yin la rang gi dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang yin pa de gcod par byed pa ste ;
translated: He says ‚ÄúIts own nature, etc.‚Äù

original: ngon mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngon mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which cuts off, that is, makes manifest, both its own nature and the aspect of its own object.

original: nus pa med pa nyid ston pa ni des ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nus pa med pa nyid ston pa ni des ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He shows that it is powerless, saying ‚ÄúBy that,‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis so //
translated: that is, by perception.

original: ci'i phyir 'dzin par mi phyed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dzin par mi phyed ce na /
translated: Why doesn‚Äôt it apprehend it?

original: yul dang dus gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says ‚ÄúIn another place and time,‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa de lta bur gyur pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i gnas lugs su mngon sum @271a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa de lta bur gyur pa yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i gnas lugs su mngon sum @271a * //
translated: because the relation is like that. Therefore, the relation is not the mode of existence of things.

original: du 'dzin pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: du 'dzin pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not so.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis yul dang dus gzhan khyab par 'brel pa 'dzin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis yul dang dus gzhan khyab par 'brel pa 'dzin na /
translated: If direct perception apprehends a connection that pervades another place and time,

original: de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: then what is the fault at that time?

original: gal te yul dang dus gzhan du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te yul dang dus gzhan du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is said in another place and time,

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten thams cad don kun mthong bar thal lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten thams cad don kun mthong bar thal lo //
translated: then at that time it follows that the entire world would see all objects.

original: re zhig 'ga' zhig tu lhan cig gi ngo bor mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: re zhig 'ga' zhig tu lhan cig gi ngo bor mthong ba yin la /
translated: At first, it is seen as the nature of simultaneity, and

original: de nyid 'brel pa 'dzin par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid 'brel pa 'dzin par brjod do zhe na /
translated: it is said that it apprehends that very connection.

original: khyab min lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: khyab min lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it is said it is not pervasive, it is simultaneous, and so on,

original: gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: the reason is stated.

original: lhan cig pa'i ngo bo de ni res 'ga' ba yin pas so //
analyzed: lhan cig pa'i ngo bo de ni res 'ga' ba yin pas so //
translated: Because that nature of simultaneity is sometimes seen,

original: lhan cig gi ngo bor mthong ba rjes su dpag pa skye na /
analyzed: lhan cig gi ngo bor mthong ba rjes su dpag pa skye na /
translated: if the inference arises that it is seen as the nature of simultaneity,

original: ha cang thal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad par ni /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad par ni /
translated: then there would be an absurd consequence, as explained.

original: yang na kun du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na kun du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, it is said everywhere.

original: bum pa dang snam bu dag la yang res 'ga' ba'i lhan cig gi ngo bo ni yod pa des na de dag gcig mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu dag la yang res 'ga' ba'i lhan cig gi ngo bo ni yod pa des na de dag gcig mthong ba ni /
translated: Also, in the case of a pot and a cloth, there is a simultaneous nature that is sometimes present. Therefore, when one of them is seen, the other is not necessarily not seen.

original: gzhan rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Also, in the case of a pot and a cloth, there is a simultaneous nature that is sometimes present. Therefore, the meaning is that when one sees one, one infers the other.

original: de'i phyir yul la sogs pa'i khyad par 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul la sogs pa'i khyad par 'brel pa ni mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection with the distinctions of object and so on is not known by perception.

original: 'o na mngon sum gyis ci rig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum gyis ci rig ce na /
translated: Well then, what is known by perception?

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚Äúthat itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means from perception.

original: gal te yul dang dus gzhan nyid mi 'dzin mod //
analyzed: gal te yul dang dus gzhan nyid mi 'dzin mod //
translated: If one does not apprehend a different object and time,

original: des na gnas pas khyab pa 'dzin pa la go 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na gnas pas khyab pa 'dzin pa la go 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: then what is the contradiction in apprehending the pervasion by enduring?

original: yul la sogs zhes smos te /
analyzed: yul la sogs zhes smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúobject and so on,‚Äù

original: yul gzhan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan la sogs pa'o //
translated: where ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes time.

original: de khyab ces bya ba ni der gnas pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de khyab ces bya ba ni der gnas pas khyab pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat pervasion‚Äù means pervasion by enduring there.

original: des zhes bya ba ni khyab pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma bzung bas ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni khyab pa 'dzin pa'i shes pas ma bzung bas ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means not apprehended by the consciousness that apprehends the pervasion.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum rang nyid kyis don bya ba dang 'brel par 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum rang nyid kyis don bya ba dang 'brel par 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, direct perception itself does not apprehend the connection to the object.

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa nyid yin te /

original: des na phan tshun bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na phan tshun bsten pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis khyab pa mi 'dzin mod /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ci ltar phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'on kyang mngon sum @271b las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum @271b las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because it is from direct perception,

original: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs sun phyung nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs sun phyung nas /

translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas‚Äô own system is summarized in the following lines:

original: 'di ni don gyis go ba grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩmi slu ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du byed pas kyang ;
analyzed: 'di ni don gyis go ba grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to // mi slu ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du byed pas kyang ;
translated: This means that the meaning of ‚Äúvalid knowledge‚Äù is established by implication.üîΩThey say that because nondeceptive is the definition of valid knowledge,

analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag cag gi mtshan nyid khas blang dgos so zhes smras pa ni /

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gang zhig mi slu ba las tshad ma yin pa de ni gal te gnod par byed pa med na /
translated: If something is valid knowledge because it is nondeceptive, and if there is no object that contradicts it,

original: tshad ma kho nar rigs kyi /
analyzed: tshad ma kho nar rigs kyi /

analyzed: gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa de'i tshe ni /

analyzed: mi slu ba las kyang ci ltar tshad mar 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni / gnod byed las ni zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhan la nyes par brjod pa 'dis ni rang gi phyogs kyi lan cung zad kyang ma btab po //

analyzed: des na gnod byed med pa tsam zhes bya ba nas shes 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis lhag par rtogs par bya ba'i don du sngar gyi sun 'byin pa nyid dran par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúmere absence of a defeater‚Äù up to ‚Äúwould be known‚Äù reminds us of the previous refutation for the purpose of further understanding.

analyzed: thob las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan te don byed pa thob pa'o //

original: rang dngos rig pa'i shes las zhes bya ba ni don byed pa'i rang bzhin rig pa 'di la yod pa'o //

analyzed: brjed pa de nyid du 'gyur ro // tshad ma tshad ma gzhan las rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam na /

analyzed: da ni bstan bcos mdzad pas 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

translated: The ‚Äútwisting‚Äù is stated by ‚Äúfrom itself‚Äù and so on.

original: rang gi do bo'i tshig gi rnam par bcad pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi do bo'i tshig gi rnam par bcad pa smras pa ni /
translated: The statement of the exclusion of the word ‚Äúown‚Äù is

analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba'i shes pa nyid kyis 'brel pa 'dzin par 'gyur te /

analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang 'dra ba dag srid pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: shes pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas kyang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid rtogs so zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: de las shes pa'i zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gang zhig thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa de nyid tshad mar smra ba rnams kyi /

original: des na sna tshogs su snang ba ni @273a * //
analyzed: des na sna tshogs su snang ba ni @273a * //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of variety

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin tsam yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin tsam yin te /
translated: is merely the nature of cognition,üîΩbecause the appearance of anything else is untenable.

original: gzhan ni snang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni tha dad par brjod pa'i skabs ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni snang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni tha dad par brjod pa'i skabs ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no occasion to speak of difference.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Having thus presented reality,

original: bsgrub bya gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he states the conclusion: ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù

original: mdor bsdus na byang grol ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na byang grol ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: in brief, enlightenment and liberation are this.

original: de ltar rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya ba 'dis don dam pa'i bden pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya ba 'dis don dam pa'i bden pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught ultimate reality with ‚Äúthus, one realizes one‚Äôs own nature from oneself,‚Äù

original: lhag mas kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i don du rgal ba dgod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: lhag mas kun rdzob kyi bden pa bstan pa'i don du rgal ba dgod pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa ni /
translated: The remainder is the introduction by way of the objection, for the sake of teaching the conventional truth.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Well then, ‚Äù

original: tshad ma ma yin pa las log pa ni tshad mar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa las log pa ni tshad mar gnas pa'o //
translated: The opposite of non-valid cognition is valid cognition.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.

original: tshad ma grub pa sgrub pa brtson pas ni de sun 'byin pa khas len par phyogs pa sgrub pa nyid bzod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa sgrub pa brtson pas ni de sun 'byin pa khas len par phyogs pa sgrub pa nyid bzod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: One who strives to establish valid cognition will not accept the refutation of that, and it is not to be endured that the position be established.

original: de la brten pa'i kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pas /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pas /
translated: Therefore, the establishment of reality based on that

original: de brten par bya bar ni shin tu yang mi nus so//
analyzed: de brten par bya bar ni shin tu yang mi nus so//
translated: cannot be supported at all.

original: des na 'di nyid kyi khyad par gyi grub pa'i mtha' yin na /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid kyi khyad par gyi grub pa'i mtha' yin na /
translated: Thus, if this is the distinguishing tenet,

original: tshad ma grub pa bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba 'di'i don yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba 'di'i don yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: what is the meaning of ‚Äúvalid cognition is to be established‚Äù?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni /
translated: The proponent of the tenet says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: is well based on the two truths.

original: zhes bya ba'i bsam pa la ltos nas tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bsam pa la ltos nas tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in consideration of the thought, in terms of convention, it is valid cognition, he said, it is valid cognition.

original: gal te re zhig tshad ma ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te re zhig tshad ma ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: If valid cognition is accepted,

original: de la rtog pa'i spro ba yang shugs kyis blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la rtog pa'i spro ba yang shugs kyis blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: then the imagination of what is unreal must also be accepted by implication.

original: kun rdzob kyi mi lhag pa ni mi gnod kyi 'on kyang ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ni 'gal lo snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi mi lhag pa ni mi gnod kyi 'on kyang ji skad bshad pa'i de kho na nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i ni 'gal lo snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: If the non-deficiency of the conventional is not refuted, then the establishment of reality as it has been explained is contradicted.

original: tha snyad kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he said, even in terms of convention.

original: tshad ma dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang gzhan rig pa bsnyon pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang gzhan rig pa bsnyon pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the existence of valid cognition, cause and effect, and the awareness of something else are denied.

original: gal te de ltar na gcig bcos na gzhan zhig go zhes bya ba de byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gcig bcos na gzhan zhig go zhes bya ba de byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then when one is fabricated, the other is born, you say.

original: bden te skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa ni dpyod par bya ba yin no snyam du thugs la gzhag nas de la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bden te skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa ni dpyod par bya ba yin no snyam du thugs la gzhag nas de la zhes gsungs te /
translated: True, but the desire of the person is to be analyzed, he thought, and said, in that regard.

original: de gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la'o //
translated: That is, in regard to those two.

original: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par  pa'i mthar thug pas phyin pas te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par  pa'i mthar thug pas phyin pas te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust this much‚Äù means that one has gone to the ultimate of the modes of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gnas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gnas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúOne stands in the ultimate truth‚Äù means that one stands in the ultimate of the modes of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: 'khor ba de ni gtan @273b med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba de ni gtan @273b med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause cyclic existence is not at all‚Äù means that cyclic existence has the nature of entering and leaving.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag kyang bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis mi 'thad pa dang 'ga' zhig tu dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag kyang bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis mi 'thad pa dang 'ga' zhig tu dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Entering and leaving are not tenable in the manner already explained, and they are not perceived anywhere.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyi rol gyi bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyi rol gyi bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the external is explained to be only the ultimate of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: des na gal te rnam par dpyod pa la gus na /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam par dpyod pa la gus na /
translated: Therefore, if one is devoted to analysis,

original: 'khor ba gang na yod de /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang na yod de /
translated: where is there cyclic existence?

original: des na rang rig tsam la gnas nas cang smra bar mi bya bas gzhan gyi rtsod pa'i go skabs ga la yod /
analyzed: des na rang rig tsam la gnas nas cang smra bar mi bya bas gzhan gyi rtsod pa'i go skabs ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, one should remain in mere self-awareness and not speak at all. How can there be an opportunity for others to dispute?

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brten nas bshad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brten nas bshad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation based on the second position is ‚ÄúOr else.‚Äù

original: thog ma med pa'i dus can med pa sgro 'dogs pa'i bag chags las 'jug pa'i spros pa 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus can med pa sgro 'dogs pa'i bag chags las 'jug pa'i spros pa 'dzin pa ni 'khor ba yin la /
translated: Samsara is the grasping of the elaborations that engage due to the latent potentialities that superimpose the non-existent, which has existed since beginningless time.

original: shin tu dus yun ring por goms pas de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i gnyen po lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni da ltar ba dang 'brel pa'i rnam par dpyod pas bsal ba ji ltar nus /
analyzed: shin tu dus yun ring por goms pas de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i gnyen po lam gyis spang bar bya ba ni da ltar ba dang 'brel pa'i rnam par dpyod pas bsal ba ji ltar nus /
translated: How can the present, which is related to the object of elimination by the path, the antidote that makes it one‚Äôs nature through long habituation, be removed by analysis?

original: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa dang bral bas brgal zhing brtag pa dang / shes rab 'dod pa la sogs pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa dang bral bas brgal zhing brtag pa dang / shes rab 'dod pa la sogs pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is free from ultimate reflexive awareness, it is thought that the desire for the wisdom of debate and analysis naturally engages it.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smras pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smras pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIf that is so, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'di thob na bde bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa de bzhin du shes pa 'di las zhugs na 'dod pa thob nas bde bar 'gyur ro snyam na yang ldog par dka' ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di thob na bde bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dzin pa de bzhin du shes pa 'di las zhugs na 'dod pa thob nas bde bar 'gyur ro snyam na yang ldog par dka' ba kho na'o //
translated: Just as it is difficult to stop the thought ‚ÄúI will be happy if I obtain this,‚Äù so too it is difficult to stop the thought ‚ÄúIf I engage in this cognition, I will obtain my desire and be happy.‚Äù

original: shes pa gang las 'jug pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang las 'jug pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: and the cognition from which the conventional engagement arises.

original: 'dod pa thob nas yongs su tshim par 'gyur ba de nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa thob nas yongs su tshim par 'gyur ba de nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the attainment of the desired object is the valid cognition that brings satisfaction,

original: tha snyad grub pa la 'bad pa gzhan la mi ltos so ;
analyzed: tha snyad grub pa la 'bad pa gzhan la mi ltos so ;
translated: the establishment of the conventional does not depend on any other effort.

original: /'on kyang gang zhig mthong ba las gzhan la yang 'jug pa mi slu ba la brten par 'gyur ba 'di ni mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhes bya ba tsam bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: /'on kyang gang zhig mthong ba las gzhan la yang 'jug pa mi slu ba la brten par 'gyur ba 'di ni mtshan nyid ci zhig yin zhes bya ba tsam bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: However, one should simply consider what the defining characteristic is of that which, based on what is nondeceptive in seeing, also engages in what is other.

original: de ltar rang rig pa nyid don dam pa'i tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rang rig pa nyid don dam pa'i tshad ma yin la /
translated: Thus, reflexive awareness itself is the ultimate valid cognition,

original: gzhan ni kun rdzob pa nyid yin pa /
analyzed: gzhan ni kun rdzob pa nyid yin pa /
translated: while the other is the conventional one.

original: de lta na yang kun rdzob la brten nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang kun rdzob la brten nas /
translated: Even so, based on the conventional,

original: mtshan nyid byas par bstan zhing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang cha tsam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid byas par bstan zhing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par gzhag pa yang cha tsam bstan pa yin no //
translated: the defining characteristic is taught, and the presentation of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa is also taught in part.

original: gang dag tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par gzhag pa de kho na nyid yin par sems shing /
analyzed: gang dag tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par gzhag pa de kho na nyid yin par sems shing /
translated: Those who think that the presentation of valid cognition and its object is reality itself

original: tha snyad las ni zhes bya ba yang phyis kyi don byed @274a * //
analyzed: tha snyad las ni zhes bya ba yang phyis kyi don byed @274a * //
translated: Also, the phrase from the conventional is explained as being from the subsequent consciousness that performs the object's function.

original: pa'i shes pas so zhes 'chad par byed pa de dag la rigs pa dang 'gal ba de ni re zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i shes pas so zhes 'chad par byed pa de dag la rigs pa dang 'gal ba de ni re zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: The contradiction with reasoning that is stated in the passage above is first presented.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i don du brjod pa ni /
translated: The passage that states the contradiction with the treatise is the line that begins,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover. . . .üîΩThe line from the commentary that begins,

original: sngar gyi rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i tshad ma bstan nas /
analyzed: sngar gyi rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i tshad ma bstan nas /
translated: Previously, it was said that one realizes one's own nature from oneself, refers to the teaching of ultimate valid knowledge.üîΩThe line from the commentary that begins,

original: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces tha snyad pa'i tshad ma ston pa na /
analyzed: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid ces tha snyad pa'i tshad ma ston pa na /
translated: From the conventional, it is valid knowledge, refers to the teaching of conventional valid knowledge.üîΩThe line from the commentary that begins,

original: don dam par ji skad bshad pa rang rig pa gcig nyid tshad ma yin gyi yul gzhan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par ji skad bshad pa rang rig pa gcig nyid tshad ma yin gyi yul gzhan dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Ultimately, it is valid knowledge in the way that was explained, refers to the teaching of reflexive awareness.

original: gal te gnyi ga don dam pa pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga don dam pa pa yin na /
translated: If both are ultimate,üîΩwhat is the fault?üîΩThe line from the commentary that begins,

original: de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na / 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: In that case . . . presents the fault.üîΩThe line from the commentary that begins,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: If . . . explains the fault.

original: de ltar 'grel pa dang 'grel bshad la sogs pa'i lugs bsal bas ji ltar tha snyad las tshad ma yin pa de lta bu nyid nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'grel pa dang 'grel bshad la sogs pa'i lugs bsal bas ji ltar tha snyad las tshad ma yin pa de lta bu nyid nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: Thus, having refuted the system of the commentary, explanatory commentary, and so on, he summarizes how it is that it is a valid cognition in terms of conventional usage.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means:

original: ; rjes su dpag pa'i rten ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: ; rjes su dpag pa'i rten ni rgyu ste /
translated: The basis of inference is the cause.

original: gang zhig snar de lta bur gyur pa de ni don bya ba byed pa yin no zhes khyab par 'dzin par byed pa'i mtshams sbyor te de yang tha snyad de tsam gyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig snar de lta bur gyur pa de ni don bya ba byed pa yin no zhes khyab par 'dzin par byed pa'i mtshams sbyor te de yang tha snyad de tsam gyis grub pa yin no //
translated: The connector is the apprehension of the pervasion, ‚ÄúWhatever is like that is a functioning thing.‚Äù And that is established by mere conventional usage.

original: mngon sum gyis gzung ba la mtshams sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzung ba la mtshams sbyor ba yin na /
translated: If it were connected by perception,

original: mngon sum la ni dngos po la brten pa'i byed pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir sgro 'dogs pas mtshams sbyor ba ni tha snyad pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni dngos po la brten pa'i byed pa de lta bu yod pa ma yin no // de'i phyir sgro 'dogs pas mtshams sbyor ba ni tha snyad pa nyid do //
translated: perception would not have such a function based on things.üîΩTherefore, the connection by superimposition is conventional.

original: des na tha snyad tsam gyis grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rten mtshams sbyor bas rab tu grub pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas te /
analyzed: des na tha snyad tsam gyis grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i rten mtshams sbyor bas rab tu grub pa'i 'brel pa la brten nas te /
translated: Thus, based on the connection of the basis of inference, which is established by mere conventional usage, and based on the relation that is well established,

original: 'brel pa khas blangs nas phyis de 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba na phyogs kyi chos nyid gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa khas blangs nas phyis de 'dra ba'i dngos po mthong ba na phyogs kyi chos nyid gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Having accepted the relation, later, when one sees an entity like that, one grasps the property of the position.

original: don bya ba sgrub pa de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: don bya ba sgrub pa de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam pa can /
translated: The establishment of the object‚Äôs function is like this.

original: don bya ba de grub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba de grub par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the establishment of that object‚Äôs function.

original: de dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no zhes de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpog pas rtogs pa po 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba yin pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no zhes de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpog pas rtogs pa po 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Because it is like that, it is like the previous one. In this way, the knower engages by inferring its nature.

original: ji lta bur gyur pas she na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pas she na /
translated: In what way?

original: gzugs tsam mthong bas reg bya la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i don bya ba sgrub pa rtogs pa na zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: gzugs tsam mthong bas reg bya la sogs pa'i tshogs pa'i don bya ba sgrub pa rtogs pa na zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa na'o //
translated: When one realizes the establishment of the object‚Äôs function, such as the collection of tangibility, etc., by seeing mere form, it is in this way.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa gzhan la yang blta bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should look at other inferences,

original: 'brel pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they depend on the relation.

original: de ltar rjes @274b su dpag pa la tha snyad la gzhol ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rjes @274b su dpag pa la tha snyad la gzhol ba yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that inference is devoted to convention,

original: mngon sum la bshad pa'i phyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la bshad pa'i phyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the explanation of perception follows.

original: sngar rtsva tsam 'gugs kyang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni don dam par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar rtsva tsam 'gugs kyang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni don dam par brjod pa yin la /
translated: The statement that previously it was not able to attract even grass is a statement about the ultimate.

original: tha snyad du ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad du ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: But conventionally, it is said to be the engaging cause.

original: khyab pa 'dzin pa la shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi mi gsal na ni khyab pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin pa la shin tu gsal ba'i mngon sum nyid sgrub par byed pa yin gyi mi gsal na ni khyab pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid du bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: The direct perception that is very clear in apprehending the pervasion is the proof. But if it is unclear, it should not be considered to be apprehending the pervasion.

original: rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inference does not engage.

original: de 'jug na yang thus pa med pa la /
analyzed: de 'jug na yang thus pa med pa la /
translated: Even if it does engage, there is no infinite regress.

original: ldog pa la gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i stobs kyis khyab pa 'dzin la /
analyzed: ldog pa la gnod par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni khyab byed mi dmigs pa'i stobs kyis khyab pa 'dzin la /
translated: In the case of a countering reason, the apprehension of the pervasion is by the power of the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang mngon sum las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang mngon sum las yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: And the relation of the pervaded and the pervader is from direct perception. Therefore there is no infinite regress.

original: dka' ba'i phyir bshad zin pa'i don nyid dman pa la rtsod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: dka' ba'i phyir bshad zin pa'i don nyid dman pa la rtsod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i don du /
translated: Because it is difficult, the meaning that has already been explained is clarified by way of a dispute with a lesser person.

original: gal te yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes smos so //
translated: If, however, one says also,

original: gzhan gyi lta bar bya ba yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta bar bya ba yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: it is not the case that the object of another's view is perceived.

original: grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the conclusion is In this regard, etc.

original: tshad ma ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The valid cognition is not the object of understanding, is the meaning.

original: 'o na tshad ma'i tshul ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma'i tshul ci yin zhe na /
translated: Well, then, what is the method of valid cognition?

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The statement Moreover, etc. is made.üîΩThe imputation of a whole and a state in the collection of form, etc. is from the conventional one.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la yan lag can dang / gnas skabs can kun du brtags pa ni tha snyad du gcig pa las yin no zhes lab lob pa'i lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la yan lag can dang / gnas skabs can kun du brtags pa ni tha snyad du gcig pa las yin no zhes lab lob pa'i lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth chapter is concluded.

original: gcig nyid la brten nas de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid la brten nas de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement In dependence upon one, etc. means that the cognition which has that as its object is posited as valid cognition.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la yan lag can dang / gnas skabs can kun du brtags pa ni tha snyad byed pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la yan lag can dang / gnas skabs can kun du brtags pa ni tha snyad byed pa yang /
translated: The imputation of a whole and a state in the collection of form, etc. is also from the conventional one.

original: yul la sogs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the one object, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the time.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis and that‚Äù is an explanation.

original: 'di yang sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: yang lag can dang gnas skabs can med pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig nyid du nges she na /
analyzed: yang lag can dang gnas skabs can med pa'i phyir ci ltar gcig nyid du nges she na /
translated: Moreover, since there is no agent and no state, how can there be a determination of singularity?

original: gcig nyid du gyur pa zhen pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig nyid du gyur pa zhen pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is determined to be singular‚Äù is stated.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa de nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa tha mi dad pa de nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How can there be a determination of singularity in the case of an object and time that are not different?

original: de tha mi dad pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de tha mi dad pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is not different‚Äù is stated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yul dang dus la @275a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa'i yul dang dus la @275a * //
translated: The object that is a collection of form and so on, and the time and so on that are not different,

original: sogs pa tha dad pa med pa pa yang don dam pa pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sogs pa tha dad pa med pa pa yang don dam pa pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: are not ultimate.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs la /
translated: However, the collection of the capacity of the collection of form and so on

original: nus pa'i tshogs pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i tshogs pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
translated: is the agent. This is the sixth case, the dative.

original: de bzhin du byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag kyang gcig nyid du mngon par rlom pa yin no zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: de bzhin du byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag kyang gcig nyid du mngon par rlom pa yin no zhes 'brel te //
translated: Likewise, the past and future are also conceived as being one.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs gnyis brjod pa ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs gnyis brjod pa ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the two reasons are stated: because they belong to the same continuum, etc.

original: de bzhin du khyab pa 'dzin pa la sogs par de ma yin pa las ldog pa byas pa gcig tu rlom pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab pa 'dzin pa la sogs par de ma yin pa las ldog pa byas pa gcig tu rlom pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in the apprehension of the pervasion, etc., the exclusion of non-pot should be understood as the conception of a single pot.üîΩIn order to state another opinion,

original: 'dod pa gzhan 'god par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩ'dri bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan 'god par bya ba'i phyir / 'dri bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he asks:üîΩIf it is said that the cognition of the object is the effect of the cognition of the sign, then it would be the cause.

original: de'i tshe ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa don bya ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba'i shes pa med kyang don bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i tshe ni rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa don bya ba'i rgyu ni ma yin te bsgrub par bya ba'i shes pa med kyang don bya ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o ;
translated: The cognition that establishes the reason is not the cause of the object's function, because the object's function is observed even when the cognition to be established is absent.

original: / rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /üîΩ'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bkod nas sun 'byin pa ni /üîΩ'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having set forth the second conception, he refutes it:üîΩIf it is said that the cognition of the object is the effect of the cognition of the sign, then it would be the cause.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni don bya ba'i shes byed ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni don bya ba'i shes byed ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that establishes the object is not the cognition that accomplishes the object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don bya bsgrub pa de la the tshom yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don bya bsgrub pa de la the tshom yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is doubt about the accomplishment of the object, such as burning.

original: ci'i phyir the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir the tshom za zhe na /
translated: Why is there doubt?

original: don bya ba ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pas res 'ga' ba yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba ni rgyu gzhan la ltos pas res 'ga' ba yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is occasional, depending on other causes.

original: lan gnyi ga rim gyis 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: lan gnyi ga rim gyis 'chad pa ni /
translated: The answer to both is explained in sequence.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gal te shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gal te shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that cognition is not a valid cognition,

original: skyed byed nyid dang shes byed nyid nyams kyang /
analyzed: skyed byed nyid dang shes byed nyid nyams kyang /
translated: then the production and the establishment are impaired.

original: cung zad kyang mi gnod pa zhig na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi gnod pa zhig na /
translated: But if there is no harm at all,

original: shes pa de tshad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de tshad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then that cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma don bya ba'i thob par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la ltos par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma don bya ba'i thob par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la ltos par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, how can it be that a valid cognition is that which obtains the object?

original: don gyis mi stong yang don bya ba'i thob par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad na /
analyzed: don gyis mi stong yang don bya ba'i thob par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad na /
translated: But if it is not tenable that the non-empty object is the means of attaining the object to be attained,

original: 'di tha snyad byed pa po rnams la nye bar mkho ba ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di tha snyad byed pa po rnams la nye bar mkho ba ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: what is the use of this conventional expression?

original: 'di la smras pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze aa rtsa ta'i lugs so //
analyzed: 'di la smras pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze aa rtsa ta'i lugs so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is said‚Äù refers to the system of the Brahmin A·πõ·π£·π≠a.

original: de tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de ni tshad ma nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition that establishes it is a means of valid knowledge.

original: gal te don bya ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don bya ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: If one doubts the object to be attained,

original: sgrub @275b pa'i shes pa ci ltar tshad ma yin zhe na des phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgrub @275b pa'i shes pa ci ltar tshad ma yin zhe na des phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: how can the cognition that establishes it be a means of valid knowledge?üîΩThe answer is ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: thabs las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: thabs las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from the means‚Äù and so on is the commentary.

original: de la the tshom zhes bya ba la ni thabs las byung ba la'o //
analyzed: de la the tshom zhes bya ba la ni thabs las byung ba la'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúdoubt‚Äù refers to the means.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi don te /
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa grub pa'i rang bzhin gyi don te /
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of which‚Äù means the object that is the nature of the desired accomplishment.

original: dgos pa gang la yod pa'i tshad ma tshol ba'i rtsom pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa gang la yod pa'i tshad ma tshol ba'i rtsom pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the composition of the search for a valid cognition for the sake of which it is, that is what is so called.

original: de ma grub ce na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma grub ce na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is not established,

original: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ma grub pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ma grub pa nyid yin na /
translated: if the establishment of the object of desire is not established,

original: de'i tshe don bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe don bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa ma grub pa ste /
translated: then at that time the establishment of the connection with the probandum, which is the nature of the object to be accomplished, is not established.

original: ma nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ci ltar don bya ba'i sgrub par brjod de /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i don gang yin pa de ci ltar don bya ba'i sgrub par brjod de /
translated: How can that which is of uncertain meaning be said to be the proof of the object to be accomplished?

original: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa bzhin du sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa bzhin du sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like the strands of hair and so on that are observed by one with myodesopsia. It is the meaning of the statement that it is not a proof.

original: tshad ma 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: This is the commentary on ‚Äúfrom this valid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'on te tshad ma des don sgrub pa'i dngos po bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig tsam nye bar bkod pa don bya ba dang de'i sgrub par byed pa dag la /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma des don sgrub pa'i dngos po bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig tsam nye bar bkod pa don bya ba dang de'i sgrub par byed pa dag la /
translated: Or, if it is the case that the thing which is the establishment of the object by that valid cognition is indicated, and so on, the mere words are set forth, and the object to be accomplished and its proof are

original: 'gal ba'i the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir nges par byed pa nyid nyams so //
translated: Because it does not eliminate the doubt that is in conflict with it, it is not a determinative cognition.

original: 'di ni tshad ma'i nyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba tsam snying po yin no zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma'i nyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba tsam snying po yin no zhes bsams nas /
translated: This is not a fault of the valid cognition, he thinks, because the mere thesis is the essence.

original: gal te shes byed ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te shes byed ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If it is not a proof, etc.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi lugs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni rang gi lugs te /
translated: Therefore, it should be taught elsewhere, he says, referring to his own system.

original: the tshom khas blang bas ni ma yin gyi /
