analyzed: the tshom khas blang bas ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not by accepting doubt, but

original: nges pa nyid kyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kyis yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: by certainty, is the meaning.

original: shes pa tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa ni'o //
analyzed: shes pa tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa ni'o //
translated: The cognition is a valid cognition, he says, referring to the cognition that is the proof.

original: don bya ba'i rang bzhin la the tshom za ba'i phyir tshad mar ci ltar rtogs snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: don bya ba'i rang bzhin la the tshom za ba'i phyir tshad mar ci ltar rtogs snyam du dogs na /
translated: How is it a valid cognition, he wonders, because of doubt about the nature of the object to be known?

original: don bya ba'i rang bzhin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don bya ba'i rang bzhin zhes gsungs te /
translated: The nature of the object to be known, he says.

original: nges pa yin gyi the tshom ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa yin gyi the tshom ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is certain, not doubtful, is the meaning.

original: don bya ba'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ci ltar nges she na /
analyzed: don bya ba'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ci ltar nges she na /
translated: How can it be ascertained that the nature of the object to be accomplished will occur?

original: de bdag ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bdag ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is the nature of that.‚Äù

original: don bya ba de'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad brjod de /
analyzed: don bya ba de'i bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad brjod de /
translated: That which has the cognition that establishes the nature of the object to be accomplished is called ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po ni de bdag go //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de bdag go //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of that.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba'i rang bzhin de la de skad ces @276a * //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba'i rang bzhin de la de skad ces @276a * //
translated: That which is the nature of the object to be accomplished that will occur is called ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: bya'o ; / de dag gi mthu ni nus pa ste nges so //üîΩsngar bsgrub par bya ba'i shes pa la don bya ba byed pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de dag gi mthu ni nus pa ste nges so // sngar bsgrub par bya ba'i shes pa la don bya ba byed pa nyid dam /
translated: The power of that is the ability to ascertain.

original: don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba nyid du nges par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba nyid du nges par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: It is ascertained that the cognition to be established either performs the function of the object to be accomplished or arises from the nature of the object to be accomplished.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i 'og rol du nges par don bya ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'i 'og rol du nges par don bya ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of the object to be accomplished is seen after the cognition that establishes it.

original: des na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: des na sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa la /
translated: Therefore, in the cognition that establishes it,

original: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa de ni don bya ba byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang zhig de lta bur gyur pa de ni don bya ba byed pa'am /
translated: That which is so is a functional object.üîΩ

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don bya ba'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: That which is so is non-erroneous with regard to the nature of the object to be accomplished or the object to be arisen.

original: dper na sngar mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngar mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the previously seen cognition that accomplishes.

original: 'di yang de lta bu yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba la ltos nas tshad mar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang de lta bu yin no zhes de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba la ltos nas tshad mar nges pa yin te /
translated: This is also like that. Thus, it is ascertained as valid cognition in dependence on having the same nature and arising from that.

original: 'di ni 'di'i 'grel par gsal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i 'grel par gsal lo //
translated: This is clear in the commentary on this.

original: 'di lta bu'i rigs can nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa gnyis ni 'jig rten pha rol grub par yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rigs can nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa gnyis ni 'jig rten pha rol grub par yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The two inferences of this type will also be explained in the proof of the existence of other worlds.

original: don byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa la 'jug pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa la 'jug pa tsam yin te /
translated: As for the cognition that performs a function, etc., this is merely an introduction to the explanation,

original: rtsod pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is not a subject of dispute.

original: 'chad pa nyid ni sngar gyi /
analyzed: 'chad pa nyid ni sngar gyi /
translated: The explanation itself is from the previous:

original: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cognition that accomplishesüîΩis non-erroneous with regard to the object to be accomplished.

original: don byed pa rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'brel to //
analyzed: don byed pa rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'brel to //
translated: The meaning is that it is understood to be a causal process.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: smras pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: smras pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúwhen‚Äù up to ‚Äúat that time‚Äù is the answer.

original: rnal 'byor ba la sogs pas bshig pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong bzhin du don mi brtan pa gang yin pa de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la sogs pas bshig pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong bzhin du don mi brtan pa gang yin pa de ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir de'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: The cognition of a dream object is not a valid cognition because the object, being destroyed by the yogi and so on, is not a stable object that performs a function.

original: shes pa med par ni don gyi don byed pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa med par ni don gyi don byed pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The point is that cognition is the conveyor of the object‚Äôs causal process because the object‚Äôs causal process is not conveyed without cognition.

original: yang ci'i phyir don bya ba go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel bar byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mthu las byung ba zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don bya ba go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa sel bar byed pa de'i bdag nyid kyi mthu las byung ba zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Again, why is it that the object‚Äôs causal process is conveyed? To dispel this doubt, the passage from ‚Äúthe power of the object‚Äù to ‚Äúthe nature of the previous cognition‚Äù is a commentary on the line ‚Äúarising from the power of the object.‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar skye bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar skye bar byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it definitely produces it means because it completely produces it.

original: de thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i don thob pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has attained it means it has attained the object that will occur.

original: 'dis don bya ba byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i @276b phyir ;
analyzed: 'dis don bya ba byed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i @276b phyir ;
translated: Because it has the nature of performing a function,

original: don bya ba byed pa nyid go bar byed pa na /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa nyid go bar byed pa na /
translated: when it causes understanding of the performance of a function,

original: don bya ba byed pa'i go byed yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa'i go byed yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is said to be the cause of understanding the performance of a function.üîΩIn reality means that it is expressed in dependence on a convention that is even lower than that, and it is expressed while remaining in the convention itself.

original: dngos su na zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang dman pa'i tha snyad la ltos pas tha snyad nyid la gnas nas brjod pa yin no des na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin dag gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos su na zhes bya ba ni de bas kyang dman pa'i tha snyad la ltos pas tha snyad nyid la gnas nas brjod pa yin no des na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin dag gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the former and latter natures are the same,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa der yang de'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa der yang de'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
translated: the former and latter consciousnesses are also just that nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they conform to the object of consciousness.

original: des na yul bzhin du shes pa gnyis kyang de'i bdag nyid rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na yul bzhin du shes pa gnyis kyang de'i bdag nyid rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, just like the object, the two cognitions are of the same nature, and this is reasonable.

original: gal te don bya ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nyams su myong bas gnod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don bya ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nyams su myong bas gnod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt this undermined by the experience of apprehending the object of activity?

original: don bya ba nyams su myong na yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: don bya ba nyams su myong na yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Even if the object of activity is experienced, it would still exist.

original: des na de'i don du 'jug pa yang mi rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na de'i don du 'jug pa yang mi rigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is unreasonable to engage in that activity.

original: brjod pa de kho na nyid du don bya ba mngon sum du bya bar mi smra bas gang gis nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: brjod pa de kho na nyid du don bya ba mngon sum du bya bar mi smra bas gang gis nyes pa 'dir thal bar 'gyur /
translated: We reply: Since we do not say that the object of activity is directly perceived in reality, what fault would ensue?

original: 'on kyang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: However, we do posit the apprehension of the object of activity.

original: de la ji ltar khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig 'dzin pa yin yang /
analyzed: de la ji ltar khyab pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig 'dzin pa yin yang /
translated: In that regard, just as when the universal is apprehended, the direct perception of the moment of the intrinsic identity is apprehended,

original: spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis spyi'i yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis spyi'i yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa bzhin nam /
translated: but it is posited as having a universal object due to the power of the conception of a universal,

original: ltar gzugs tsam mthong ba na /
analyzed: ltar gzugs tsam mthong ba na /
translated: in the same way, when form alone is seen,

original: bdag gis bum pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis rig pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang de'i don bya ba bdag gis mthong ngo
analyzed: bdag gis bum pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis rig pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang de'i don bya ba bdag gis mthong ngo
translated: Just as the cognition of a pot is posited as apprehending form in dependence on the thought ‚ÄúI see a pot,‚Äù in the same way, direct perception that establishes an object is posited as apprehending the object in dependence on the thought ‚ÄúI see the object.‚Äù

original: snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis don bya ba 'dzin par rung ba'i dngos po gzung ba nyid du rnam par 'jog pas don bya ba 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa las ji ltar 'da'/
analyzed: snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis don bya ba 'dzin par rung ba'i dngos po gzung ba nyid du rnam par 'jog pas don bya ba 'dzin par rnam par gzhag pa las ji ltar 'da'/
translated: How can you avoid positing the apprehension of the object?

original: gzhan yang mthong bzhin pa 'di nyid ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong bzhin pa 'di nyid ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this very seeing is not the performance of the object‚Äôs function.

original: 'on kyang 'byung ba dang byung bar 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'byung ba dang byung bar 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: However, it is the arising and the future arising.

original: de la 'das pa ni 'jug pa'i yul ma yin la /
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni 'jug pa'i yul ma yin la /
translated: The past is not the object of engagement.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur bar yang ma mthong ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa yang ji ltar nges /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur bar yang ma mthong ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa yang ji ltar nges /
translated: And since the future is not seen, how can it be ascertained?

original: da ltar ba dang gzhan dag gcig nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar ba dang gzhan dag gcig nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the present and the other are reified as being the same.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de'i don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid der sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de'i don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid der sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: If that is so, then the activity of the object is reified as the nature of the present.

original: de yang @277a * //
analyzed: de yang @277a * //
translated: And that

original: don bya ba la mi ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba la mi ltos pa yin no //
translated: does not depend on the activity of the object.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong na ni da ltar ba 'ba' zhig tu gzung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong na ni da ltar ba 'ba' zhig tu gzung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the present were empty of the nature of the future, it would be apprehended as the present alone, and not as a reification of the other.

original: de'i phyir don bya ba dang lhan cig pa nyid sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don bya ba dang lhan cig pa nyid sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the present is reified as simultaneous with the activity of the object.

original: sgro btags pas 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa na yang don bya ba 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa na yang nan gyis 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pas 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa na yang don bya ba 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa na yang nan gyis 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: When the apprehension of reification is posited, the apprehension of the activity of the object is also posited.

original: gal te de ltar na yang de byed par mthong ba la don bya ba mthong ngo zhes nges pa med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang de byed par mthong ba la don bya ba mthong ngo zhes nges pa med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, if one sees the activity of the object, is it not certain that one sees the present?

original: de lta na ni 'o na bum pa la yang gzugs dmigs pa ni reg pa la sogs pa dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bum pa la yang gzugs dmigs pa ni reg pa la sogs pa dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa ma mthong ngam /
translated: If that is so, then in the case of a pot, it is not that the pot is not perceived when its form is perceived, but that its tactility, etc. are not perceived.

original: ci 'on kyang bum pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las lhag ma mthong bar rnam par gzhag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: ci 'on kyang bum pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las lhag ma mthong bar rnam par gzhag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Or, is it that the pot is perceived only in the sense that the thought ‚ÄúI see a pot‚Äù is formed?

original: skabs la yang don bya ba byed pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las don bya ba'i mthong ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
analyzed: skabs la yang don bya ba byed pa mthong ngo snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las don bya ba'i mthong ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference between the two cases, because in the case of the pot, the thought ‚ÄúI see the object of activity‚Äù is formed only in the sense that the pot is seen.

original: gal te don bya ba nges na res 'ga' ji ltar mi thob ce na sgrub par byed pa la yang res 'ga' mi 'thob pa nyid mtshungs so //
analyzed: gal te don bya ba nges na res 'ga' ji ltar mi thob ce na sgrub par byed pa la yang res 'ga' mi 'thob pa nyid mtshungs so //
translated: If the object of activity is ascertained, then why is it not sometimes obtained? It is the same for the means of attainment, which is sometimes not obtained.

original: ci ste sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig gi bshig pa 'am ma zhugs pas ma thob par zad kyi /
analyzed: ci ste sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'ga' zhig gi bshig pa 'am ma zhugs pas ma thob par zad kyi /
translated: If the means of attainment is existent, it is not obtained only because something is destroyed or does not arise.

original: 'jig pa la sogs pa med na ni thob pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la sogs pa med na ni thob pa kho na'o //
translated: If there is no destruction, etc., it is obtained.

original: don bya ba ni bshig pa la sogs pa med kyang thob par mi 'gyur te /üîΩma skyes pa rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don bya ba ni bshig pa la sogs pa med kyang thob par mi 'gyur te / ma skyes pa rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if the means of attainment does not exist, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.

original: sgrub par byed pa yang de kho na nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa med pa dang / 'jig byed la sogs pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa ma skyes pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir mi 'thob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang de kho na nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa med pa dang / 'jig byed la sogs pa med kyang sgrub par byed pa ma skyes pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir mi 'thob pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.üîΩBut if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yod kyang don bya ba med par mi nus te /üîΩsgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir da ltar bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir don bya ba dang de byed pa gnyi ga rtogs par rnam par gnas pas /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sgrub par byed pa'i rang bzhin yod kyang don bya ba med par mi nus te / sgrub par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir da ltar bzhin no // de'i phyir don bya ba dang de byed pa gnyi ga rtogs par rnam par gnas pas /
translated: But if the means of attainment exists, the object to be attained is not attained, even though it exists, because it is not arisen.

original: da ltar ba'i shes pa nyid du ma 'ongs pa rjes su zhugs pa yin te /üîΩyul la yul bzhin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i shes pa nyid du ma 'ongs pa rjes su zhugs pa yin te /üîΩyul la yul bzhin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: But if

original: 'o na rgyu rtogs par yang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa 'dus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu rtogs par yang 'bras bu'i rtogs pa 'dus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, the realization of the effect would be included in the realization of the cause.

original: tha snyad la ltos nas de ni de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad la ltos nas de ni de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: This is so, but only in terms of conventional truth.

original: 'on kyang rgyu rtogs na 'bras bu @277b mngon du byas pa nyid du ni mi 'dod de mang du brjod pas chog go //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu rtogs na 'bras bu @277b mngon du byas pa nyid du ni mi 'dod de mang du brjod pas chog go //
translated: However, we do not maintain that when the cause is realized, the effect is actually accomplished.

original: de las 'byung ba'i mthu yis zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i mthu yis zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir yang na zhes smos so //
translated: In order to explain the phrase ‚Äúby the power of its arising,‚Äù the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is used.

original: des zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the effect that will arise.

original: des khyab pa'i phyir khyab byed du 'gyur mod rgyur go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na tha dad pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: des khyab pa'i phyir khyab byed du 'gyur mod rgyur go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na tha dad pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: Since it is pervaded by that, it is pervaded by the effect that will arise. But how can it be the cause? The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù is used.

original: de med par zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu med par ro //
analyzed: de med par zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout that‚Äù means without the effect that will arise.

original: gal te gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba skye ba de'i tshe snga ma yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba skye ba de'i tshe snga ma yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the effect that will arise exists when it arises, then it already exists.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de yang ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ci ltar 'ga' zhig gis skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de yang ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ci ltar 'ga' zhig gis skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: Whatever exists is devoid of all dependence, so how could it be produced by something else?

original: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba de skyes pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba de skyes pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: When that which is to arise has arisen,

original: snga ma de zhig zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma de zhig zin pa'i phyir /
translated: then that which is to arise has already ceased.

original: ji ltar des bskyed par bya ba yin snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: ji ltar des bskyed par bya ba yin snyam du bsams nas /
translated: How could it be produced by that?

original: pha rol pos ma skyes pa ltar zhes smras so //
analyzed: pha rol pos ma skyes pa ltar zhes smras so //
translated: Thinking this, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is as if it were not arisen.‚Äù

original: lan du skyes pa yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du skyes pa yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúHow could it be arisen?‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu sngar byung ba'i 'bras bu'i dus na med pas rgyu ma yin /
analyzed: don 'di yin te gal te 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu sngar byung ba'i 'bras bu'i dus na med pas rgyu ma yin /
translated: The meaning is as follows: If the cause of that which is to arise does not exist at the time of the effect that has already arisen, it is not a cause.

original: de'i tshe sngar byung ba yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pas rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sngar byung ba yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pas rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If that is so, then that which has already arisen does not exist at the time of the effect, so it would not be a cause.

original: gzhan dag khyad par ston pa ni gal te 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag khyad par ston pa ni gal te 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others explain the distinction as follows: If this exists,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang yod pa la sogs pa srid pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang yod pa la sogs pa srid pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it possible that that which is to arise exists?

original: des na de yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: des na de yang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Therefore, if you think that it is also a cause, he says, ‚ÄúThe elements are not the cause of the effect.‚Äù

original: des byed pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: des byed pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: ‚Äú It is not a creator‚Äù means that it is not an element.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni 'di la yang khyad par med pa nyid du ston pa ni yod dang skyes gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas ni 'di la yang khyad par med pa nyid du ston pa ni yod dang skyes gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proponent of tenets shows that there is no difference here in the case of existence and arising.

original: yod pa'i sgras bstan pa'i don 'chad pa ni 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgras bstan pa'i don 'chad pa ni 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning indicated by the term existence is explained in ‚ÄúIf this exists.‚Äù

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes smras pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin de las gzhan pa'i de na srid par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes smras pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin de las gzhan pa'i de na srid par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf this exists, that arises‚Äù does not indicate that the nature of an existent thing is different from that.

original: skyes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa skyes pa 'ang yod pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa skyes pa 'ang yod pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: With respect to arising, the statement ‚ÄúThe arisen is not different from the nature of the existent‚Äù is made.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes so zhes brjod par yang sngar gyi yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes so zhes brjod par yang sngar gyi yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi don yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause this has arisen, that arises‚Äù indicates the meaning of the existent thing as before.

original: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam tha dad par zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam tha dad par zad do //
translated: However, there is only a difference in the mere desire to speak.

original: des na gnyi ga ltar yang 'di'i rang bzhin yod na /
analyzed: des na gnyi ga ltar yang 'di'i rang bzhin yod na /
translated: Therefore, if the nature of both exists,

original: @278a * // 'di'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes brjod pa yin la de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: @278a * // 'di'i rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes brjod pa yin la de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu la yang mtshungs so //
translated: it is said that the nature of this arises, and that is the same for the cause of what is to arise.

original: khyad par smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par smra ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka's doubt is anticipated: If it is said...

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du ci zhes 'dri bar mdzad do //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba yod pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du ci zhes 'dri bar mdzad do //
translated: The proponent of tenets asks, What? in order to show the nature of existence.

original: de lta yin mod ce na zhes dogs pa bsu nas yun ring du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta yin mod ce na zhes dogs pa bsu nas yun ring du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, anticipating the doubt, For a long time... and so on is said.

original: 'on te bar chod pa'i lus la sogs pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba des na rnam par rtog pa la de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i yod pa dang skye ba med do zhes ci ste brjod snyam na lus la sogs pa yang zhes gsungs so
analyzed: 'on te bar chod pa'i lus la sogs pa nyid rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba des na rnam par rtog pa la de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i yod pa dang skye ba med do zhes ci ste brjod snyam na lus la sogs pa yang zhes gsungs so
translated: But if the body and so on that are interrupted become the cause of the conception, then why is it said that the conception does not arise immediately from existence and arising? The body and so on... is said.

original: // 'gro bzhin pa na rtsva la reg pa'i shes pa ltar gnyid mthug po log pa la yang /
analyzed: // 'gro bzhin pa na rtsva la reg pa'i shes pa ltar gnyid mthug po log pa la yang /
translated: Just as when one is walking, the consciousness that touches the grass,

original: gnyid rtsom snga ma na yod pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: gnyid rtsom snga ma na yod pa'i shes pa la /
translated: in deep sleep, too, the consciousness that exists in the prior beginning of sleep

original: shes pa tsam skyes pa khyad par ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ma tshor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa tsam skyes pa khyad par ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir ma tshor ba ma yin te /
translated: is not unconscious because it is simply consciousness, free from all distinctions.

original: de las ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: de las ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that it is a conceptual consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni lus la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par de dang 'brel pa'i sems tsam las skyes pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir goms pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni lus la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par de dang 'brel pa'i sems tsam las skyes pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The point is that a conceptual consciousness that follows the specific features of the object of familiarity and that conforms to the absence of the object of familiarity does not arise from mere mind, which is connected to that specific feature, just as the body does.

original: tshig le'ur byas par sogs pa'i sgras bstan pa /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas par sogs pa'i sgras bstan pa /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the verse refer to the following.

original: 'di ni 'dir byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs nye bar bzung nas brjod pa ni byed pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs nye bar bzung nas brjod pa ni byed pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe agent, too‚Äù is made in the context of the position that this is the agent here.

original: des na 'di 'dir byed do zhes bya bas ni 'di'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas na /
analyzed: des na 'di 'dir byed do zhes bya bas ni 'di'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas na /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThis is this‚Äù indicates that its intrinsic reality is present.

original: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pas snga ma las tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pas snga ma las tha dad pa med do //
translated: Since it indicates that its intrinsic reality is present, it is not different from the previous statement.

original: de nyid smras pa ni rang gi ngo bo las rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa ni rang gi ngo bo las rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúfrom its intrinsic reality‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom its intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na yang rang gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba'i lnga pas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rang gi ngo bo las zhes bya ba'i lnga pas /
translated: If that is so, then the statement ‚Äúfrom its intrinsic reality‚Äù would have the fifth case ending.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo gnyis dus gcig gi tshe nye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo gnyis dus gcig gi tshe nye bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the two intrinsic realities exist at the same time,

original: de'i tshe khyed la yang mi 'dod pa grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyed la yang mi 'dod pa grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: then at that time, even for you, the undesirable consequence would be established.

original: 'bras bu'i dus su ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus su ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is indicated by the passage, ‚ÄúAt the time of the effect . . . ‚Äù

original: ci ste rigs pa'i stobs kyis lnga pa 'di ni med na mi 'byung ba ston pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste rigs pa'i stobs kyis lnga pa 'di ni med na mi 'byung ba ston pa yin na /
translated: But if you say that the fifth case ending indicates the invariable relation,

original: de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs kyi go skabs kyang yod do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe kho bo'i phyogs kyi go skabs kyang yod do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: then at that time, there is also an opportunity for our position.

original: @278b med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @278b med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is indicated by the passage, ‚ÄúThe invariable relation . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di byed do zhes bya ba yang tshig gi sdeb sbyor tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di byed do zhes bya ba yang tshig gi sdeb sbyor tsam yin gyi /
translated: This is just a verbal formulation, ‚ÄúThis does that.‚Äù

original: byed pa'i phyogs las don gzhan ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: byed pa'i phyogs las don gzhan ma yin pa des na /
translated: Since it is not a different object from the side of the action,

original: 'di ni de nyid kyis rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de nyid kyis rtogs so //
translated: it is understood by that itself.

original: khyad par smra bas 'on te mthong ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: khyad par smra bas 'on te mthong ba zhes smos so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says, ‚ÄúBut it is seen.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / sngar ma byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not an element, meaning it is not seen, and it does not exist prior to that.

original: mthong ba khyab byed nyid du nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: mthong ba khyab byed nyid du nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Taking the pervasiveness of seeing as the basis,

original: re zhig sun 'byin par smras pa ni mthong ba rang gi ngo bos khyab byed nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sun 'byin par smras pa ni mthong ba rang gi ngo bos khyab byed nyid du rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: first the refutation is stated: Seeing is not understood to be pervasive by nature,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the effect is not understood.

original: 'on te mthong ba la sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba la sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs na /
translated: But if the pervasiveness at the time of the effect is understood in terms of the nature superimposed on seeing,

original: de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyab byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyab byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And at that time, the cause of what is to arise would be the pervader, which has the nature of an imputation.

original: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù is an explanation.

original: phye phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: phye phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The explanation of the latter part is ‚Äúwhen.‚Äù

original: / gal te de ltar byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus su yod pa sngar byung bas 'bras bu khyab par 'gyur gyi mthong ba phyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: / gal te de ltar byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus su yod pa sngar byung bas 'bras bu khyab par 'gyur gyi mthong ba phyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: If it were like that, then what is to arise and what has arisen would exist at the same time, and the effect would be pervaded by what has arisen earlier, not by what arises later.

original: ci ltar khyab snyam du dogs pa na /
analyzed: ci ltar khyab snyam du dogs pa na /
translated: Fearing that one might think, ‚ÄúHow could it pervade?‚Äù

original: khyab pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyab pa de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat pervasion is . . .‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi mthong bar 'gyur bas zhes smras so//
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthong bar 'gyur bas zhes smras so//
translated: He says, ‚Äúby what is to be seen.‚Äù

original: lan du de'i tshe zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan du de'i tshe zhes bya ste /
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúAt that time . . .‚Äù

original: khyed kyi dri ba'i skabs med do //
analyzed: khyed kyi dri ba'i skabs med do //
translated: There is no opportunity for your question.

original: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba las skyes zin pa nyid du sems pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong ba las skyes zin pa nyid du sems pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because it exists‚Äù means thinking that it has already arisen from seeing.

original: mthong bar 'gyur ba la yang de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur ba la yang de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú It is the same for what is to be seen.‚Äù

original: rang gi dus kyi khyad par can gyis so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dus kyi khyad par can gyis so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is distinguished by its own time.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o ;
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: /'di ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: /'di ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the philosophical position.

original: mthong ba yang de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba yang de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing does not exist at that time.

original: bskyed nas gnas pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: bskyed nas gnas pa la 'gal ba ci yod snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is no contradiction in its enduring after it has arisen,

original: de rang bzhin nyid kyis ni gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang bzhin nyid kyis ni gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: it does not endure by its own intrinsic reality,

original: yang skyed byed yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang skyed byed yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would arise again.

original: des na rang bzhin de ni zhig pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: des na rang bzhin de ni zhig pa kho na'o ;
translated: Therefore, its intrinsic reality is destroyed.

original: / de bzhin du sngar byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs nye bar dgod pa'i ni /
analyzed: / de bzhin du sngar byung ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs nye bar dgod pa'i ni /
translated: In the same way, the position that is stated in the line ‚ÄúWhatever has arisen previously‚Äù

original: snga ma nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma nyid do zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: skabs kyi rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: skabs kyi rgyu nyid do //
translated: The reason is the context.

original: lan du snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: lan du snga ma dang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúPrevious and later,‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang @279a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang @279a * //
translated: This is clarified in the line ‚ÄúBoth are untenable.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The anticipation of an objection is ‚ÄúBut if‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: snga mar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snga mar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The former is what is asserted.

original: mthong bar sgro btags pa ni mthong ngo snyam du sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bar sgro btags pa ni mthong ngo snyam du sgro btags pa'o //
translated: The superimposition of seeing is the superimposition of ‚ÄúI see.‚Äù

original: mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur ba'o snyam du spro btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'gyur ba'o snyam du spro btags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of what is to be seen is what is to be seen. The meaning is that the superimposition is ‚ÄúI will see.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu nyid yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i rgyu nyid yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because that is so, the cause itself does not exist.

original: 'on kyang sngar byung ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar byung ba kho na'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: However, it is thought that it is only what has occurred previously.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di thams cad dgos pa med pa nyid du dgongs nas phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so//
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'di thams cad dgos pa med pa nyid du dgongs nas phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so//
translated: The proponent of the conclusion, thinking that all of this is pointless, says ‚ÄúIf they are mutually dependent‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf what does not exist‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on is the explanation.

original: rgyu gang la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu yod pa'i rgyu de ni 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: A cause that definitely has an effect is a cause that definitely produces an effect.

original: 'bras bu phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The results that follow later, etc. are easy to understand.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba dag go//
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba dag go//
translated: Both means the former and the latter.

original: khyab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang phyed dang gsum gyis ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rkang phyed dang gsum gyis ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The half-verse beginning with ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù is a summary.

original: gang zhig tha dad par gyur pa'i khyab par byed pa de nyid ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad par gyur pa'i khyab par byed pa de nyid ni rgyu yin te /
translated: That which is a pervader that is different is a cause.

original: tha dad pa nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid gnyis rgyu'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid dang khyab par byed pa nyid gnyis rgyu'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that difference and being a pervader are the reasons for being a cause.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur brgyur smra ba'i dgos pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur brgyur smra ba'i dgos pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another purpose of the proponents of emergence is stated.

original: pha rol gyi 'jig rten dpog pa 'di las yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'jig rten dpog pa 'di las yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is from the inference of the other world.

original: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: rgyur gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan ni zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyur gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan ni zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The other reason for positing a cause should be understood.

original: 'bras bu dang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang ngo //
translated: Both are the cause and the result that necessarily arises from the cause.

original: ring du 'gro yang ci dgos te /
analyzed: ring du 'gro yang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to go far?

original: rnam 'grel du bshad pa'i spros pa thams cad gsung rab tu dngos su ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam 'grel du bshad pa'i spros pa thams cad gsung rab tu dngos su ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the elaborations explained in the Pramiirtawirttikii are not actually established in the scriptures,

original: bzhed pa ma yin pa dang / rang dbang gi skyon du ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhed pa ma yin pa dang / rang dbang gi skyon du ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: why would it not be the case that it is not the belief of the Arya and that it is a fault of his independence?

analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi lugs la sgrub par byed pa dang 'gal ba med pa dang rnam par dpyad bzod pa nyid blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in our system, it is proper to accept that it is not contradictory to the proof and that it can withstand analysis.

original: yon tan gsum dang ldan pas rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan gsum dang ldan pas rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called proper because it possesses the three qualities.

original: 'di ma grub ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ma grub ma yin nam /
translated: But isn't this not established?

original: slob dpon dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: slob dpon dang 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it contradicts the Acarya.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: For it is said:

original: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
analyzed: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
translated: Because it arises later, it is not the cause.

original: zhes bya ba dang / rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: And: All causes exist prior to their effects.

original: 'di la yang brjod pa rigs par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod pa rigs par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said: It is proper to say that this is seen to be logical.

original: cung zad kyang mi 'grig pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi 'grig pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means there is not the slightest inconsistency.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad du rab tu grub /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad du rab tu grub /
translated: Thus, it is well established conventionally.

original: sngar 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid la brten nas de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: sngar 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid la brten nas de skad du brjod do //
translated: It is called that in dependence on the prior cause itself.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ltar dngos po nyid yin gyi nges tha snyad du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa ltar dngos po nyid yin gyi nges tha snyad du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the future is the entity itself, like momentariness, and so on. It is not a conventional activity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang der 'di nye bar ma bkod de gzhan dag kyang /üîΩsngar byung ba rgyur bstan pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid mngon par 'dod pa yin yang ma bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang der 'di nye bar ma bkod de gzhan dag kyang / sngar byung ba rgyur bstan pa nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid mngon par 'dod pa yin yang ma bstan to //
translated: For that very reason, it is not set forth there, because others will understand it through the mere teaching of the prior cause.üîΩEven though the cause of the future is asserted, it is not taught, because it is understood through the mere teaching of the prior cause.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid do zhes mtha' yongs su dag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid do zhes mtha' yongs su dag pas rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not understood through the mere statement ‚ÄúThe cause of the future,‚Äù because the end is not purified.

original: gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid par dogs pa na /
analyzed: gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba srid par dogs pa na /
translated: When there is the possibility of an obstruction or incompleteness,

original: da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis yod par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis yod par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the present nature itself is not ascertained to exist.

original: 'o na ci ltar rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rgyu nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How then is it a cause?

original: gang la snga ma dang phyi ma mthong ba der rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med la /
analyzed: gang la snga ma dang phyi ma mthong ba der rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nyams pa med la /

analyzed: tha dad la des pa yang rgyu ma yin pa mad pa'i phyir / gzhal bya khas blangs nas / tshig la brtsir ci yod /
translated: If one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.

analyzed: rab tu grags pa la ltos nas ni / 'bras bu mi dmigs par bshad kyi /
translated: If one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.

original: de kho nar ni de yang rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni slob dpon dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar ni de yang rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid ni slob dpon dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: If one sees the prior and subsequent, then the cause is established.üîΩIf

original: bshad zin pa'i don gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang lhan cig nye bar sdud de /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i don gzhan gyi 'dod pa dang lhan cig nye bar sdud de /
translated: The meaning of the other assertions that have already been explained are combined together.

original: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de don skye ba'i rgyu 'am zhes 'brel te ;
analyzed: gal te sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa de don skye ba'i rgyu 'am zhes 'brel te ;
translated: If the cognition that is the proof is the cause of the arising of the object,

original: 'dis ni sgrub byed kyi shes pa'i yul yang mtshan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrub byed kyi shes pa'i yul yang mtshan par bya'o //
translated: then the object of the proving cognition should also be indicated.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained in terms of the other systems.

original: rigs pa can la sogs pa dag kyang /üîΩrgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog par khas len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pa dag kyang / rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog par khas len pa'i phyir /
translated: Even the NaiyƒÅyikas and so onüîΩaccept that the effect is inferred from the cause.

original: don bya ba nges par khas blangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: don bya ba nges par khas blangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore it is taught that they definitely accept the object to be the effect.

original: gal te shes pa de don skye ba'i rang bzhin nam zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gal te shes pa de don skye ba'i rang bzhin nam zhes 'brel to //
translated: If that cognition is the nature of the arising of the object,

original: don skye zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don skye zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then the object arises.

original: don bya ba grub pa ste /
analyzed: don bya ba grub pa ste /
translated: The object to be establishedüîΩis the effect.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa des de byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa des de byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement of its nature that produces that effect

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis mi 'khrul par bstan pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis mi 'khrul par bstan pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: is taught to be nonerroneous by its nature.

original: gal te shes pa de don skye ba'i 'bras bu zhes 'brel to /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de don skye ba'i 'bras bu zhes 'brel to /
translated: If consciousness is related to the object as its effect,

original: 'di ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu la bsams nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu la bsams nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: this is said with reference to the cause of its arising.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrnam pa gsum ka ltar yang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni / rnam pa gsum ka ltar yang sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: In all cases,üîΩwhether it is a cognition that establishes or a doubt that establishes,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i the tshom ldog par byed pa yin du chug na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i the tshom ldog par byed pa yin du chug na /
translated: it is possible that the cognition or doubt is eliminated.

original: rang gi dus nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi dus nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be at the very time of itself.

original: de'i phyir don bya bar snang ba'i dus de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir don bya bar snang ba'i dus de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: Therefore, at the very time that the object appears as something to be done,

original: the tshom de med mod /
analyzed: the tshom de med mod /
translated: that doubt does not exist.

original: 'jug par 'dod pa'i dus gzhan du go ji ltar min te /
analyzed: 'jug par 'dod pa'i dus gzhan du go ji ltar min te /
translated: But how is it that it is not understood at another time, when one wishes to engage?

original: me ni gzhan gyi tshe yod la /
analyzed: me ni gzhan gyi tshe yod la /
translated: The meaning is that fire exists at one time,

original: grang ba gzhan gyi tshe ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grang ba gzhan gyi tshe ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but cold is not eliminated at another time.

original: da ni zhar la the tshom ldog pa dogs pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni zhar la the tshom ldog pa dogs pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show that there is also no doubt about the elimination of doubt, he says,

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere,

original: sgrub byed kyi shes pa la'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed kyi shes pa la'o //
translated: with regard to the cognition that establishes.‚Äù

original: tshad ma de la the tshom za ba de bzlog pas so //
analyzed: tshad ma de la the tshom za ba de bzlog pas so //
translated: because it is the refutation of doubt about that valid cognition.

original: de yang grub pa yin @280b zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i sgo nas de ma thag nyid du'o //
analyzed: de yang grub pa yin @280b zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i sgo nas de ma thag nyid du'o //
translated: And that is established, in the sense of ascertained, immediately.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the second conception is

original: shes pa kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa kun gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúof all cognitions.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig gi don dang 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi don dang 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection with the meaning of someüîΩis seen by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsams pa yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di bsams pa yin na /
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: de rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: mngon sum ni sbyor byed kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni sbyor byed kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because perception is not the nature of a connector.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi don dang 'brel pa gang zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba de nyid rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi don dang 'brel pa gang zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba de nyid rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If you think that the connection with the meaning of perception, which is seen by perception, is not understood by inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa'am zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'am zhes gsungs so //
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúInference also . . .‚Äù

original: spyi'i ste dpe dang thun mong gi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ste dpe dang thun mong gi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: The universal, that is, the nature that is common to the example and the inferential subject.

original: des na mngon sum gyis ni ma mthong ba'i 'brel pa rjes su dpag gis mi rtogs /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis ni ma mthong ba'i 'brel pa rjes su dpag gis mi rtogs /
translated: Therefore, the connection that is not seen by perception is not understood by inference.

original: sngar ni mngon sum nyid med phyir //
analyzed: sngar ni mngon sum nyid med phyir //
translated: Previously, because of the absence of direct perception,

original: rjes dpag ci ltar tshad ma yin //
analyzed: rjes dpag ci ltar tshad ma yin //
translated: how can inference be a valid cognition?

original: des na rjes su dpag pas kyang //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pas kyang //
translated: Therefore, even though there is inference,

original: don bya ba dang 'brel par ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don bya ba dang 'brel par ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it does not understand the connection with the object to be done,

original: the tshom zlog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom zlog pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not stop doubt.

original: 'o na ni gzhan gyis bzlog go snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzhan gyis bzlog go snyam na /
translated: If you think it is stopped by another,

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAnother,‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'o //
translated: which is different from direct perception and inference.

original: chad pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis mang po'i tshig gam /
analyzed: chad pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis mang po'i tshig gam /
translated: ‚Äú Cutting off‚Äù means by the meaning of many words,

original: lnga pa ste the tshom chad pa las snga ma tshad ma yin par ga la 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ste the tshom chad pa las snga ma tshad ma yin par ga la 'gyur snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: or the fifth, from the cutting off of doubt, how can the former be a valid cognition?

original: ci ste me mdag du ba med pa mthong ba la yang 'ol ma ser the tshom za ba na /
analyzed: ci ste me mdag du ba med pa mthong ba la yang 'ol ma ser the tshom za ba na /
translated: If doubt arises even when seeing smokeless embers,

original: lo ma la sogs pa lhung bas thub mthong ba the tshom ldog pa na snga ma tshad mar rtogs pa mthong ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa lhung bas thub mthong ba the tshom ldog pa na snga ma tshad mar rtogs pa mthong ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: and when doubt is stopped by seeing the sage falling leaves, etc., then the former is seen to be a valid cognition.

original: ma yin te der rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma mthong ba'i bya ba la the som gyis zin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te der rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma mthong ba'i bya ba la the som gyis zin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: No, because inference itself is valid cognition in that context, and the activity of seeing the prior is not embraced by doubt.

original: de ltar tha snyad du 'am don dam pa las kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar tha snyad du 'am don dam pa las kyang rung ste /
translated: Thus, whether conventionally or ultimately,

original: chos mchog gi phyogs mi rigs par bstan nas sngar bshad pa nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
analyzed: chos mchog gi phyogs mi rigs par bstan nas sngar bshad pa nyid mjug sdud pa ni /
translated: having taught that the position of the supreme dharma is untenable, he concludes what was previously explained.

original: des na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tha snyad kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tha snyad kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: that it is posited by the conventions as they have been explained,

original: de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not in reality. This is the meaning.

original: gal te de kho nar tshad ma 'gog pa'i @281a * //
analyzed: gal te de kho nar tshad ma 'gog pa'i @281a * //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe reasoning that proves the refutation of valid cognition

original: sgrub pa'i rigs pa nyid tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rigs pa nyid tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: in reality is itself valid cognition or not valid cognition,‚Äù

original: bden te tshad ma ni yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bden te tshad ma ni yin mod kyi /
translated: it is true that it is valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad pa yin no /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad pa yin no /
translated: However, it is conventional.

original: 'o na tha snyad pas gnod do zhes bya ba'i don 'di ji ltar 'grig ce na bden te /
analyzed: 'o na tha snyad pas gnod do zhes bya ba'i don 'di ji ltar 'grig ce na bden te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIn that case, how is the meaning of ‚Äòit is undermined by the conventional‚Äô coherent?‚Äù It is true.

original: 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba khas blangs pa'i brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept the contradiction, and you want to say something.

original: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i phyir don ni phan tshun gnod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i phyir don ni phan tshun gnod pa nyid yin te /
translated: In this way, because of the contradiction, the objects mutually contradict each other.

original: gzhan du ha cang thal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du ha cang thal ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: don bya ba dang 'brel pa las tshad mar khas blangs pa des don dang 'brel pa ma nges kyang tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal lo //
analyzed: don bya ba dang 'brel pa las tshad mar khas blangs pa des don dang 'brel pa ma nges kyang tshad mar khas blangs pa'i phyir 'gal lo //
translated: Because of the relation to the object, you accept it as valid knowledge. Therefore, because of the relation to the object, you accept it as valid knowledge, even though the relation is not ascertained. Thus, there is a contradiction.

original: 'brel pa nges pa ni tha snyad de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa nges pa ni tha snyad de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the ascertainment of the relation is the cause of the convention,

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du gsal te /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du gsal te /
translated: the non-observation of the cause is clearly stated.

original: 'on kyang des khas blangs pa nyid du zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang des khas blangs pa nyid du zad do //
translated: However, that is all that is accepted.

original: des na phan tshun gnod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i tshad ma ngang 'gog par byed pa la tshad ma'i tha snyad du zhen pas ni ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: des na phan tshun gnod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba'i tshad ma ngang 'gog par byed pa la tshad ma'i tha snyad du zhen pas ni ci yang byar med do //
translated: Therefore, because of the mutual contradiction, when the object of negation is refuted by valid knowledge, there is nothing to be done by clinging to the convention of valid knowledge.

original: 'di yang thob par bya ba gzhan la ltos nas skyon du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang thob par bya ba gzhan la ltos nas skyon du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: This is also a fault in dependence on another object to be attained.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa la ni /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa la ni /
translated: Because it does not depend on another, it is the mere awareness of its own nature.üîΩBy the mere realization of that, the purpose is accomplished.

original: de tsam rtogs pa nyid kyis don byas pa'i mngon sum gyis tshad ma dang gzhal bya mtha' dag sel bar nus so //
analyzed: de tsam rtogs pa nyid kyis don byas pa'i mngon sum gyis tshad ma dang gzhal bya mtha' dag sel bar nus so //
translated: Direct perception is able to eliminate all valid cognitions and objects of comprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩrang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs //
translated: For that very reason,

original: zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: it is also said, ‚ÄúIt realizes its own nature from itself.‚Äù

original: 'o na dang po ni mi bzod pa'i tshig phrad yin la /
analyzed: 'o na dang po ni mi bzod pa'i tshig phrad yin la /
translated: Now, the first is a verbal prefix meaning ‚Äúnot enduring.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The second means ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad mar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tshad mar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúas a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: bshad zin pa'i don sdud pa ni /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i don sdud pa ni /
translated: The summary of the previously explained meaning is

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la yid ches pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang cig shos la phyin ci log pa ston te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la yid ches pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang cig shos la phyin ci log pa ston te /
translated: Because there is no confidence in the definition of valid cognition, it shows the error of valid cognition and its opposite.

original: mngon sum la sogs tshad ma yis //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs tshad ma yis //
translated: Valid cognitions such as direct perception

original: 'jig rten pha rol rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol rtogs ma yin //
translated: do not realize a world beyond.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas yin no zhes bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: However, it is said that it is in dependence on the omniscience itself.

original: rig byed la sogs pa'i lung las zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa'i lung las zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is that it is from the scriptures of the Vedas and so on.

original: tha snyad las tshad mar nges na ni rnam pa 'di tsam gyi skabs med de /
analyzed: tha snyad las tshad mar nges na ni rnam pa 'di tsam gyi skabs med de /
translated: If it were ascertained as valid cognition in terms of conventional usage, there would be no occasion for this kind of analysis.

original: don dam pa'i 'dod pa cig kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i 'dod pa cig kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be only an ultimate assertion.

original: @281b des na tha snyad las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: @281b des na tha snyad las ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is that it is not from conventional usage.

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad pa rnams log par rtogs pa des na bstan bcos la ma ltos pa'i tha snyad tsam gyis tshad mar rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad pa rnams log par rtogs pa des na bstan bcos la ma ltos pa'i tha snyad tsam gyis tshad mar rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: Since conventional usage is a mistaken understanding, it is not realized as valid cognition merely through conventional usage that does not rely on treatises.

original: gang ges bstan bcos don med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang ges bstan bcos don med par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would the treatise be pointless?

original: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi khyad par las yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad kyi khyad par las yin la /
translated: However, it is from a particular conventional usage.

original: de yang sngar brjod zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang sngar brjod zin pa nyid do //
translated: And that has already been stated before.

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad tsam tshad ma'i bsgrub bya ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang tha snyad kyi khyad par las yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad tsam tshad ma'i bsgrub bya ma yin gyi / 'on kyang tha snyad kyi khyad par las yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because mere conventional usage is not what is to be established by valid cognition,üîΩbut rather it is from a particular conventional usage,

original: tha snyad nges par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad nges par rtogs pa ste /
translated: therefore it is the ascertainment of conventional usage.

original: snga phyir mi 'gal bar nges par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga phyir mi 'gal bar nges par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is ascertained that there is no contradiction between the former and latter,

original: mtshan nyid ci lta ba bzhin gyi bstan bcos blo dman pas rtogs par byed pas rmongs pa zlog byed yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ci lta ba bzhin gyi bstan bcos blo dman pas rtogs par byed pas rmongs pa zlog byed yin no //
translated: the treatise is a remover of confusion because it causes those of lesser intelligence to understand the characteristics as they are.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / snga ma phyi ma mi dran pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / snga ma phyi ma mi dran pa //
translated: The former and latter are not remembered.
